story:
The truth is, we can make a difference!

It is the unfortunate truth that almost everyone has been touched by cancer in some way. No matter the race, religion, gender, age or social class - cancer does not discriminate and for every person who fights the disease, there is a network of friends and loved ones who battle it with them. Often words are not enough to express what it truly means to experience cancer.

My son Ryder died just before his 6th birthday and I knew right then it would change my life forever and be the hardest thing I would ever have to endure. 

Losing a loved one is not something you get over or heal from. It is with you for the rest of your life. What you have to do is figure out how to deal with the knowledge that you have, and what to do with it.

Knowing the past and what we want for the future, 

gives us our mission!

While some mornings were hard to put one foot in front of the other, a fire was lit under me. A passion was born and set me off on a new path.

I set off on a mission to help raise as much money as I possibly can for BC Cancer Foundation benefitting BC Cancer Agency for cancer research, so that with the money we raise we can keep the scientists in the labs working toward the discoveries that will lead to a cure for this terrible disease. 

So that children like Ryder do not have to suffer as a result of this disease and dads like me and families like mine don't have to go through such heartbreaking journeys.

So how do we do that?  
Well, I created 
cancer TAPS OUT!

cancer TAPS OUT! is a one-day submission-grappling tournament with the proceeds going to the BC Cancer Agency so they can continue towards their goal of a world free from cancer and to make sure cancer TAPS OUT! once and for all. 

cancer TAPS OUT! is issuing a challenge to grapplers of all levels to join us for a full day of round-robin no gi jiu-jitsu tournament.

Roll and submit your opponent for a great cause. Before you can be named champion, each competitor will have to raise their entry fee of $300, through our easy and simple to use fundraising site. For every $300 dollars raised, each participant will receive an entry for a chance to win the grand prize.

WHY?

Well I love to follow my passion and I believe with this event we can raise over $100,000+ for cancer research and the impact from that would be amazing. Literally the money we raise today could be saving lives tomorrow. I also believe within 4 years this could be the single largest tournament of its kind in north America raising over half a million dollars.

Why Me?

I'm passionate, I believe in this cause with every fibre of my soul. I'm a dad and I know I can do this with your help.

I also have a proven track record of raising money through my Ride to Conquer Cancer team www.ridersforryders.com it's my passion and my life’s mission and I just know this event will be amazing and the 1st of its kind in Canada and I'm just getting started.

Help me make history and raise thousands while doing it.

Here's why we need $23,800 which will turn into $100,000+

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financially and I completely understand that, but that doesn't mean you can’t help:

  • Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Tell everyone you know
  • If you know someone who might be interested in being the presenting sponsor please pass along this link.

     Thank you all for your time!

Use the Indiegogo share tools
Tell everyone you know
If you know someone who might be interested in being the presenting sponsor please pass along this link.


     Thank you all for your time!

story:
About Us

We are three fiber artists who are creating a space for classes, clubs, and activities that develop skills, cultivate a love of fiber arts, and foster friendships and community.  Between us, we have over 20 years of collective teaching of the fiber arts in the Santa Cruz community and beyond.  Knit Sew Make will give us a space to share our collective wisdom and foster a vibrant fiber arts community.

Sara Homan (left) has been teaching private sewing lessons for children and adults since 2007 and taught for Santa Cruz Adult School from 2012 - 2017. She is also trained in sewing machine repair.  She comes from a long line of seamstresses, knitters, and crafty women. What she loves best about teaching is helping people understand how sewing machines work and how to troubleshoot and prevent problems. She also really enjoy teaching kids skills, giving them raw material and seeing what they do with it. She finds it delightful to see their creative ideas. Her personal sewing projects are mostly garments, though she also has experience with quilting and home dec. 

Heddi Craft (center) is a knitwear designer, lifelong fiber artist, and teacher.  She learned to crochet when she was six years old, and went on to sew clothes and quilts, create costumes, cross stitch, and dabble in a variety of other crafts.  She has a Master’s degree in Education and a certificate in teaching adult learners. She's been knitting for over a decade and began teaching knitting two years ago. She loves working with students of all ages and skill levels and is confident in variety of styles and methods of knitting.  Her goal is to help students find the way to knit that works the best for them and help them to accomplish their creative goals.

Sara Jessen (right) has been Knitting for 15+ years. Her Auntie introduced her to the fiber arts world when she was 3 and she was hooked! Sara loves teaching and sharing her passion with all. She loves to help knitters challenge themselves in new ways whether it’s the daunting task of a well fitted sweater, those scary cables, or learning brioche. Sara has been teaching both kids and adults since 2011.

 

Our Vision

Imagine a cozy, well lit space where groups meet to knit, sew, crochet, spin, weave, and create.  A group of kids meet one afternoon to make small toys from knitted squares.  That evening, the tables are rearranged to accommodate a sewing class where students are making their first garments.  The next morning a knitting circle meets over coffee and tea and a crochet class assembles that afternoon.  On a weekend, a local dyer brings a trunk show of yarns and fibers and a special guest teach has a class on drop spindle weaving.

We see Knit Sew Make doing all this and more!  Join us in creating this amazing community!

 

What We Need & What You Get

To make this vision a reality, we need your help!  We have found a wonderful ground floor space on the Westside of Santa Cruz in the former Garfield Park Community Church.  It’s steps away from the parking lot, well lit, and easily accessible.  However, the room needs a new coat of paint, an updated light fixture, and some comfortable furniture.  We also need your support in covering some of our start up costs including insurance and a security deposit.  

Your contribution, large or small, will help bring our vision closer to reality, and we’ve created some great perks to thank you for your support.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are doing everything in our power to make sure as many people as possible see this campaign that would care about it or support it. But our power pales in comparison to the thousands of people in our community that can spread the word. Let your fiber arts friends know about this developing community using the Indigogo share tools just above the perks listing!

 

Class Schedule Sneak Peek

We are already scheduling classes, get a sneak peak of what's coming up!

story:
Pay With Bitcoin



*Just click on the link, enter in your information and on the next page choose your membership  QR card


We of course prefer bitcoin donations, however, we gladly offer both. For this campaign is aimed at helping the general public that are NOT YET familiar with crypto currencies, become more comfortable. 



AMERICAN BITCOIN™ Community QR Bitcoin Deposit Membership Card


Have you been hearing or reading a lot about this thing called BITCOIN? Do you want to know more, but have no idea where to start. Are you aware that bitcoin is NOT the only crypto currency available?? Bitcoin has become too expensive for a lot to get really involved, but bitcoin is only the technology. Its not necessarily the final solution!

Learn how to do all things BITCOIN, specific to your experience level. Beginners will be walked thru the easiest and safest ways to execute bitcoin transactions. The more money raised, the more fun bitcoin features and activities we can add. This campaign is not designed to help anyone but the American Bitcoin Community.


Learn the best ways to SAFELY and SECURELY:

-Open a personal wallet, or simply open a bitcoin account with a trusted American based bitcoin company.

-Save and PROTECT your bitcoins

-Buy bitcoins

-Sell bitcoins

-Spend bitcoins

-Send bitcoins

-Receive bitcoins

-Invest with bitcoins

-Gamble with bitcoins

-Trade bitcoins for alternative coins and visa versa  e.g. litecoins, worldcoin, PPcoin etc

And much more...



We are The American Bitcoin Community/Association, and we are building the ultimate playground for American crypto currency enthusiasts. Help us finance the rest of this project to bring more attention and entertainment to the crypto currency world. The ABC allows anyone to chat, post on forums, form city to city bitcoin meet-up groups, earn bitcoin, and much more. Help us make bitcoin what it should be, a mainstream, worldwide, unregulated, currency.



   

 Let me start by saying, this product is for anyone who networks or is constantly trading personal contact information with others. A QR code can be embedded with almost anything, from web links, personal contact information, Facebook friend resquest and likes. The possibilities are endless. The bitcoin community is available if you want to know more about bitcoin. Its just a huge perk to help get more people familiar with a global phenomenon that has been compared by many to the original concept of the "internet". This card works as a contact card as well as a QR bitcoin deposit/cold storage wallet card.


Websites for personal QR Code Generation: 

http://www.qrstuff.com/

http://www.the-qrcode-generator.com/

http://qrcode.kaywa.com/



Secondly, welcome to the world of bitcoin! We are a very knowledgeable group of American bitcoin fanatics, and we want to help the American people become more comfortable and familiar using crypto currencies on a day to day bases.


The ultimate goal of launching this bitcoin community, is to make an informational, fun, and all-in-one interactive bitcoin website. We want to offer bitcoin newcomers and enthusiast alike, a trusted community they can call Home. If you need to do anything regarding exchanging or trading crypto currencies we ask that you start with us to find out the safest way of executing bitcoin transactions.

This is the very beginning, and bitcoin is only going to become more popular. This is not a local currency that can be manipulated. It is worldwide, across the entire globe and its just catching on. Therefore, we want to help YOU, and that's also one of the great things about bitcoin. Most of the bitcoin community wants to help you too. Because as bitcoins become more widely used, their value rises as everyone has seen. The ONLY drawback is SECURITY, and thats where the community helps tries to help EVERYONE. We have heard from too many people, and have read too many news articles regarding people getting their bitcoins stolen. This is what we want to rid of bitcoin. Therefore, we have created the American Bitcoin QR Deposit Membership Card.  With the purchase of this card you will have a 1 year membership into the most trusted bitcoin community in the world. Helpful, trusted American bitcoin moderators will personally oversee all daily dealings and member interactions. All member to member transactions can be expedited thru the American Bitcoin Escrow Service. The American Bitcoin wallet card can be used for high security cold storage, an alternative wallet for backup, as well as a personal contact QR card.

Some of the features we will be offering are a live chat with very helpful moderators. As well as bitcoin faucet pages that give members free bitcoin just for entering in their bitcoin wallet address. Also, we are in the process of adding the ABBBB, short for the American Bitcoin Better Business Bureau. We encourage bitcoin savvy members to give credible first hand accounts of prior business dealings whether good or bad. There will be a "Business Complaint" file option for members. Other features that will be available at The ABC are a Forum, Classified Ads, and extensive bitcoin information and resources.

 

All American Bitcoin Association membership cards will have the members name, member #, and optional phone #. In addition to, members can personalize 2 possibly 3 QR codes, 1 on the front and 1 or 2 on the back. You may not know that QR codes can be coded to almost anything, including facebook likes, friend requests; and automatic twitter follow. Never fumble entering names and numbers manually into your phone again. All you have to do is scan your American Bitcoin QR card and youre instantly connected. At that point all of the bitcoin perks are just a bonus, and very good ones. 


One of the big perks is the bitcoin faucet sites. For those of you who dont know what a bitcoin faucet is, it basically drips small amount of bitcoin to someone who types in their bitcoin address. However, these will be lottery style faucets. Therefore, giving members a chance to win A LOT more than the normal faucet payout of a few satoshis. Faucets are normally funded by selling advertisement space to bitcoin companies. Ideally, we will do the same. However, we will only promote 100% trusted bitcoin companies. We also operate a site that lets people/businesses list items or services for sale for bitcoins world wide. That site is bittakers.com, and we just launched so the listings are limited but feel free to sign up. Furthermore, The ABC founded bitpledge.com for non-profits/charities/people in need that want to accept bitcoins as donations. This makes it easy for members to donate the faucet money they earn directly to a charity of their choice.


As of now, The ABC is directing its attention to three things. Firstly: education, as a means of awakening the public as to the importance of crypto-currencies. For their lives, their prosperity, and the future their children will inherit.

Secondly: Getting the public more comfortable executing bitcoin transactions, the safest ways to store bitcoins, and who can be trusted with YOUR bitcoin.

Third: How to safely invest bitcoins, and gain a profit using bitcoins.



Perks for members:


-Learn the best ways to store bitcoin, and keep it safe and secure. THE MOST IMPORTANT PART OF BITCOIN

-Very cool, useful, and personal trademarked American Bitcoin QR wallet Card. This QR card is for anyone even if you dont want to get involved in bitcoin. It can be personalized anyway and makes a great gift for the kids. 

-Extensive information on the SAFEST sites to open a bitcoin wallet, buy/sell bitcoins, shop, and invest

-AmericanBit bitcoin mining contracts available for Black Card members

-Very low escrow service fees-free for black card members

(escrow- peace of mind member to member bitcoin transactions. The bitcoin is sent to a secure ABC controlled account/wallet, and it is held there till the seller gets the funds owed. Once funds are sent and no chargebacks are possible, bitcoin is released to buyer. We offer $500 USD insurance policy per transaction)

-Exclusive high paying bitcoin faucets for members only

-A trusted Q and A Forum and live chat with personal member profiles

-Bitcoin advice and support 24/7

-Weekly raffles, prize giveaways, and fun games

 -Bi-weekly newsletter with useful tips and weekly investment information (optional)

-A trusted community where members look out for other members

-Exclusive access to bittakers.com for free personal business advertising

-Exclusive access to the American Bitcoin Better Business Bureau for information and first hand reviews of current bitcoin businesses.

If you have accounts at bitcoin chats and forums I would greatly appreciate you spreading the word so we can grow the American Bitcoin Community into a strong legion where trust and security is king. Thank you and and have a lucky day!


The Community will launch January 2014!! and prizes for members will be announced. 




*The AmBit QR Bitcoin Deposit Membership Card pictured is not the final product. It is a close rendering of the card members will receive. Members are responsible for providing a name and TWO QR codes.
story_txt:
Pay With Bitcoin*Just click on the link, enter in your information and on the next page choose your membership  QR cardWe of course prefer bitcoin donations, however, we gladly offer both. For this campaign is aimed at helping the general public that are NOT YET familiar with crypto currencies, become more comfortable. AMERICAN BITCOIN™ Community QR Bitcoin Deposit Membership Card
Have you been hearing or reading a lot about this thing called BITCOIN? Do you want to know more, but have no idea where to start. Are you aware that bitcoin is NOT the only crypto currency available?? Bitcoin has become too expensive for a lot to get really involved, but bitcoin is only the technology. Its not necessarily the final solution!
Learn how to do all things BITCOIN, specific to your experience level. Beginners will be walked thru the easiest and safest ways to execute bitcoin transactions. The more money raised, the more fun bitcoin features and activities we can add. This campaign is not designed to help anyone but the American Bitcoin Community.

Learn the best ways to SAFELY and SECURELY:
-Open a personal wallet, or simply open a bitcoin account with a trusted American based bitcoin company.

-Buy bitcoins

-Spend bitcoins

story:
Short Summary

Eleven students from a small school in rural Appalachia want to become lawyers. By creating our school's first ever mock trial team, we are hoping to get our students one step closer to achieving their dreams. Through our high school's mock trial program, these 11 students have the chance to become lawyers and witnesses and argue a case in an actual courtroom. Our students have been working week nights and weekends for the past three months to prepare for the Kentucky High School Mock Trial State Tournament, but we can't get these bright, hard-working students into the courtroom if we don't raise the money to get them there. 

Our students come from an area where more than 80% of families are considered low income. Most of our students have never experienced the things that most high school students take for granted, such as being able to leave the county, having a multitude of organizations to join and having the ability to fund-raise quickly and easily in the community. Instead our students are worried about not having notebooks to take to class or finding $5 to go see a movie with friends on the weekend. Raising $1,500 to compete in a mock trial tournament is something our students would never experience without your help.  

What We Need

To cover the basic costs of the competition we will need: 

Transportation: $700

Hotel: $500

Food: $200

Case Materials: $100

TOTAL: $1,500

Impact

Many of our students have never left the counties they have grown up in. Many of them will not leave the area if they decide to go to college. Having the experience of leaving the county to participate in a mock trial tournament gives them the experience many other high school students take for granted and helps to open more opportunities for them to attend prestigious universities. 

Attending the mock trial competition will help our students gain the experience needed to get into a law school program of their choice, which gets them one step closer to their law degree. Achieving their goal allows them to come back to the impoverished community they grew up in, open local businesses, and use the law to create a stronger community for the local families that they love and care for.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our students appreciate your donation. Please help our students reach their goal by sharing our students' story with those who can also contribute to our cause.

story:
The Riverview High School Thespian troupe has the opportunity to go to the State competition in March, but they need some help getting there.  Even a small donation will help.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  • Money for the charter buses (we can't walk that far!)
  • Money for hotel rooms (the hotel won't let us sleep in the lobby, we've asked)
  • Money for our competition registration fees (good looks didn't work, we tried)

What you get:

  • The warm fuzzy feeling of helping some kids who worked really hard all year get to State...and if that's not enough...
  • Our undying gratitute...and if that's not enough...
  • A handwritten thank you note from the whole troupe!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help but don't wish to make a contribution online, you may mail your checks to:

Riverview High School Thespians

c/o Ms. Swihart

One Ram Way

Sarasota, FL  34231

Even if you aren't able to help us, please share this campaign with others!

  • Facebook
  • Tumblr
  • Twitter
  • Email
  • Any place else you can think of!

Thank you from RHS Thespian Society Troupe #829!

story:
Short Summary

Some friends and I decided to pay off outstanding school lunch fees of local students on free and reduced lunches. In the area where we live, some schools have as many as 95% of children on free and reduced lunches. When paying for that we learned about a program for all-day kindergarten students at Morgan. 

They get a snack of milk each afternoon, and those on free and reduced lunch are not eligible for help because they're already getting breakfast and lunch. "It's a struggle for some of the parents" according to our contact in the school system, to come up with the 50 cents a day for the milk snack. 

Morgan is one of the more affluent schools locally, and have 46% of their students on free and reduced lunches. This is 35 children who are affected. We paid for the ones on free lunch for the month of May, and want to raise enough to pay for all the kids on free and reduced lunches for the rest of the school year. 

What We Need & What You Get

Funds will be paid directly to the district nutrition office, so the children's accounts will show as "paid." If we raise more than the amount needed to pay for the milk snacks and indiegogo fees, we will just do it again in the fall. I'm not offering the typical perks. I can think of nothing to offer you that compares to the knowledge that you are feeding hungry children in a direct way. 

The Impact

The children get their milk snack in the afternoon because they can eat lunch as early as 11 a.m. so they're hungry before the end of the day. They also want to send the kids home with something in their tummies. Poverty is a serious issue in this area.

I post copies of all checks/receipts online so people can see where the money went.
Thanks for your help and for sharing this with your friends.

story:
What I am trying to do

Hi I am Ion Yamazaki. I'm an artist in Atlanta Georgia and also I'm a second year MFA Sculpture student at Georgia State University. This summer I am planning to attend a summer program called SOMA Summer which will take place in Mexico City from June 30th to August 22nd.

Here are some descriptions about SOMA and its summer program:

  • SOMA was founded in Mexico City in November 2009 at the initiative of a group of artists who had joined forces, resulting in a unique platform in the cultural field.

    SOMA’s task is to build a platform to collectively investigate what art can become and how it can work in different contexts. The pedagogical program seeks to create a space for horizontal, collective interaction and critical thinking, taking into account the many different creative communities of Mexico City.

    SOMA’s mission—promoting dialogue and discourse in our society and tracking the professional development of emerging artists—is conceived as four different programs:

  • International Summer Program: SOMA Summer
    During the months of July and August, SOMA offers an international eight-week summer program. Facilitated by artist Carla Herrera-Prats, the program is taught in English, and brings together a great group of artists, curators and art-historians from various latitudes who lead seminars and workshops. Every year SOMA Summer focuses on the examination and development of a specific topic. In an environment of intense work, participants have the opportunity to evaluate their practice through individual and group critiques, and to visit the studios of relevant artists in the international art world.

Since participation/collaboration is one of major focuses on my artistic practice, I am thinking about including some participatory elements for my thesis coming up next year. Thus this summer program by SOMA should greatly develop my knowledge and skills on the realm.

What you can do

But I am short of money constantly and I don't think Ill be able to come up with the whole tuition ($3600), and that's why I'm making this campaign so that I can go to Mexico City with your collective support. So, here is what you can do.

  • You can help me by donating $10 and up, and in exchange, I will send you a postcard with my sincere gratitude and updates from Mexico.

That's it. How simple is that? Since I wanna value your support equally, I don't wanna create different perks. Too idealistic? So be it:) 

The Impact

One of my goals as an artist is to make this world better. Socially engaged art (art dealing with participation/collaboration) operates within community by inserting alternatives and it inevitably has a strong relationship with community development.  So, the more sophisticated I become in this field, better the world will be! (of course, at a microscopic level, but that's how CHANGE happens in the first place, right? )

Thank you for reading this and thanks in advance for your generous support!

Ion Yamazaki


www.ionyamazaki.com

story:
Short Summary

  • I am Mother of two, artist, healer, and Oneness Facilitator, facing many challenges after ending a destructive marriage and possibly fighting to keep custody of my children.
  • Your contribution will literally save me from homelessness and give my children and I a warm, safe, and stable place to live... it will provide us a second chance at life. 
  • No words can adequately express how much your generosity will do for my family... its the difference between life and death.  Thank-you for your Love and for giving us a second chance.


What We Need & What You Get


  • My children and I need $2500 to move into a town home and no longer be without a residence.
  • $645 for the deposit + $645 for the rent + $250 (pet deposit) + $500 to restore electricity + moving expenses and campaign costs.
  • Along with your donations, you can receive unique perks from Kelly that range from individualized healing sessions, hands on energy and body work to a very rare, powerful and sacred oil treatment.  (see details blow).

  • Although we intend to reach the goal of $2500 in donations, if the goals is not reached, these funds will still be utilized to help us re-establish our lives in a healthy, safe, and productive manner.  My children and I are out of other options.

The Impact

    • Your contribution will literally save me from homelessness and give my children and I a warm, safe, and stable place to live... it will provide us a second chance at life.
    • No words can adequately express how much your generosity will do for my family... its the difference between life and death.  Thank-you for your Love and for giving us a second chance.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute, you can still help!

story_txt:
Short Summary
I am Mother of two, artist, healer, and Oneness Facilitator, facing many challenges after ending a destructive marriage and possibly fighting to keep custody of my children.
Your contribution will literally save me from homelessness and give my children and I a warm, safe, and stable place to live... it will provide us a second chance at life. 

No words can adequately express how much your generosity will do for my family... its the difference between life and death.  Thank-you for your Love and for giving us a second chance.



What We Need & What You Get


My children and I need $2500 to move into a town home and no longer be without a residence.
$645 for the deposit + $645 for the rent + $250 (pet deposit) + $500 to restore electricity + moving expenses and campaign costs.

Along with your donations, you can receive unique perks from Kelly that range from individualized healing sessions, hands on energy and body work to a very rare, powerful and sacred oil treatment.  (see details blow).

Although we intend to reach the goal of $2500 in donations, if the goals is not reached, these funds will still be utilized to help us re-establish our lives in a healthy, safe, and productive manner.  My children and I are out of other options.


The Impact

Your contribution will literally save me from homelessness and give my children and I a warm, safe, and stable place to live... it will provide us a second chance at life.
No words can adequately express how much your generosity will do for my family... its the difference between life and death.  Thank-you for your Love and for giving us a second chance.



Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you cannot contribute, you can still help!

Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Even the smallest contributions can help!
Please use the Indiegogo and social networking share tools

story:
Short Summary

I'm a PhD student who studies marine microbes. When most people hear the words "marine biology" they think of sharks and dolphins and all the other really cool stuff in the ocean that we can see.  But in every teaspoonful of seawater there are millions of mysterious and intriguing creatures that escape the naked eye, and they have existed for billions of years longer than any other life on the planet. I study the interactions between these creatures and their environment. It's a lot like getting a peek into an invisible world.

Last year I got an opportunity to sail up the Atlantic from Barbados to Cape Cod on the R/V Atlantis (that's me on the bow of the ship, leaving Bridgetown). I took over 200 samples of seawater, each one containing literally billions of organisms. The only thing that remains now is to process these samples and analyze the data.

I have an offer to go to Argonne National Laboratories in November, to work with some of the researchers of the Earth Microbiome Project. This project's goal is to get as many microbial samples from as many different environments as possible: soils, beaches, desserts, rivers, even the inside of the human body. However, they're short on deep ocean samples like mine. Meanwhile, I need to get access to the equipment that can sequence the DNA of the microbes in my samples, and process all of the data into some usable format. Argonne National Labs has this equipment, and they want to help me complete my project, but I have to cover the cost of my travel and my stay there.

What I Need 

I've been able to arrange to stay with a friend who lives in Chicago. The funds you contribute will cover my airfare and the cost of a rental car for the duration of my stay (about a month). The lab is basically in the middle of nowhere and it's about a 40-minute drive from my friend's place in the city.

EDIT: Since we have passed my original funding goal, any money I receive beyond that goal will go towards sending me to scientific conferences to promote my work and help me find a job after graduating. So please, keep donating!

What You Get

You get the satisfaction of knowing that you contributed to a young woman's education in the sciences, and that you helped further our knowledge of life in the ocean and life at the microscopic level. Also, contributions of a certain amount will earn you some sweet perks:

$1- A simple contribution of $1 gets you an awesome 1.5" diameter sticker with an adorable cartoon dolphin that says "Dolphins Are Overrated." Hey, marine science isn't all about the cute stuff.

$25- A $25 contribution will earn you a postcard from me during my stay in Chicago, thanking you for your help in making this project possible, and letting you know how the project is coming along. Contributing at this level will also get you a sticker.

$50- I have a few samples of seawater taken from the very bottom (about 6,000 m down) by the sampling equipment onboard the ship, from the middle of the Atlantic Ocean. The bottom water is very cold and very clear, and hasn't seen the light of day in hundreds of years. If you donate $50 you will receive your own sample of this water in a very pretty blue glass bottle, sealed tightly and strung up with traditional sailor's knots. Wear it as a necklace or hang it somewhere as a conversation piece. I'll also provide the latitude, longitude, and depth from which the sample was taken. Contributing at this level will also get you a sticker and a postcard.

$100- If you donate $100, I will list you in the acknowledgements on any academic journal article I publish as a result of this project, and send you a copy of the article if you wish. This will take the longest amount of time to receive, but it's well worth the wait to know that you will be forever immortalized in a peer-reviewed academic journal. Contributing at this level will also get you a sticker and a postcard.

The Impact

This project will be a HUGE portion of my dissertation (which will help me get my PhD, get a real job, and become a college professor). But in addition to that, I will be answering questions about the way life functions at the microscopic level in the ocean. All life started in the sea, and all life started as single cells. These organisms represent a wealth of biodiversity, produce 50% of the world’s oxygen, and are an untapped source of biological compounds that have potential uses in the fields of pharmaceutics, cosmetics, nutrition, and bioenergy.  They influence global temperature, and can act as indicators of global climate change.  Microbes are the life’s blood of the ocean, and of our planet. You would be helping me increase our knowledge of these amazing creatures, and contributing to a project that is studying the invisible world of microbes worldwide.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this project to others! If I can get just 100 people to donate $12 (around the cost of a movie ticket) each, I will have reached my goal. If 200 people donate $6 each (less than the cost of a fast food meal), I will reach my goal. Let people know that they are not only helping someone complete their education, but also helping contribute to a growing field in science.

story:
Short Summary

Social Entrepreneurs Network -Africa (SEN-A) is a youth led organization that works to empower the youth through mentorship, coaching and sensitization programs. SEN-A’s vision is to Invest in the future of young people through education, entrepreneurship and creative arts and to create a world where young people benefit from and participate in the development agenda and programmes at the local, national and international levels.

It is another year and SEN-A is undertaking its annual Basic School Development Project under the theme: “bridging the gap through entrepreneurship and creative arts”. The theme will seek to draw attention to the fact that education needs to be holistic and include creative arts and also entrepreneurship,we believe this will help school children begin to unearth their full potential.

The Basic School Education Project, seeks to bring together students from the various tertiary institutions across the country to serve as volunteer tutors in rural communities. The volunteers will assist the pupils with their academic work and also serves as mentors. Approximately, there will be thirty-day classroom work and additional social and personal development classes which will equip the pupils with skills such as bead making and other handicraft activities.

On the part of volunteers, it will provide them with the opportunity to contribute their quota to their community and also to experience the field of education. The Basic School Education Project will also be used as a case study to identify challenges facing education in rural communities that have adverse effect on the development of pupils and to ‘push’ for more attention and support for these schools in the communities. 

Ultimately, we believe this project will contribute to the entire development of these children and expose them to the concept of volunteerism.

PERKs

  • The key to living is GIVING! Share the love by contributing to education in Africa. We believe you will definitely love to give wholeheartedly, but we also want to show our appreciation to what you donate to this cause. Unique pecks have been arranged for you personally, as you have shown your support in bridging the education gap between rural and urban communities. Be proud and let the world know how you feel about Education as a tool for development. Perks which include shipping will be processed a week after the project. We estimate by November it should have reached your doorstep.

  • Donation perks are in the Ghanaian Cedi equivalent to the US Dollars


  • Unfortunately, if we are not able to reach our goal,  the project duration will be reduced given the resources available. Whatever amount that is raised will be divided into three parts, two thirds of the amount will be allocated to purchasing the desktop computers  and educational materials we intend to donate to the school at the end of the project , with one third of the money plus what we have raised internally will go to providing feeding for the volunteers till the project comes to an end. 

The Impact

Most often we perceive development to be about infrastructure and the provision of amenities to make life comfortable. We often forget the the requisite and quality of the human resource is a vital component in the execution of development goals and agenda. As a result, SEN-A has come to realise that education plays a vital role in the development of all persons and the society in which they find themselves.

Ghana is one of the countries that appended her signature to the to achieving Universal Primary Education and the Promotion of Girl Child Education as part of the Millennium Development Goals. As a country we give due recognition to  education as a very vital pivot to our development.

Basic School Development Project seeks to compliment the effort of teachers in the rural areas by organizing vacation classes for the students during the holidays. The extra tuition will give the students a better understanding of some of the lessons learnt in the course of the term and also introduce them to the new lessons for the next academic term thereby bridging the academic gap between them and their colleagues in the urban centres.

SEN-A will bring together a team of volunteer teachers from the tertiary institutions who will take the students through the 4 core subjects: English, Mathematics, Social Studies and Science. They will double task as role models to the students, developing their self-esteem through improved participation in class.

~ A total number of 500 students from the community including its neighboring village will benefit from this project. 

~ Donation to the community school including educational materials & three (3) desktop computers will be added to the empty computer laboratory for the students to have a well structure for Information technology. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you have the will to contribute to make this campaign a success, 

1. Donate - even small donations raise popularity and give us more visibility on the site. Any amount is cherished from $1 to the target amount.

2. Post to Facebook - in the end, the more people hear about us, the more likely we will meet our target.

3. Share to other social platforms that you are connected with, to help create awareness. You can use the share tools on this page.

And that's all there is to it.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Welcome to my campaign!

I'm Andrea Dela Calzada, an incoming fourth year college student taking up Advertising & Public Relations at Assumption College Makati in the Philippines.

Living in a developing country makes you either callous or sensitive to the needs of the poor. I grew up in a home that instilled the importance of doing what is right. I was taught that if you don't like something, change it. Seeing my fellow countrymen's struggle motivated me to at least try and make a difference.

I applied at Rohei, a learning and development consultancy organization based in Singapore that champions the equipping of core skills for adult learners, and was accepted for its internship program. Not many are accepted, and I was one of the very privileged ones to have made it.

I believe the training I will receive at Rohei will help me to better understand limiting mindsets and learn how to challenge those beliefs.

What I Need

I need $2500 to support the expenses I will incur for my one-month internship at Rohei. This will include my roundtrip airfare, lodging, and food. 

Impact

I am determined to bring home the knowledge and skills I will obtain through my internship and apply it to my future work. 

Thank you for your generosity.  May God bless you.

story:
About Our Journey

Each day our students enter our classrooms and “travel” a world away to countries like France, Morocco, Spain, and Mexico. We work tirelessly to provide our students with a global education that brings real-life situations and culture to our classrooms. We are fortunate to enjoy an array of technology to assist us in providing this experience, but videos alone can never take the place of traveling to these countries to genuinely put language learning into practice.

This June, eight high-achieving juniors and seniors from urban areas of Birmingham will have the chance of a lifetime to travel to France and Spain to do exactly that as they embark on a nine-day learning adventure and language challenge. Before departing Birmingham, our students will participate in interactive lessons outside of the normal classroom schedule, in which they will study in great detail the history of these two countries and the cultural landmarks they will visit.

Our trip begins in Paris, from which we will travel to Monaco, Nice, and Collioure, ending our journey in Barcelona. As we visit the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre Museum, the Prince’s Palace in Monaco, and La Sagrada Familia and Las Ramblas in Barcelona, the students will participate in a series of structured activities aimed at putting their classroom preparations to use in real life situations as they interact with Spanish and French locals. They will write online journal entries about their experiences abroad and share their adventures with their classmates and community when they return as true world travelers.

Meet the Students You will Be Impacting

In Their Own Words: Why They Want to go on this Educational Adventure

 

Sha’Warren: I believe this trip will help me in my future goal of being a nurse. As I take care of people from various cultural backgrounds, I will be able to minister to Spanish-speaking patients using a language that brings them comfort. This trip will help me learn more about the language I am studying because I will not be in a country where they speak English. Experiencing all that Barcelona and Paris have to offer will push me to take advanced classes in Spanish and possibly French. This trip will also help me branch out from my home community and help me connect to a country I am not used to. I will learn so much, and it will become a part of my history that everyone will hear about in my future.

Lace: Hi, My name is Lace. I would really love to travel to France and Spain to further my knowledge about the culture, traditions and art in France and Spain. I believe that if I go to these two places I can really grow as a person. Being that I’ve never traveled outside of the United States, I feel very blessed to have this opportunity to travel to two amazing countries. I honestly cannot wait to go and I hope to have a wonderful time and learn a lot!

Ja’Darrius: In life everyone does not have the opportunity to be able to go out and explore this great world, but some people are blessed to receive such a great experience. Being able to travel to Europe is like a dream come true.  I want to travel to France and Spain because it is a great chance to experience a variety of things outside the U.S.: different living habits, atmospheres and people. I would like to travel because this could be my only chance to be able to go out and experience these two great places. Traveling abroad will help me further my studies and career goals in many ways. By being able to travel, I will gain knowledge that will help me later on in life. I am truly grateful for this opportunity that I have been given.

Justin: I want to go to España (Spain) and France to enhance and further my knowledge of languages and other cultures. Not only would I be furthering my Spanish language skills, but learning a new language as well: French. It would be a powerful way to learn the language by being immersed in the country and culture.

 

Ketera: I would love to visit Spain to further my education, and this trip will be a once in a lifetime chance to visit other parts of the world. I want to try their flavorful foods. Going on this trip to Europe will further my knowledge so that I can be a well-rounded person and a wonderful nurse. This trip will open my eyes to a Spanish-speaking country’s way of life.

 

Jazme'ne: The thought of getting to explore other regions of the world and and different cultures fills me with excitement.  The fact that facets of Hispanic and French cultures are embedded within my own here in the United States only intensifies my desire to learn more.  Furthermore, I have come to understand that life’s greatest experiences are nothing without someone to share them with.  This is why I am so eager to participate in this adventure with a group of some of my closest peers and people I have come to love.  Both of these countries have immense beauty and rich cultures, and there is absolutely nothing I would love and appreciate more than to experience firsthand what they have to offer.

Joseph: The trip to France and Spain will not only allow me to further my knowledge of their history and society, but it would also allow me to receive hands-on experiences in a more diverse way.  Going to France and Spain would give me a better understanding and a better appreciation of their cultures. Like me, an average person would not be able to have the opportunity to go out of the country and engage in another culture. This trip will allow me to view the historical monuments, and to experience the intricacies of different cultures. I will see the famous work of Androuet du Cerceau, Salomon de Brosse, Philibert Delorme and Pierre Francois Leonard. By giving me this opportunity I will be getting a chance to be a truly inspired engineer. Lastly, this opportunity will allow me to become a global citizen, and I will be able to share my experiences with others who are unable to travel.

 

Cinnamon: ¡Hola! Mi nombre es Cinammon Callins. I am a high school senior and my current goal is to become an international citizen. Studying abroad is a dream of mine, but because of low finances my dream has been put on hold. I have a chance to go to France and Spain this summer and then I will be transitioning to college. I will take what I learn from this experience and use it as I begin my college experience.

Travel Costs

As of January 4, our goal has changed to the following: 

Travel insurance, airfare, hotel, tour guides, breakfast and dinner for nine days provided by Explorica Educational Travel and Student Tours per student:

 $3380

Passport fee per student:

 $140

Lunch for nine days per student:

 $180

Total cost per student:

 $3700

Total for 8 students:

 $29, 600

 

We are so proud of how hard our students are working to reach their goal of international travel. Nonetheless, without generous donors like yourself this experience will not be possible. Please consider donating today and joining our students’ families and community in investing in this incredible educational opportunity for our students.

With much gratitude,

Rebecca Blumenfeld, Spanish Teacher

Shelley Fordice, French Teacher

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider sharing this site on any social media site you may use and to friends and family via e-mail. If you have any questions about our campaign please contact us.

Being able to travel to Europe is like a dream come true.  I want to travel to France and Spain because it is a great chance to experience a variety of things outside the U.S.: different living habits, atmospheres and people. I would like to travel because this could be my only chance to be able to go out and experience these two great places. Traveling abroad will help me further my studies and career goals in many ways. By being able to travel, I will gain knowledge that will help me later on in life. I am truly grateful for this opportunity that I have been given.
Justin: I want to go to España (Spain) and France to enhance and further my knowledge of languages and other cultures. Not only would I be furthering my Spanish language skills, but learning a new language as well: French. It would be a powerful way to learn the language by being immersed in the country and culture.
 
Ketera: I would love to visit Spain to further my education, and this trip will be a once in a lifetime chance to visit other parts of the world. I want to try their flavorful foods. Going on this trip to Europe will further my knowledge so that I can be a well-rounded person and a wonderful nurse. This trip will open my eyes to a Spanish-speaking country’s way of life.
 
Jazme'ne: The thought of getting to explore other regions of the world and and different cultures fills me with excitement.  The fact that facets of Hispanic and French cultures are embedded within my own here in the United States only intensifies my desire to learn more.  Furthermore, I have come to understand that life’s greatest experiences are nothing without someone to share them with.  This is why I am so eager to participate in this adventure with a group of some of my closest peers and people I have come to love.  Both of these countries have immense beauty and rich cultures, and there is absolutely nothing I would love and appreciate more than to experience firsthand what they have to offer.
Joseph: The trip to France and Spain will not only allow me to further my knowledge of their history and society, but it would also allow me to receive hands-on experiences in a more diverse way.  Going to France and Spain would give me a better understanding and a better appreciation of their cultures. Like me, an average person would not be able to have the opportunity to go out of the country and engage in another culture. This trip will allow me to view the historical monuments, and to experience the intricacies of different cultures. I will see the famous work of Androuet du Cerceau, Salomon de Brosse, Philibert Delorme and Pierre Francois Leonard. By giving me this opportunity I will be getting a chance to be a truly inspired engineer. Lastly, this opportunity will allow me to become a global citizen, and I will be able to share my experiences with others who are unable to travel.
 
Cinnamon: ¡Hola! Mi nombre es Cinammon Callins. I am a high school senior and my current goal is to become an international citizen. Studying abroad is a dream of mine, but because of low finances my dream has been put on hold. I have a chance to go to France and Spain this summer and then I will be transitioning to college. I will take what I learn from this experience and use it as I begin my college experience.
Travel Costs
As of January 4, our goal has changed to the following: 



Travel insurance, airfare, hotel, tour guides, breakfast and dinner for nine days provided by Explorica Educational Travel and Student Tours per student:


 $3380




Passport fee per student:


 $140




Lunch for nine days per student: 


 $180




Total cost per student:


 $3700




Total for 8 students:


 $29, 600


 
We are so proud of how hard our students are working to reach their goal of international travel. Nonetheless, without generous donors like yourself this experience will not be possible. Please consider donating today and joining our students’ families and community in investing in this incredible educational opportunity for our students.
With much gratitude,
Rebecca Blumenfeld, Spanish Teacher
Shelley Fordice, French Teacher
Other Ways You Can Help
Please consider sharing this site on any social media site you may use and to friends and family via e-mail. If you have any questions about our campaign please contact us.

story:
Thanks for taking time to read this. I believe that a little help from a lot of people can make a huge difference in someone’s life.

I am trying to raise funds to save some soldiers from having to foreclose on their homes. There are a lot of soldiers and their families that are in need. We need to take care of the people that protect and sacrifice for our country. These soldiers aren’t covered under the HAPP program.

The funds will be used to:

  • pay missed payments due to hardships i.e. (involuntary separation, death in the family)
  • pay missed payments due to injury or illness associated with deployments
  • pay missed payments due to a PCS where their new pay wouldn’t otherwise cover their home mortgage payments

This is not for profit. I will be updating the page with more information like the families that are chosen and the process that I went through to select them. Just wanted to say thank you to everyone that has donated.

 

If you can’t afford to spare some change; please help me get the word out on FB. Any effort is effort well spent. You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

If you know someone that could and will benefit from this please email: saveahomeforasoldier@gmail.com

 

Links:

http://realtybiznews.com/military-families-real-estate/9872814/

http://www.usatoday.com/news/military/2011-02-04-1Avetforeclosures04_ST_N.htm

story:
On July 16th, 2008, Tara (Olmstead-Kinsella) Dennee got a phone call saying her dad had taken his own life. Her dad, Wayne Olmstead, was only 50 years old at the time of his death. He left behind a wife, a daughter (Tara), a granddaughter, 3 step-children, 9 step-grandchildren and many friends.     Wayne worked for 29 years at Camillus Cutlery. The company closed their doors in 2007 after losing too much business to overseas manufacturers.         Wayne was diagnosed with bipolar disorder in his early 40s. According to mayoclinic, "bipolar disorder - sometimes called manic-depressive disorder - causes mood swings that range from the lows of depression to the highs of mania. When you become depressed, you may feel sad or hopeless and lose interest or pleasure in most activities. When your mood shifts in the other direction, you may feel euphoric and full of energy. Mood shifts may only occur a few times a year, or as often as several times a day. In some cases, bipolar disorder causes symptoms of depression and mania at the same time". With proper medication and counseling, the disorder can usually be kept under control. Wayne was able to live a productive life with the medications and counseling. When Camillus Cutlery closed Wayne lost his health insurance coverage and in turn he lost his medical care.     Wayne scrambled to find employment that would pay the household bills. He worked a few temporary jobs as well as taking on side jobs as he could find them. Eventually he couldn't keep up with all the bills and ended up losing his house, including most of his possessions as they bought a small mobile home to live in. He worked hard to make the mobile home a "home" for himself and his wife. He painted walls, built an enclosed porch, and they landscaped the small yard. Things just didn't seem to make him feel "good" as they once did.     During this time Wayne reached out for help several times. He spent some time in the psychiatric units of area hospitals trying to feel better. He made one serious attempt at taking his life and was given electronic shock therapy. He still just didn't feel "right". After watching everything he worked so hard for his whole life slip away from him, he hit one of his "lows" and wasn't able to pull himself out of it this time. Instead of reaching our for help, he made a decision that changed his family and friends' lives forever. If they only knew this would be the "final" cry out for help, things may have been different.     Tara, his daughter, as well as everybody else, was left with many unanswered questions. Why? Was it really that bad? How could he do this to us? Was there something we could have done differently? Tara researched mental disorders and suicide rates and was shocked at the statistics. She decided to start a nonprofit organization that would bring this horrible reality into the light.

    In April of 2011, Tara began really dealing with her dad's death. She endured complicated grief from her dad's suicide, she also found herself feeling depressed, not motivated, and suffering from many physical feelings of illness. After dealing with this for months, she found herself in a really dark place. After having suicidal thoughts, she checked herself into the local psychiatric unit at the hospital. After spending 11 days there, her visions became even more real. She met SEVERAL people that were there also in her same situation. Every single patient there got the help they needed and were able to leave the unit and live a productive life. Tara was diagnosed with Panic Disorder with Agoraphobia, OCD (Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder), Depression and PTSD (Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder). She is now being treated for all with medication and therapy and calls her progress "successful".

    Tara's mission then became to tell her story, both of her dad's suicide and her ability to get help to prevent her own suicide, and Stand Against Suicide now has a new dimension.

   Stand Against Suicide's main goal is to let the world know that mental disorders are TREATABLE and that suicide doesn't have to be the only option. We do this by providing educational literature to the public, promoting awareness at events, and hosting online support forums.

    Our goals are to open counseling centers, have a hotline that people can call for help, and just be available to share our unique stories with people, hoping to give them some inspiration.

story:
Just as we were getting back on our feet after a fire in our building almost destroyed some of our careers and handicapped our ability to do work six months ago, a burglary took place in late June that kicked us right back down to square one.

The burglars chiseled through the solid core door to access the deadbolt (an estimated 20-30 minute endeavor according to the police), and pounded a screwdriver to pop open the studio door handle lock. Once in, they spent an estimated 2+ hours rummaging through our space, stealing tens of thousands of dollars in computer and camera equipment.

It’s not just the loss of equipment that’s handicapped us but the loss of work. It’s hard enough being an artist in today’s economy, but we were doing it and we were working our tails off, and now some of us are left with nothing. They stole back-up hard drives from every one of us, including one artist’s hi-res portfolio of his last 22 years of work and computers that contained current projects for clients. The even stole some of our identities including credit and debit cards, checkbooks, a U.S. Passport, and tax documents for the last 10 years. Adding insult to injury, they left an insurance card on the door…commercial insurance is something we all wish we could afford.

The arts are always the first to suffer during hard times. Add a fire and a burglary in a period of six months and this is where we, the artists of Studio 307, stand today. We’re putting this fundraiser together in hopes of being able to continue our dream of working in the arts, replacing some of our stolen equipment and rebuilding our studio to make it happen. (list of stolen stuff here)

We are asking for $10,000 because it’s the minimum we need. Chris needs a camera, lenses, and a laptop to shoot animation  of the monkey and rhino puppets for the web video game he is working on; Brad needs to replace his edit suite to continue work on the educational pilot program videos he has been working on for the last 6 months for the Seattle based Educurious. Your contributions will go toward these projects and more. Chris dreams of building up Seattle as a stop motion animation hub that artists from all over flock to to collaborate on projects—but he can’t do that without his camera, lens and equipment.

Please help us with this dream, and share it with everyone you know—especially if you know an artist or someone else who has been burglarized and knows what it is like to start at square one. We truly appreciate every contribution, no matter how small, and cannot begin to express our thanks for the support we’ve already received from so many of you. If we receive over $10,000, it would be amazing, but replacing the most essential tools will help us get back on our feet, and right now that is what we need most. If we do not reach our entire goal, we will replace pieces bit by bit, and keep working day to day in the hopes that it all comes together somehow.

Sincerely,

The artists of Studio 307, including:

Chris Rodgers

www.milkmanmelvin.com

Chris Rodgers is a Stop Motion Animation Artist and Designer. His work history includes Fleet Foxes and Katie Herzig music videos, Target and Miller High Life commercials, a feature film, short films, and web/video game art.  The recession hit and made things tough for him. When the studio got burglarized, it was a truly low blow to the struggling artist, as they stole cameras, a laptop, and even his Passport and social security card.

...

Brad Strain

www.scaredofgenerefilms.com

Born in Melbourne, Australia, Brad Strain moved to Seattle in 2002, where he runs Scared of Genre FIlms an independent production company. He has been involved in projects for Duff Mckagan, ZZ Top, KEXP, Educurious, The George Lucas Educational Foundation and many others. He is also the documentarian behind up and coming musician Reignwolf.

Brad lost entire edit suite, including computer, speakers, external hard drives as well as multiple cameras. This hit hard as he supports wife and 2 daughters through this business. 

…

Duncan Smith
www.duncansmithphotography.com
Duncan Smith is a commercial photographer who loves to shoot food. He is currently working on a photography based cookbook from his travels around Latin America. Most of his equipment was not in the studio at the time of the burglary but his biggest loss was that of two hard drives containing 22 years of portfolio shots.

…

Jeremy B Morris

Jeremy B Morris is a local artist, businessman and entrepreneur. His past projects include The Poken, a small USB social networking device, and a online marketplace for all things Print Gocco.  He is currently pouring all of his energy into his passion project, Free Monkee.  The soon to be released gaming website is a crazy little concoction that mixes bananas, entertainment, puppets, nonsense, real-world prizes, and stop-motion animation all into one sweetly absurd experience.

Paul Maupoux

www.cromagnonpictures.com
Paul Maupoux is part-owner of a Seattle-based independent film company named Cro-Magnon Pictures. His shorts and features encompass a diverse range of styles, from silent comedy to improvised thriller to mockumentary and stop-motion animation. His work has been screened at various festivals, commissioned as a video art installation, and utilized as training and educational tools across the country. He lost a lens in the burglary.

…

Scott Carver

Scott Carver is an engineer at Adobe Systems. He is currently working on After Effects (AE).
…

Ryan Shinn

Ryan Shinn is currently making his living as a musician and artist. He is formerly one of the founding members of the experimental instrumental rock group Hovercraft based out of Seattle. He also used to work for glass artist Dale Chihuly as an installation artist.
…
