story:
Hello my name is Stuart Shaw, principal teacher of The Golden Rose Tai Chi Chuan school and publisher of www.tai-chi-wizard.com.  After practicing Tai Chi continuously for the last 20years and teaching formally for the last 12years I have dedicated myself to one single task...
 
To get as many people like you enjoying the remarkable benefits of Tai Chi Chuan.
 
Benefits like:
  • Relieving stress and tension,
  • Easing the pain and discomfort of arthritis,
  • Relieving back pain,
  • Improving physical fitness,
  • Helping with chronic illnesses,
  • Easing the impacts of aging,
  • Gentle weight loss,
  • Helping the mind body and spirit connection.

Here is the excitingly GOOD NEWS...

After 8-years of research and development I am very excited to break the news with you that I am ready to release a revolutionary new Tai Chi teaching method. This ground-breaking new method makes it possible for you to learn all the Tai Chi postures, poses, and movements virtually as if you were training one-on-one with a live teacher.
 
I will be will be releasing this online Tai Chi course via a 9-part series of eBooks made available from my website, www.tai-chi-wizard.com.  This will be accompanied by a video conferencing eTraining service where, using the eBooks and associated tools, you get one-on-one instruction with me helping you work through the curriculum at your own pace and ability.
 
Which means all the health benefits of Tai Chi are now well and truly in your reach regardless of where you are in the world.
 


BUT there is one hurdle that stands in the way of me delivering this new teaching method to you...

I don't have all the software and hardware to do the job !!

I have tried my best with a cheap camera but the audio/video quality is terrible!  And I can't keep asking for freebies from friends like I did in the intro video ;-)
 
So in order for my online learning course to go ahead I need to buy a new digital camrecorder and the relevant software that can do the job properly.  Like this one:
 
As you can imagine this software and hardware has a pretty large price tag ... and this is where you come in. My goal is to provide a complete Tai Chi practice guide for beginners, seasoned practitioners, and Tai Chi teachers all over the world, and I am asking for your help!
 
 
 
Help me buy the hardware and software I need to produce these 9 Learn Tai Chi eBooks by claiming one of the perks! Share my Indiegogo story with your family, friends, colleagues, and fellow Tai Chi nerds! Facebook, Twitter, blogs, emails, phone calls, and coffee dates – help get the word out!  Ask for a perk as a birthday present! Claim a perk as a gift to a friend and offer them the reward!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Also... Get a Tai Chi Group Together and SAVE $$!

Get friends and family together to claim one of these perks and you can share in the cost.  Here's how it works:
  • You tell you family, friends, colleagues, and fellow Tai Chi nerds about this great offer,
  • As a group you claim one of the perks (make sure it's one which includes video conferencing eTraining) and share the cost,
  • When you book your eTraining time the whole group turns up at the one location where you have internet connection and a webcam and you all get personalized training as a group,
  • This way it makes it also makes it a fun social event and you get to motivate each other to keep practicing Tai Chi and, best of all, you all save money!
 
 
 
In fact it will be a SERIES of 9 eBooks (with another series planned for the near future).  Each eBook in the series will build upon what you have learnt in the previous eBook.  For example:
 

The first eBook, called "Tai Chi 1: Your First Steps", will include:

  • Introduction to Tai Chi Theory
  • Basic Tai Chi stances and postures
  • Tai Chi Song Gong Level 1 ... these 3 simple exercises are amazing in the way they help you relax, develop foundation and core strength, and develop coordination.  These are the key to unlocking all the benefits Tai Chi offers.
  • Tai Chi Form Level 1: Opening the Wings.  This simple and easy to learn sequence of Tai Chi movements will be your first steps in coming to learn this beautiful and graceful artform

The second eBook, called "Tai Chi 2: Finding Your Tail Feathers", will include:

  • Tai Chi Theory 2: Understanding Yin and Yang,
  • Tai Chi Song Gong Level 2 ... learn 3 more of the Tai Chi Song Gong exercises and discover new depths that unlock even greater internal coordination and understanding,
  • Introducing the Learn Tai Chi Online Toolkit™ ... This is where you get to make your Learn Tai Chi Online Toolkit™. This toolkit has revolutionised your opportunity to learn Tai Chi regardless of where you are in the world and regardless of your circumstances.
  • Tai Chi Form Level 2: Grasping the Bird's Tail.  This is where you will learn how to use the Learn Tai Chi Online Toolkit™ in conjuction with the Tai Chi form you learnt in Tai Chi 1.  You get laser-guided instruction on how to get all the Tai Chi alignments and postures perfectly correct.

The third eBook, called "Tai Chi 3: Taking Flight", will include:

  • Tai Chi Theory 3: Ziran, what it means to be "natural",
  • Tai Chi Song Gong Level 3 ... learn 3 more of the Tai Chi Song Gong exercises and begin learning simple variations of the exercises already learned.
  • Tai Chi Form Level 3: The 8 Move Sequence Form.  Using the knowledge gained from previous lessons, and using the Learn Tai Chi Online Toolkit™, you will learn your first "formal" Tai Chi form.
Of course eBooks 4 through 9 will progress in a similar way.
 
Each eBook will have a easy to use chapter format full of clear instructions, photos and diagrams as well as interactive video.
 
Listen to audio clips of a Chinese scholar correctly pronouncing each pose name.  Watch video clips of Stuart Shaw offering alignment instructions for each category of poses (when the device and eBook format allows).  Learn key alignment actions, tips, and safety cues with diagrams and illustrated content.  
 
 
 
Now THIS is very EXCITING !!
 
The most important facet of successful learning and education is FEEDBACK.  You can follow DVD's or watch Youtube videos all you like, but unless you have direct and immediate feedback from the teacher or coach than your progress is severely limited.
 
So how do you and I get to talk on a personal level so I can give you feedback and help you succeed in your Tai Chi practice?

Let me introduce you to www.vcita.com !!

vCita is a simple, yet ingenious web application that makes it easy for you and I to get in touch with each other on a personal basis via web-conferencing.  It really is easy:
  • Via an application on my website, you check my calendar for available times,
  • You book in an eTraining time that work for both of us, then,
  • Using the ebooks and tools that I have provided we fast-track you through the curriculum and you enjoy all the amazing benefits of learning and practicing Tai Chi.
All you need is a computer with a web-camera and an internet connection. That's it!
 
Once I have my full online Tai Chi coaching service up and running I plan to be charging upwards of $80 an hour for this eTraining, but if you grab one of these perks right now you can get personal, one-on-one eTraining for as little as $20 an hour ... that's an awesome saving !!!
 
My personal recommendation is that you claim a perk that includes eTraining, I guarantee you it will help you succeed in your Tai Chi training.
story_txt:
Hello my name is Stuart Shaw, principal teacher of The Golden Rose Tai Chi Chuan school and publisher of www.tai-chi-wizard.com.  After practicing Tai Chi continuously for the last 20years and teaching formally for the last 12years I have dedicated myself to one single task...

 
To get as many people like you enjoying the remarkable benefits of Tai Chi Chuan.
 
Benefits like:


Relieving stress and tension,
Easing the pain and discomfort of arthritis,
Relieving back pain,
Improving physical fitness,
Helping with chronic illnesses,
Easing the impacts of aging,
Gentle weight loss,
Helping the mind body and spirit connection.


Here is the excitingly GOOD NEWS...

After 8-years of research and development I am very excited to break the news with you that I am ready to release a revolutionary new Tai Chi teaching method. This ground-breaking new method makes it possible for you to learn all the Tai Chi postures, poses, and movements virtually as if you were training one-on-one with a live teacher.
 
I will be will be releasing this online Tai Chi course via a 9-part series of eBooks made available from my website, www.tai-chi-wizard.com.  This will be accompanied by a video conferencing eTraining service where, using the eBooks and associated tools, you get one-on-one instruction with me helping you work through the curriculum at your own pace and ability.
 
Which means all the health benefits of Tai Chi are now well and truly in your reach regardless of where you are in the world.
 

BUT there is one hurdle that stands in the way of me delivering this new teaching method to you...
I don't have all the software and hardware to do the job !!
I have tried my best with a cheap camera but the audio/video quality is terrible!  And I can't keep asking for freebies from friends like I did in the intro video ;-)
 
So in order for my online learning course to go ahead I need to buy a new digital camrecorder and the relevant software that can do the job properly.  Like this one:
 

As you can imagine this software and hardware has a pretty large price tag ... and this is where you come in. My goal is to provide a complete Tai Chi practice guide for beginners, seasoned practitioners, and Tai Chi teachers all over the world, and I am asking for your help!
 

 
 
Help me buy the hardware and software I need to produce these 9 Learn Tai Chi eBooks by claiming one of the perks! Share my Indiegogo story with your family, friends, colleagues, and fellow Tai Chi nerds! Facebook, Twitter, blogs, emails, phone calls, and coffee dates – help get the word out!  Ask for a perk as a birthday present! Claim a perk as a gift to a friend and offer them the reward!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Also... Get a Tai Chi Group Together and SAVE $$!
Get friends and family together to claim one of these perks and you can share in the cost.  Here's how it works:

You tell you family, friends, colleagues, and fellow Tai Chi nerds about this great offer,
As a group you claim one of the perks (make sure it's one which includes video conferencing eTraining) and share the cost,
When you book your eTraining time the whole group turns up at the one location where you have internet connection and a webcam and you all get personalized training as a group,
This way it makes it also makes it a fun social event and you get to motivate each other to keep practicing Tai Chi and, best of all, you all save money!

 

 
 
In fact it will be a SERIES of 9 eBooks (with another series planned for the near future).  Each eBook in the series will build upon what you have learnt in the previous eBook.  For example:
 
The first eBook, called "Tai Chi 1: Your First Steps", will include:


Introduction to Tai Chi Theory
Basic Tai Chi stances and postures
Tai Chi Song Gong Level 1 ... these 3 simple exercises are amazing in the way they help you relax, develop foundation and core strength, and develop coordination.  These are the key to unlocking all the benefits Tai Chi offers.
Tai Chi Form Level 1: Opening the Wings.  This simple and easy to learn sequence of Tai Chi movements will be your first steps in coming to learn this beautiful and graceful artform


The second eBook, called "Tai Chi 2: Finding Your Tail Feathers", will include:


Tai Chi Theory 2: Understanding Yin and Yang,
Tai Chi Song Gong Level 2 ... learn 3 more of the Tai Chi Song Gong exercises and discover new depths that unlock even greater internal coordination and understanding,
Introducing the Learn Tai Chi Online Toolkit™ ... This is where you get to make your Learn Tai Chi Online Toolkit™. This toolkit has revolutionised your opportunity to learn Tai Chi regardless of where you are in the world and regardless of your circumstances.
Tai Chi Form Level 2: Grasping the Bird's Tail.  This is where you will learn how to use the Learn Tai Chi Online Toolkit™ in conjuction with the Tai Chi form you learnt in Tai Chi 1.  You get laser-guided instruction on how to get all the Tai Chi alignments and postures perfectly correct.


The third eBook, called "Tai Chi 3: Taking Flight", will include:


Tai Chi Theory 3: Ziran, what it means to be "natural",
Tai Chi Song Gong Level 3 ... learn 3 more of the Tai Chi Song Gong exercises and begin learning simple variations of the exercises already learned.
Tai Chi Form Level 3: The 8 Move Sequence Form.  Using the knowledge gained from previous lessons, and using the Learn Tai Chi Online Toolkit™, you will learn your first "formal" Tai Chi form.

Of course eBooks 4 through 9 will progress in a similar way.
 
Each eBook will have a easy to use chapter format full of clear instructions, photos and diagrams as well as interactive video.
 
Listen to audio clips of a Chinese scholar correctly pronouncing each pose name.  Watch video clips of Stuart Shaw offering alignment instructions for each category of poses (when the device and eBook format allows).  Learn key alignment actions, tips, and safety cues with diagrams and illustrated content.  
 

 
 
Now THIS is very EXCITING !!
 
The most important facet of successful learning and education is FEEDBACK.  You can follow DVD's or watch Youtube videos all you like, but unless you have direct and immediate feedback from the teacher or coach than your progress is severely limited.
 
So how do you and I get to talk on a personal level so I can give you feedback and help you succeed in your Tai Chi practice?
Let me introduce you to www.vcita.com !! 

vCita is a simple, yet ingenious web application that makes it easy for you and I to get in touch with each other on a personal basis via web-conferencing.  It really is easy:


Via an application on my website, you check my calendar for available times,
You book in an eTraining time that work for both of us, then,
Using the ebooks and tools that I have provided we fast-track you through the curriculum and you enjoy all the amazing benefits of learning and practicing Tai Chi.

All you need is a computer with a web-camera and an internet connection. That's it!
 
Once I have my full online Tai Chi coaching service up and running I plan to be charging upwards of $80 an hour for this eTraining, but if you grab one of these perks right now you can get personal, one-on-one eTraining for as little as $20 an hour ... that's an awesome saving !!!
 
My personal recommendation is that you claim a perk that includes eTraining, I guarantee you it will help you succeed in your Tai Chi training.

story:
Haiti H.E.R.O.

Haiti H.E.R.O was founded to house and educate the children who were displaced and orphaned in the 2010 earthquake.  At present the orphans are housed at a transitional facility in Port-au-Prince.  This campaign is to raise $30,000 to build the first of eight domes for Haiti H.E.R.O’s permanent orphanage.  Each of these eight buildings will be 40 ft in diameter (providing a floor area of 1,250 sq ft).   EcoShell Domes are earthquake, hurricane and fire proof, and provide a cool interior.  They can also be built using a local workforce, thereby keeping the money within the local community.  Furthermore, once the domes are completed, the rental of the EcoShell equipment will provide long term funding for Haiti H.E.R.O. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help us raise $30,000 to build the first EcoShell as part of the new H.E.R.O. Residence for Orphans in Maniche.  We are truly grateful for donors such as you that have joined our mission to help the most disenfranchised youth of Haiti.  As a result of your efforts we are able to truly impact the orphans of Haiti in a significant and meaningful way.

When you donate, your name will be added to a plaque inside the EcoShell building, thanking you for impacting the orphans of Haiti in a significant and meaningful way.

H.E.R.O. was established to provide life opportunities for the orphans of Haiti.  H.E.R.O. currently operate a 12-bed residence in Port-au-Prince that serves girls and boys between the ages of 6 and 18.  H.E.R.O.'s mission is to create a pathway for children in Haiti to become healthy, educated, self-reliant and socially conscious citizens.  In order to complete that mission H.E.R.O. offers programming for the children that is varied, efficient, and of high quality.  The children in H.E.R.O.'s care attend a private Haitian operated school and also receive daily tutoring every afternoon.  Additionally they receive weekly English classes, participate in a Saturday chess program, and take monthly field trips to explore all that Haiti has to offer.  It is H.E.R.O.'s goal to offer a well-rounded education that will prepare the children to become successful in both Haiti and the world.

Haiti H.E.R.O is a registered charity and as such, donations are tax deducatble. 

The Impact 

EcoShell construction is a low-cost 21st century technology used to create a dome shaped building that is earthquake, hurricane, fire, and infestation resistant.  The first EcoShell at the H.E.R.O. Residence for Orphans in Maniche will be a circular EcoShell measuring 40ft in diameter and 20ft in height.  This building will serve as the multi-purpose center for the residence, creating a space for indoor soccer and basketball, church services, large group gatherings, and much more!  

The Players

Haiti H.E.R.O. President – Steven Kirby, Ed.D

Dr. Steven Kirby is a career educator and strong advocate for disenfranchised youth. He holds five degrees in the field of education including a Doctorate in Education from Peabody College at Vanderbilt University, an Ed.M. from the Harvard Graduate School of Education, and an M.S.Ed. from the University of Miami. His history as an educator has taken him from the villages of Fiji and Ghana to the inner city of Miami. Dr. Kirby first learned about Haiti and its true needs as a mentor to Haitian youth in the Miami neighborhood of Little Haiti. As a result of his interactions with immigrant Haitian families he felt the need to visit Haiti personally to better understand the country and people. After moving to Haiti permanently in 2009 and experiencing first-hand the tragic 7.0 earthquake of 2010, Dr. Kirby realized the importance and need for a system that would help the orphans and street children of Haiti become educated and productive citizens of society. H.E.R.O. is a result of that realization. Currently, Dr. Kirby lives at the Transition Home for Orphans in Port-au-Prince working on a daily basis to provide housing, education, and rehabilitation for the street children and orphans of Haiti.

Haiti H.E.R.O. Vice President – Michele Deardorff

Michele Deardorff holds a degree in Elementary Education from Northwest Nazarene University. She spent three years teaching 3rd grade in Nampa, Idaho serving ESL students from low-income neighborhoods. She has also been involved with various community organizations that provide care for at-risk children, especially the children of migrant farm workers. Michele moved to Haiti in August 2009 to teach 3rd grade at an international school in Port-au-Prince. What began as an overseas travel opportunity soon became an eye-opening lesson in true poverty. Although Michele had been teaching impoverished students in the US, that was nothing compared to the conditions she observed in Haiti. While there, she saw first-hand the many street children who are on their own because their country lacks systems to support them. Michele has since returned to the US, but continues to travel to Haiti, working with H.E.R.O. to create a place for these children.

CEO Hildebrand Construction - Dan Hildebrand 

Although Dan Hildebrand has a background in many areas of construction, for the last ten years he has focused on Monolithic and EcoShell Dome Construction.  Dan is one of world's top EcoShell experts and will donating his services to this build for Haiti H.E.R.O.  He will travel to Haiti from Los Angeles to manage the build, and teach the local workforce how to construct the first EcoShell, thereby enabling them to continue with the process for future buildings. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about this amazing organization.  

Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Education

I grew up in Nigeria and lost my father at age 12. Up to that time my mother was home to look after me and my 4 siblings. Now she was forced to also provide for the finances. She took a job at a school where she worked her way up to become an assistant teacher.  
My mother's first priority became to give us an education so we would have a way out of poverty. Today we are all university graduates.

Zarlok School

Zarlok nursery and elementary school in Lagos Nigeria is privately owned and financed. Zarlok's main objective is to provide children a good and affordable education.

My two sisters, my mum and I all work hard to have Zarlok offer exactly that, We now employ 11 people and are constantly looking to improve the school and the facilities for the children. 

Happy kids cooling off from the heat. 

Time to study.

 

Why we should give these children a happy ride to school?

  • Regular education is only possible if there is an affordable way to get to school.
  • Education is the best way according to the UNESCO to build peace, eradicate poverty and drive sustainable development.
  • Safety is a major concern to us, Lagos has the worst traffic in the world. Please help us bring the kids to school safely.

Why we need your financial support?

  • We want to provide an affordable way to get the children to school.
  • We want to prevent that the children have to wake up at 5am and come home at 8pm because of the way the public transport works.
  • We want to prevent children to hike or take okada's (motorcycle taxi) to school because of lacking alternatives.
  • We want the teachers and the children to come to school dry, it is rainy season now.

T-Shirt: "Inside Africa"

 

Scarf: Handwoven scarf

Painting: Play Time

Painting: Happy Moment

Painting: Lunch Time

Painting: Hawkers

Poster: Dance

 

Poster: Ocean Burn

 

Poster: Solace

 

Painting: My Dreams

 

Painting: Reflection

 

Painting: I've Waited long enough

Q & A

Q: When do you intend to start shipping?

A: We ship after receipt of the order as all items are on stock. 

Q: How do you send the art work?

A: All art work will be rolled and shipped in a tube for protection. 

Q: What courier are you using?

A: We ship all items with UPS or Swiss Post (within Switzerland and some EU countries). 

Q: How are you helping the kids?

A: We have a driver waiting to be hired by us. As soon as we have enough funds we will aqcuire the bus and start picking up children. 

Q: Can i get the t-shirt in another colour?

A: Sadly no. But you can order T-Shirts from Carry Am Go who supports our campaign. In this case only 10% will be donated to the school.

Q: Can you send the perks to a friend directly? 

A: If this is a gift and you wish to have it wrapped and sent as a gift go ahead and purchase the perk. Send us a separate mail in this regard.

Other ways you can help!

  • Send us your old (working) ipad which we can use in our classroom.
  • Subscribe to our "Orphan in School" program to provide education for orphans. Press here to request information.

We appreciate your help!

If in any case you are not able to help us financially, please pass on this campaign to your friends and family, share via social media or email it to anyone you think might be willing to help or contribute. Lets come together and enable the children to attend school, enable them to take an active role in building the future. 

Following us on Facebook: acquire School 

Visit our website: Zarlok

Art Sponsor: Carry Am Go

Thank you!

Nneka Lokhorst

story:
臺美共創：TASC  IS  A  JOINT  TAIWAN - U.S.  COLLABORATION.

We believe that international collaboration is the key to addressing and resolving the world’s greatest needs. Each TASC conference is planned and led by a joint executive committee composed of American and Taiwanese students. By placing international collaboration at the heart of TASC’s creation, we provide a bold, inspiring environment for delegates to see and experience the power of cross-cultural partnership.

Today, students from East Asia and the United States are interacting at historically unprecedented rates. During the 2011-12 school year, 14,887 American students studied in China, 5,283 studied in Japan, and 2,695 studied in South Korea. Taiwan, however, is missing from this growth narrative. While almost 15,000 Americans studied in China during 2011-12, only 820 Americans studied in Taiwan in the same year. 
The time for TASC is now. Even as we enter the so-called Pacific century, civil interpersonal discourse between Americans and Asians is still greatly lacking.  American perceptions of Asians as the "perpetual foreigner" are the most prolific form of hostile treatment faced by Asians living in America today. Likewise, non-white Americans working and studying in Asia are frequent targets for racism and exoticism. In today's cross-Pacific civil discourse, there remains a clear, fundamental ignorance on both shores of what it truly means to be American, and what it truly means to be Asian.

TASC is the beginning of a new story. We see the current lack of cultural exchange between the U.S. and Taiwan as a valuable opportunity to challenge the current U.S-Asia social narrative. Our identity as a joint U.S-Taiwan collaboration puts us in the perfect position to initiate cross-cultural dialogue that engages and benefits both nations equally.

議題實踐: TASC  TURNS  ABSTRACT IDEAS  INTO  ACTIONABLE  SOLUTIONS.

We believe that actions speak louder than words. Our Roundtable discussion format is designed to help student delegates develop creative solutions for the most important problems affecting the United States and Taiwan today. A 21-day excursion throughout Taiwan provides delegates with the necessary academic, professional, and experiential knowledge needed to formulate well-informed responses to these pressing issues. Each TASC conference culminates in the Final Forum, in which Roundtables present their findings and propose tangible solutions to a panel of local and global ripplemakers eager to invest in the ideas brought forth by TASC delegates.  


TASC is not your ordinary student conference. 
We share hotel rooms. We take public transportation. Sometimes we wear suits, but usually we're in shorts and T-shirts. We travel -- a lot. We're in it to learn and to grow; to challenge ourselves and to challenge each other. We're in it to change lives.
 

Are you up to the TASC?
Sponsor TASC or a TASCer!
All donations will go towards our conference as a whole unless specified. If you would like to sponsor a TASCer, please mention their name in your donation.

  Josh Hu 胡傳義

School: University of Texas at Austin

Major: Business/Accounting

Year: Graduated May 2015

Pitch: As a Taiwanese American born in Texas, I hope to discover my Taiwanese roots this summer and forge lifelong relationships with my fellow delegates during the conference. As I enter into the business world in September, I hope to one day do business and work in Taiwan in the future. Your support is greatly supported, and I'll send you a postcard either from either Taiwan or Texas (your choice)! 


 I Chun "JoJo" Lee 李孟璇

School: Northeastern University Freshman (Rising Sophomore)

Major: Psychology (major) Graphic & Information Design (minor)

Pitch: I believe that knowledge truly is power, and I am currently on a quest to become as perceptive of the world around me as I can. Aid me on this journey and you will be rewarded with a postcard featuring a personal drawing and message by me (along with my eternal gratitude).


Allison Malmsten 麦小鱼

School:University of Minnesota - Twin Cities

Major: Linguistics Minor: Asian-Languages and Literature

Pitch: During my time at TASC I would like to gain a deeper understanding of Taiwanese culture and education. I hope to apply what I learn to my future in making more efficient foreign language acquisition techniques for both countries, and take action on making a good education available for everyone no matter what location or demographic. Donate over $50 and I will personally send you a postcard from Taiwan!


Sean Salansky 蘇忠誠

School: Lawrence University, Junior

Major: Chinese and Linguistics Double Major Japanese Minor

Pitch: I deserve financial help because I am a hard worker and strive to be the best in every thing that I do. I’m going to Taiwan to make a difference and to help myself to make a difference in the world after college as well.


 Jason Cheung 張皓程

School: Case Western Reserve University (rising senior)

Major: Political Science, International Studies /Minors: Japanese, Music

​​Pitch: I do not know what is going to be like during TASC but that's why I am doing it. In TASC, I am meeting strangers who may turn into lifetime good friends, and experiencing new culture that enlarge my site horizon. Isn't it fantastic? Support me and I will send you a postcard about my experience in Taiwan! 


Reece Sisto


School: University of Pennsylvania (rising Sophomore)

Major: Economic History and Gender Studies 

Pitch: I want to grow as a global citizen and embolden my study of gender and sexuality through an international lens. I think TASC's mission and their approach to educating young students is commendable, something I'm lucky to join. Through TASC, I believe I will learn a lot about myself and how to interact with a culture that is beautiful, unique, and totally different from my own.
story_txt:
臺美共創：TASC  IS  A  JOINT  TAIWAN - U.S.  COLLABORATION.
We believe that international collaboration is the key to addressing and resolving the world’s greatest needs. Each TASC conference is planned and led by a joint executive committee composed of American and Taiwanese students. By placing international collaboration at the heart of TASC’s creation, we provide a bold, inspiring environment for delegates to see and experience the power of cross-cultural partnership.Today, students from East Asia and the United States are interacting at historically unprecedented rates. During the 2011-12 school year, 14,887 American students studied in China, 5,283 studied in Japan, and 2,695 studied in South Korea. Taiwan, however, is missing from this growth narrative. While almost 15,000 Americans studied in China during 2011-12, only 820 Americans studied in Taiwan in the same year. The time for TASC is now. Even as we enter the so-called Pacific century, civil interpersonal discourse between Americans and Asians is still greatly lacking.  American perceptions of Asians as the "perpetual foreigner" are the most prolific form of hostile treatment faced by Asians living in America today. Likewise, non-white Americans working and studying in Asia are frequent targets for racism and exoticism. In today's cross-Pacific civil discourse, there remains a clear, fundamental ignorance on both shores of what it truly means to be American, and what it truly means to be Asian.TASC is the beginning of a new story. We see the current lack of cultural exchange between the U.S. and Taiwan as a valuable opportunity to challenge the current U.S-Asia social narrative. Our identity as a joint U.S-Taiwan collaboration puts us in the perfect position to initiate cross-cultural dialogue that engages and benefits both nations equally.議題實踐: TASC  TURNS  ABSTRACT IDEAS  INTO  ACTIONABLE  SOLUTIONS.


We believe that actions speak louder than words. Our Roundtable discussion format is designed to help student delegates develop creative solutions for the most important problems affecting the United States and Taiwan today. A 21-day excursion throughout Taiwan provides delegates with the necessary academic, professional, and experiential knowledge needed to formulate well-informed responses to these pressing issues. Each TASC conference culminates in the Final Forum, in which Roundtables present their findings and propose tangible solutions to a panel of local and global ripplemakers eager to invest in the ideas brought forth by TASC delegates.  





TASC is not your ordinary student conference. We share hotel rooms. We take public transportation. Sometimes we wear suits, but usually we're in shorts and T-shirts. We travel -- a lot. We're in it to learn and to grow; to challenge ourselves and to challenge each other. We're in it to change lives. Are you up to the TASC?Sponsor TASC or a TASCer!All donations will go towards our conference as a whole unless specified. If you would like to sponsor a TASCer, please mention their name in your donation.
  Josh Hu 胡傳義

School: University of Texas at Austin
Major: Business/Accounting
Year: Graduated May 2015
Pitch: As a Taiwanese American born in Texas, I hope to discover my Taiwanese roots this summer and forge lifelong relationships with my fellow delegates during the conference. As I enter into the business world in September, I hope to one day do business and work in Taiwan in the future. Your support is greatly supported, and I'll send you a postcard either from either Taiwan or Texas (your choice)! 

 I Chun "JoJo" Lee 李孟璇
School: Northeastern University Freshman (Rising Sophomore)
Major: Psychology (major) Graphic & Information Design (minor)
Pitch: I believe that knowledge truly is power, and I am currently on a quest to become as perceptive of the world around me as I can. Aid me on this journey and you will be rewarded with a postcard featuring a personal drawing and message by me (along with my eternal gratitude).



Allison Malmsten 麦小鱼
School:University of Minnesota - Twin Cities
Major: Linguistics Minor: Asian-Languages and Literature
Pitch: During my time at TASC I would like to gain a deeper understanding of Taiwanese culture and education. I hope to apply what I learn to my future in making more efficient foreign language acquisition techniques for both countries, and take action on making a good education available for everyone no matter what location or demographic. Donate over $50 and I will personally send you a postcard from Taiwan!

Sean Salansky 蘇忠誠
School: Lawrence University, Junior
Major: Chinese and Linguistics Double Major Japanese Minor
Pitch: I deserve financial help because I am a hard worker and strive to be the best in every thing that I do. I’m going to Taiwan to make a difference and to help myself to make a difference in the world after college as well.



 Jason Cheung 張皓程
School: Case Western Reserve University (rising senior)
Major: Political Science, International Studies /Minors: Japanese, Music

​​Pitch: I do not know what is going to be like during TASC but that's why I am doing it. In TASC, I am meeting strangers who may turn into lifetime good friends, and experiencing new culture that enlarge my site horizon. Isn't it fantastic? Support me and I will send you a postcard about my experience in Taiwan! 




Reece Sisto
School: University of Pennsylvania (rising Sophomore)
Major: Economic History and Gender Studies 
Pitch: I want to grow as a global citizen and embolden my study of gender and sexuality through an international lens. I think TASC's mission and their approach to educating young students is commendable, something I'm lucky to join. Through TASC, I believe I will learn a lot about myself and how to interact with a culture that is beautiful, unique, and totally different from my own.

story: -

MINI-MEDINA: a project for the Egyptian children by the Egyptian children


Our project started in October 2012, building ground to create a city made by children in Egypt. In this city children are the government, make the laws and the constitution, build the buildings and the streets. They select their professions adopting a role-play model, and they run the city.The first pilot mini-medina took place on 20 January 2013 in Cairo.

Today we can say that the pilot phase that concluded with the 5th mini-medina edition has been a success, and we are ready to continue and grow, with your help! In our experimental phase we have had an open mind, experimenting with the project in different locations of Cairo and other Egyptian cities: mini-medina took place three times in Cairo (twice inMuqqatam in cooperation with Alwan wa Awtar NGO, once at darb1718 cultural centre in cooperation with selmiya initiative), once in Abu Sir and once in Alexandria (with Alashanek ya Baladi).

We are entering a second phase now, with new locations, longer duration of play cities, more training for participating adults, and more children involved

WHO ARE WE? 

Mini-Medina is a group of highly motivated Egyptians and long-time residents that seek to review the vision of society that Egyptian children have. For six months the core team of mini-medina (Nairy A, Mohamed el Khatteeb, Muhammad Nasr, Ulrike von Ruecker and Paloma Yáñez) has worked to train over one hundred facilitators in Cairo and other Egyptian cities. These facilitators have become the mini-medina messengers to the children, guiding the activities and carrying out different dialogue dynamics with the children to brainstorm a better city. The entire team is part of a network of alternative education facilitators in Egypt which mini-medina is trying to formalize. Up to now, all facilitators and trainers have worked in a voluntary manner. We work in Rasheed22, a coworking space in Cairo, and we continue to develop different partnerships to spread all around the city and the country!

ONE DAY MINI-MEDINA, PHASE I

January to June 2013

The pilot phase of the project has been based on our one day medina-model:

When: Once a month in a different location

Cost to attend: Free and upon a voluntary agreement with the children

Who: Neighborhood children between the ages of 6-16

How Many Kids: All neighborhood kids are welcome. Up to now we have been working with 50 children at a time, but we aim to make Mini-Medinas for 600 children a day in the second phase of the project

Where has Mini-Medina started: Mini-Cairo, Mini-Muqqatam, Mini-Selmeya, Mini-Alexandria and Mini-Abu Sir.

Where is Mini-Medina going: Mini-Siwa, Mini-Nweiva, Mini-Aswan, Mini-Menya, Mini-Dar el Ahmar and much more!!

What do you do in a Mini-Medina day: Brainstorm about what are the feature of the city that we like and those that we would like to change, draw the ideal city, make the projects the city buildings in groups of 5 to 10 children, build the structures with recycled materials, paint the buildings, make the customs, select a profession within the city, play the city, meet other children, reflect upon the city, experiment with the mechanisms of the city, make the rules and laws, play with the concept of citizenship and have fun!

SECOND PHASE OF MINI-MEDINA: OUR GOALS

One day Mini-Medina model: In the next six months we plan to continue using the one day city model in the new locations: Siwa, Aswan, Nweiva, Menya...

Play the city Mini-Medina model: In Cairo and Abu Sir we will take the model to the next phase of the project that steps up from simply building the city and works more with the functioning and mechanisms of the city. We will make cities specific of different professions, for instance the craft city is a project that we are developing in Dar el Ahmar in Cairo, in this case the city will be made with wood and carton, to last for at least a week. With the aid of traditional Egyptian craft makers, who will be the facilitators, the children will be able to take different traditional crafts and spend a week experimenting with such professions. At this step the role-play becomes more realistic, and the children leave the role of city planners to become city doers, further deepening the citizenship exercise.

The Alternative Education network: The Mini-Medina team finds it fundamentally important to develop a network of alternative education facilitators in Egypt. Such network is still maturing, and to help the process we want to create an online space where the different projects can be discussed and developed. A framework, or umbrella where the facilitators can experiment and propose new ideas to improve the educational opportunities to Egyptian children. This network would of course be accompanied by different off-line events, meetings and encounters where we can learn from each other and support with trainings or ideas, the different projects. It will also serve as a portal for new people to integrate in the network, and a legitimacy base for the work in alternative education that is being done in Egypt.

Online platform for children: Although Mini-Medina is inclusive and free for all children of Cairo, there is a space and time limitation in every edition we do. Thus we want to create an online environment in which children can make suggestions, all year round, on how to improve Mini-Medina. The play city is their city, and they need to have time and space to propose new ideas, debate the best option among them and create effective changes to the play city.

Mini-Muenchen: The play city model exists in over 70 countries of the world. One of the biggest edition takes place in Munich every 2 years. In the summer of 2014 we plan to take a group of 14 Egyptian children to the Mini-Munich so they can participate and explore which aspects can be further explored in Egypt. The children that go will be part of the Mini-Medina children founding team!

Per diem: Six months down the road and our facilitators are still paying their own transportation costs and food when working in Mini-Medina. We love them for their support, but we would like to du justice to the effort of their work by providing a per diem salary.

Storage: Mini-Medina is built upon recycled materials (literally). For each edition, we have been gathering recycled material from our networks and up to know it has been stored in the coworking space Rasheed22. Now we have allocated a storage space in Abu Sir which we plan to rent to become the Mini-Medina Egypt storage facility!

WE NEED YOUR HELP!

We have worked, we have built, this is to show you that our project is meaningful ... However, now we need your help to continue! We are ready to work more, but ... unfortunately the mini-medina money is nothing but paper in real life - and we have emptied our pockets.

To play more, and train the needed facilitators, we need a total of EUR 8,000.-OUR COSTS that we need to cover:

1- one day mini-medina model: once a month edition for the year to come will cost EUR 1,500.- (including per diem)

2- play the city mini-medina model: one week craft city will cost EUR 1,500.-

3- establishing and curating the Alternative Education network: EUR 500.-

4- establishing and curating the interactive online platform for children: EUR 500.-

5- participation in mini-muenchen 2014: travel expenses and accommodation for 14 participants (10 children and 4 accompanying adults) EUR 4,000.-

6- materials storage and workspace: rent for one year EUR 500.-

Total: EUR 8,000.-

With this first campaign we aim to raise 50% of the total cost

For the other 50% we are fundraising from various sources, including a second campaign in July/August.

We are also contacting local organisations and institutional partners for financial and other support.

IMPACT

Not only we will be able to carry out the above mentioned steps, but we will be able to keep working towards developing citizenship and democracy values among Egyptian children!

Respect: towards each other and the city

Unity: to make a city look beautiful through collective work

Critical Thinking: through questioning existing structures and proposing creative ways of improvement.

Independence: by allowing for a degree of autonomy, creativity sparks and ideas are brought to life

Experimentation: how does a certain profession feel and why does s/he feel that way?

Creativity: The process of building their city allows children to imagine, fly, and dream. This will help them build an original future!

YOU CAN'T DONATE? HERE, A THOUSAND OTHER WAYS TO HELP US OUT!

If in Egypt: 

  • Become a facilitator!! Give Egyptian children a chance to get to know you, and yourself a chance to discover how Egyptian children want their society to be like!

  • Find a location for the next mini-medina... anywhere is great as long as the children want to build a city!

  • You would like to organize? Get in touch with us through mini.medina.egypt@gmail.com and we will welcome you to the team

  • Collect recyclables and write to us! We will come to pick them up!

  • You want to share your profession with the children? Write to us and we will welcome you as a activity host in one of the next mini-medinas

story:
Dearest Friends and Family,

As many of you know, I am moving to Indonesia for an English teaching job in Solo, Central Java.  I have spent the last many years teaching yoga and working as a birth doula in Boston, but now it is time for me to make a complete and total life change.

And let me tell you... ending a career, getting trained in a brand new field, and moving to Asia is a major and very expensive undertaking. 

As I enter the final weeks before my departure, it has become clear that despite months of planning, saving, and trying to account for the unforeseeable, I am in need of your financial support.  This is a very uncomfortable position to be in, but they say that true growth starts at the end of your comfort zone... So I am asking y'all for help.

Donations will go towards:

  • $0- $2,000 raised: International Medical Insurance
  • $2,000-$2,500 raised: Indonesian Language Classes
  • $2,500- $4,000 raised: Emergency Healthcare Fund *
  • $4,000- $5, 000 raised: Unforeseen Expenses Upon Arrival in Java.
  • $5,000-$6,000 raised: Service Project at Bumi Sehat, Bali's world famous birth center.  
*If I require medical care beyond something very basic, I will need to go to Singapore, or another more developed city.  So I need to be prepared for related expenses.  If at the end of my time in Solo I have not needed this money for healthcare.  (Yay!)  I will use it towards my relocation home.  

Pay it Forward

Any amount over $6,000 dollars that I raise will  allow me to take on additional service projects in South East Asia.

There is a world famous birth center in Bali and I have been in touch with them about volunteering my time to support local women in the birth process. I am also planning to do other service projects while I travel and your help will fund additional volunteer projects. 

More about my work history and future aspirations

As you may have guessed, working as a doula/yoga teacher did not leave me with stacks of cash.  It was amazing life-changing work, and I have chosen to go into another service field that I am so excited about.  Working in a developing nation with a native population really inspires me, and is something that I am passionate about.  I knew that working internationally was an important next step for me and chose the path of an English teacher so that I could delve into local culture and have direct relationships with the native people. 

I am so excited for this next step in my journey.  And I look forward to keeping you all updated about my adventures, experiences, and wild stories.  
Thank you in advance for your love, support, and help in this big transition.

I understand that for some, supporting my journey financially just isn't realistic.  I am so grateful for any way you can offer support whether its just a message of encouragement, a Skype call when I'm in a new land, or a care package  (like of American Flags for the 4th of July). 

I promise you, I will pay it forward big time.

Love!
Nina

story:
Education is not just the study of the subject, but a holistic approach toward life, “it is the harmonious development of the physical, the mental, and the spiritual powers” (White, 1999). Once a student grasps this concept, he or she automatically takes ownership of their learning.

Travon Ross, an 8th grader, has been attending James E. Sampson Memorial SDA (JESM) school in Fort Pierce, FL since 2007. He enrolled in JESM in 1st grade. Travon is a hard working and dedicated young man who has many goals and aspirations. He has realized that education is not just the study of the subject but is more than that and has taken ownership of his goals. In the classroom he takes a proactive approach in meeting his educational and long term goals. He plans on becoming a computer programmer when he grows up and he knows that it takes hard work and dedication along with a good grasp in Mathematics. Though Travon is in the 8th grade he has advanced in Mathematics and is currently working on Algebra 1. Many students like Travon have had an opportunity to advance because of the Christian environment and robust curriculum.

JESM has been providing quality Christian education in St. Lucie county for 70 years. Many have been touched by this institution and have benefited from it. In order for this institution to continue providing quality Christian education and to keep its doors open for the benefit of future generations, funds are required.

story:
“By education I mean all-around development, drawing out the best in the child: body, mind and spirit.” -Mahatma Gandhi 

       Namaste! My name is David Morgan. I am happy to say that as of April 27th, 2015 we fully funded the Balgram Children's Village and raised a total of $21,512! Thank you to everyone who made this happen. 

    If you would still like to contribute to this wonderful foundation, you can! Because our campaign was fully funded, IndieGoGo has allowed us to become a permanent member. We are still continuing our efforts for our Girl Scholarship Program, and you can become a part of it! 

Girl Child Scholarship Program

Shreyas began a mission to provide quality education opportunities to girls from the most disadvantaged parts of society, especially girls from the nearby slum communities of Ahmedabad, India. Whereas many of these girls were on their way to dropping out at a young age, they are now being fully educated at one of the best Montessori schools in India and are on their to becoming the bright minds of tomorrow. 

 

Instead of telling you about the Girl Child Program, let us show you here...


Many of the girls brought into this program have blossomed into intelligent, energetic, and empowered young women that are becoming future women leaders. 

The Shreyas Foundation Vision:

The Shreyas Foundation was founded on the teaching philosophies of Mahatma Gandhi, Maria Montessori, and Rabindranath Tagore with a vision:

"To create an ecosystem for learning that enables its students to explore their heritage, discover their true potential, understand their responsibility as global citizens, ignite in them creativity and curiosity to question boundaries, and instill in them desire, capability and self-confidence to pursue excellence."

Our Efforts

     In order to guarantee that this incredible program continues in the years to come, the costs of the girls tuition must first be covered. Your contribution will go directly towards the girls' tuition.
For years, these programs have been transforming lives. Now, each and every one of you has the opportunity to transform a life by becoming involved yourself.

What happens with my contribution?  


How can we thank you enough? 

 In addition to personal thank you letters...
Your contribution of $100 or more brings you a hand-made Indian scarf from the region of Gujarat in west India, along with a personal thank you letter from a child at Shreyas. These are just just a few of the many perks available.

              

              

No matter what your donation, we can't express enough gratitude for your generosity. You have transformed a life and empowered a child to write their own story. THANK YOU!!!

Spread the word

     Share our message with your friends and family, help us transform the lives of children in the City of Gandhi. Please come by the Shreyas Foundation at any time! We would love to meet you! 

Facebook

Tell your friends:

"I just contributed to the Shreyas Foundation, and helped provide education to a girl in need. Will you join me? [tag 5 friends here]. Join me at Indiegogo, https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/balgram-chil...

Support the Balgram Children's Village at the Shreyas Foundation. Transform the life of a destitute child by providing them with a home, a family, and top-quality education.


The Shreyas Foundation is registered under Bombay Public Charitable Trust Act, 1959. Registration number - 45873.

                                                       


For more information, please visit our website, at  http://www.shreyasfoundation.in/

Balgram Children's Village

http://www.shreyasfoundation.in/balagram-sos.html

Girl Child Scholarship Program

http://www.shreyasfoundation.in/scholarship.html
story_txt:
“By education I mean all-around development, drawing out the best in the child: body, mind and spirit.” -Mahatma Gandhi         Namaste! My name is David Morgan. I am happy to say that as of April 27th, 2015 we fully funded the Balgram Children's Village and raised a total of $21,512! Thank you to everyone who made this happen.     If you would still like to contribute to this wonderful foundation, you can! Because our campaign was fully funded, IndieGoGo has allowed us to become a permanent member. We are still continuing our efforts for our Girl Scholarship Program, and you can become a part of it! 



Girl Child Scholarship Program
Shreyas began a mission to provide quality education opportunities to girls from the most disadvantaged parts of society, especially girls from the nearby slum communities of Ahmedabad, India. Whereas many of these girls were on their way to dropping out at a young age, they are now being fully educated at one of the best Montessori schools in India and are on their to becoming the bright minds of tomorrow.

story:
A Brief History of Decks In the Park from the Founder

Hi guys, my name is Jeff Mitchell, founder of Decks. I’m just one member of a large team of Dallas citizens who have been committed to bringing you that “Beats. Park Life” mission to Dallas. Decks is the city's premier monthly electronic music gathering that is one of the largest of its kind in the country and now draws 4000-5000+ people per event. Our team is made up of Real Estate people, DJs, Music business veterans, Graphic Designers, Marketers and just generally super cool and good hearted people who want to make Dallas a better place to live. 

For those of you who are new to Decks... think of a music festival like Coachella or Electric Daisy Carnival who draw couple hundred thousand people, then subtract 195K people, condense it into 3.5 hrs. and imagine it free and fun for all ages to enjoy on a regular basis.  Not only that, we give Big Brothers Big Sisters and Music Weapon who are great local charities a voice at our events and also donates 10% of our net profits to them.

What Decks Needs to Continue... 

Decks is now going on its third year and only happen if we get the generous support of our fans to donate and our sponsors partners to help fund the event. That being said, we can’t do this without you. This event production costs alone to put this Decks on for a season is $70,000 at minimum and we really need to be able to raise $100K per season to make this event sustainable for years to come. We do get some occasional funding from official sponsors but that doesn't cover the entire costs. That being said, we are only asking for a portion of the costs listed below for now.

The great news is that if we have 4,000 people attend who donate $3 per person that will be $12,000 per event which will allow us to continue to have this monthly event free. Every dollar helps!  

Beats I Park I Life...The Impact (see video in gallery)

Beats: Decks is committed to serving the community with best beats from a wide variety of music genres from the classic funk, soul, and hip hop to all genres of electronic music ranging from house, Trapp & Bass and Indie Dance plus other World music genres like Reggae and Samba to name a few.

Park: We want to inspire and promote the use of our cities amazing public spaces like Klyde Warren Park where we host Decks. Finally the most important…

Life: Its our goal to connect people through music, enhance the culture and quality of life in our community and help inspire one another to actively get involved in making a difference in the community by serving others in enjoyable ways like becoming a child mentor or donor with Big Brothers Big Sisters or giving of your time and resources to serve the less fortunate in fun musical way like Music is Our Weapon. Decks donates 10% of its net profits to our community charities of choice.

What Does it Cost to Make Decks a Reality?

Most of the event costs are mainly in rental fees for the park, professional quality sound, lighting and video, marketing and promotion costs and event insurance. Other costs include design work, web site, rental fees for stage production, banking fees, legal fees to operate the business, merchandise and production staff. 

Why Support?

So why support Decks in the Park?? Because it super Cool and fun and hey…who doesn’t want to be super cool and fun? But even better than that it gives the community a unique outlet to experience music in an amazing public space that’s fun for the whole family and finally it brings the community together.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always looking for introductions to potential partners and sponsors. Please send referrals, contacts and introductions to: Beats@decksinthepark.com


Bigger Picture

We would love nothing more for this experience to spread into other communities across the U.S. and into places like LA, Oklahoma City and Austin for example. We have the technology, the team and DJ contacts to make this a reality, we just need the right partner and money to make it so!


Closing Statements from Decks

Decks is not something we get paid to do but Team Decks do out of love for music and the community. We truly feel that we are creating memories and experiences that will be with friends and families for years and years to come. This event has become uniquely Dallas and we hope Dallas decides to take action and donate so we can all makes this a musical legacy to last for years to come in the city! 

So ask yourself… Are you a music lover? Do you want to help connect the community through music and make it a better place to live and enjoy?

If the answer is yes we hope you will make a choice to donate  $10,$20, $100, $1000 or more to this music movement so that in can be enjoyed in the community  for years to come.

Thanks for Listening!

Team Decks

story:
Celebrate Earth Day by Funding B's Environmental Health Education 

  • I'm Brenda, and I am passionate about environmental justice and would like to pursue an MPH in Global Environmental Health. I have been admitted to a program at George Washington University in DC and I am short $36, 000 to cover the cost of attendance. 
  • I deeply care about the environment and want to gain the knowledge to prevent or mitigate the adverse impact of environmental hazards on human health. 
  • I come from a community that has been exposed to contaminated water and other environmental hazards and I believe this has caused the many cancers in my community---including my immediate family. 
  • I'm a first generation college graduate (yay, I graduated!) and very close to being the first one in my family to pursue graduate studies....I just need to find the money to fund grad school. 

Brenda Needs $36,000 for the Cost of Attendance

  • Brenda needs $36,000 to cover the cost of attendance which includes books, tuition, housing, and personal expenses (like food). 
  • All funds raised will go towards covering the cost of attendance at George Washington University's MPH in Global Environmental Health in DC and to pay indiegogo for using their website.
  • Help Brenda and she will send you a post card thanking you and letting you know how school is going in DC.
  • Every dollar counts :) 

The Impact: Celebrate Earth Day

  • Celebrate Earth Day by helping Brenda gain the tools to prevent or mitigate adverse impacts of environmental hazards on human health!! 
  • Everyone benefits from promoting the health of the earth!!
  • Brenda successfully graduated from Seattle University and was even selected as the Commencement Speaker for her graduating class in 2012 (watch the video posted), she will definitely succeed in completing the MPH program at GWU!!
  • Brenda has been active in her community and will continue to do so and she will have the tools to be an informed environmental justice advocate :)

Other Ways You Can Help, 'cuz it's NOT all about the bacon

Brenda is a Gates Millennium Scholar, and although most people believe this scholarship is a full ride, the foundation provides a capped amount for graduate studies in Public Health that will not be enough for Brenda to cover GWU's cost of attendance, so PLEASE help Brenda!!!

  • Please make some noise about Celebrating Earth Day by Funding Brenda's Environmental Health Education!!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share, share, share!!!
  • Brenda is applying to other scholarships and would appreciate it if you let her know about any scholarships/fellowships/opportunities that she could apply/qualify for :)
  • Love the Earth :)
  • Thank you :)

story:
The Roots of CameroonONE (AKA CamONE!)

Hello all! I am an undergraduate student at Stony Brook University in New York; a rising senior with dreams to make waves in the nonprofit field. I became involved in the fate of these children when I heard some starting facts about Cameroon.
Cameroon, a small to midsize country in Central Africa, has 1.3 million orphaned children, according to UNICEF, due to the haunting grip of diseases such as malaria, AIDS, and tuberculosis. These kids end up in orphanages, in relatives homes who are too poor to take care of them, on the streets ridden with drugs and crime, or in sex trafficking and organ exploitation circles, just to survive. In all of these situations, they do not have the ability to attend school. 

Due to the magnitude of poverty in Cameroon, $1 in the United States equates to $600 in Cameroon. Because of this huge currency gap, with just $150 US Dollars, an orphan in Cameroon is funded for an ENTIRE YEAR! $150 = Out of an Orphanage and Into a Family Member's Home. With this very unique opportunity, we can truly change the lives of these kids with our contributions.  Although we hope to lower this currency gap, this difference gives us the rare opportunity to make a giant and measurable impact in this African country. 


Where Your Contribution Goes

The money goes to CameroonONE, a recently established, small organization that relocates orphans in Cameroon to safe homes of relatives, by providing relatives with the money and resources to take care of these growing children.  
  • There is no credible foster care system in Cameroon. Because of this, the founders of CamONE created a new system to solve this crisis: The In-Home Foster Care System. 
  • They locate surviving relatives of the children, rejoin the family and provide an annual stipend to cover school fees, medical assistance, school supplies, uniforms, text books, shoes, as well as rice, seeds, and cooking oil. 
  • This annual stipend strictly depends on whether the family is nurturing the child properly. They must have positive evaluations, attend a credible school, be fully vaccinated and tend to all healthcare needs. 
When we raise money, we immediately transfer it to our team in Cameroon who donates it directly to the relatives who take in the orphaned children. 
  • Our team at CameroonONE has no office space. We all work virtually.
  • Because we do not have to pay for office space or an abundance of employees, 90% of the funds raised go directly to the children! 
  • We currently have 60-65 orphans in our program and hope to raise this number in the coming years with your help!
Although improving the all around welfare of these orphans is important, we highlight the need for education. Through developments in education, by getting these children out of orphanages and back into schools, Cameroon can make strides in reducing poverty and increasing employment in critical fields such as medicine, public policy, and education. Funding education is not a short term solution, but a long term investment in the development of these children and the lifting of a nation out of poverty. 


The Impact

It takes $150 to sponsor a child for an entire year, and every dollar and cent counts to us to get to that magic number again and again. I currently spend my time collecting spare change door-to-door, conducting garage sales, organizing large scale social events, and brainstorming new ideas to raise money for our orphaned children. My team and I truly appreciate every dollar and cent given, and strive to find new ways to raise awareness of this cause everyday. Our fundraising efforts run on the dedication of individual interns running campaigns every year to achieve our goals. Although we are a new organization and lack large scale funding, we make our goals come true through passion and persistence.  

Challenges of CamONE 

For those children in the orphanage with remote outside relatives or family members not suitable to take them in, it can be very difficult to find homes for these children. Our professional staff works to make these connections between families, and the more we grow, the more resources we can use to locate family members and relocate more orphans out of orphanages. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have the means to contribute financially, there are always other ways to help!

Partner with Us - Know an organization with similar or intertwining goals? E-mail: haley.wodarczyk@stonybrook.edu to discuss!

Share our Campaign - On Facebook, on IndieGoGo, On Twitter, and of course in person! Whatever method you prefer to use, we appreciate you spreading our cause for our children. 

Join our E-mail List - Receive e-mails on the progress of CamONE and follow our kids as they learn and grow! To receive e-mails, contact: haley.wodarczyk@stonybrook.edu.

Help us with Ideas - Grassroots fundraising is not an easy process! Without the luxury of large grants, we rely on the accumulation of small efforts to fund our children. If you know any one willing to help or ways to inspire change, please share it with us.


Sincerely,

Haley Wodarczyk

story:
Greetings!  We are the Los Angeles Pony and Critter Club.  We explore human Animal Role Play in social events such as Fox Hunts, Derby Days, and Western Days.  We march in GLBT Pride parades - everyone loves the human Ponies, Puppies and Critters.  We would like to provide our events free or for a very nominal cost to the public, so that more people can see what we do.  We would like these events to be free for the participants in the events.  Human Animal Role Play is a fun hobby and a creative outlet, it relieves stress and boredom from every day life.  We stand for diversity, free speech, the freedom to express your true self, and celebrating life in jubilant fun.

We're the the *REAL* "What did the Fox say?" people. ;-)    In addition to Foxes, we have Ponies, Puppies, Kitties, Pigs and Trainers/Handlers/Riders!

What We Need  

  • Spring Fox Hunt on April 19, cost is $150 for ribbons, Sparkling Cider Toast and Feast Main Dish
  • Fall Fox Hunt on October 4th, cost is $150 for ribbons, Sparkling Cider Toast and Feast Main Dish
  • Derby Day on May 3, cost is $650 for hall rental, van rental, ribbons, Tea Service, supplies
  • Play Dates on the first Saturday of each month, cost is $150 each month for hall rental, total is $1800.00
  • DomConLA booth in May cost is $500 for space rental in vendor area plus event registration
  • Palm Cards $200
  • Web fees and domain name fees $200
  • Western Day on November 15, cost is $650 for hall rental, props, van rental, supplies
  • Folsom Fair Booth September 21st, cost is $500 for booth rental and insurance
  • Palm Springs Pride Parade on November 2nd, cost is $75.00 for entry fee
  • Cart Rides at The Park on December 7th, cost is $200 for van rental transportation
  • Jamboree July 26th, cost is $2975 for space rental, Judges, forms, ribbons, props, van rental

What You Get


Perk Packages:  

1.   One Year Pass to attend all Events of the LA Pony and Critter Club $25

2..  Stainless Steel liquid container with the LA Pony and Critter Club logo.  $30

story_txt:
Greetings!  We are the Los Angeles Pony and Critter Club.  We explore human Animal Role Play in social events such as Fox Hunts, Derby Days, and Western Days.  We march in GLBT Pride parades - everyone loves the human Ponies, Puppies and Critters.  We would like to provide our events free or for a very nominal cost to the public, so that more people can see what we do.  We would like these events to be free for the participants in the events.  Human Animal Role Play is a fun hobby and a creative outlet, it relieves stress and boredom from every day life.  We stand for diversity, free speech, the freedom to express your true self, and celebrating life in jubilant fun.We're the the *REAL* "What did the Fox say?" people. ;-)    In addition to Foxes, we have Ponies, Puppies, Kitties, Pigs and Trainers/Handlers/Riders!What We Need  
Spring Fox Hunt on April 19, cost is $150 for ribbons, Sparkling Cider Toast and Feast Main Dish
Fall Fox Hunt on October 4th, cost is $150 for ribbons, Sparkling Cider Toast and Feast Main Dish
Derby Day on May 3, cost is $650 for hall rental, van rental, ribbons, Tea Service, supplies
Play Dates on the first Saturday of each month, cost is $150 each month for hall rental, total is $1800.00
DomConLA booth in May cost is $500 for space rental in vendor area plus event registration
Palm Cards $200
Web fees and domain name fees $200
Western Day on November 15, cost is $650 for hall rental, props, van rental, supplies
Folsom Fair Booth September 21st, cost is $500 for booth rental and insurance
Palm Springs Pride Parade on November 2nd, cost is $75.00 for entry fee
Cart Rides at The Park on December 7th, cost is $200 for van rental transportation
Jamboree July 26th, cost is $2975 for space rental, Judges, forms, ribbons, props, van rental

story:
The Fight for Kenya!

Hello, 

My name is Austin Porsborg, and I was recently accepted to go on a public health mission to Kenya, Africa to educate the community on various health concerns focused on improving well being. I will be traveling with a team of dedicated students from the University of Nevada, Reno and partnering with a local non-governmental organization called "Tareto Maa," in Kilgoris, Kenya. This organizations main focus is to prevent child marriages and ending female genital mutilation. We will be working side by side with Tareto Maa aiming to end sexual violence and empower the female population. 

The majority of the students within our team have former experience educating the community, and are highly qualified to perform the desired tasks. The man that will be taking us on this life changing journey is one of the most passionate individuals I have ever had the privilege of knowing. Not only will this be his 9th visit to Africa, but he also has a great deal of experience working to improve the lives of people living in 3rd world countries.

This mission is something that I have wanted to do my entire life, but I need your help. For this mission I am trying to raise $3000.00 to help cover a portion of the tuition cost, and traveling expenses. I am not asking for a large donation, but simply a token of your appreciation for the betterment of humanity. Know that if you help me go on this mission I will be going for both of us. So help me help this community by raising awareness of these issues so that more people will help fight the good fight. Together...we can make a difference. Thank you for taking the time to read this message. 

P.S. If you are not able to donate, you can still help. Feel free to spread the word about this mission by sharing my video with your friends and family. The more you share it the closer we get to achieving our goals, and making this dream become a reality.

Thank you,

Austin Porsborg

story:
Aaron’s Story

My name is Aaron Samuel Mulenga, and I am 24 years old. Originally from Zambia, I am entering my third year of a four-year Bachelor’s degree in Fine Art and Anthropology at the University of Cape Town. I have been creating art since I can remember, mainly in an effort to share my faith, experiences and understanding of the world.

I am launching this campaign to fund the third year of my education at UCT. Studying at UCT’s Michaelis School of Fine Art grants me access to an art library and a multitude of art facilities such as kilns, laser cutters, and print media facilities. In addition I am afforded the opportunity to immerse myself in the broader circles of Cape Town’s internationally recognised professional art & culture scene. These are resources that I would not be able to find in Zambia, and for that reason it is of the utmost importance for me to be able to complete my studies at UCT.

My father passed away in May 2012, and his absence has put a substantial amount of pressure on my mother and my family, particularly in financing our education—my sister is also in university and my younger brother is in primary school. To help my mother, I sell my artwork, assist my lecturers at Michaelis, work as a waiter, and have applied to be an orientation leader and a library assistant for the upcoming semester. However, without additional assistance I will not be able to afford the costs of completing my studies. UCT does not provide tuition assistance to international students at the undergraduate level, so I'm reaching out to you, my friends and family, for your help!


The Impact

Upon completion of my degree at UCT, my intention is to return to Zambia and work to expand the art scene there. The long-term goal is to open a gallery, while in the more immediate future I plan to collaborate with a friend in Zambia on a project to use art as a platform for disability awareness. I believe that the presence of visual arts in our culture has the potential to influence society.

My aim is to use the knowledge I will obtain from this degree to affect positive change in art when I return to Zambia.


What I Need

To cover the cost of university in 2015 I need the following:

Fine Art: $4680

Anthropology: $1684

Total Tuition Cost: $6364


Through my work, I will be covering my living expenses, which are ~$5000 per year.


What You Get

An awesome selection of perks for all ranges of contributions, including opportunities to own original artwork from myself! Check out the details on the side of the page. 


Other Ways to Help

Please share this information with your friends on social media and add the following campaign link to your email signature: “Support Aaron’s Educational Endeavors!”


Connect with me:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/asminspired

Blog: https://asminspired.wordpress.com/ 

Email: rn_mulenga@yahoo.com

story: My family has fallen on hard financial times and I must humble myself to seek help to attend my son's college graduation. My son graduates on December 13, 2014 less than 10 days away at the University of South Alabama in Mobile, Alabama. My business closed in February 2014 causing this undue financial hardship. I am a single dad with custody of my 14 year old son and 8 year old daughter who also will be traveling to there brothers college graduation. The most economical way currently is to drive the 18 hour drive from Waterloo, Iowa to Mobile, Alabama and back home to Iowa. It will be heart breaking for all of us if we do not attend his graduation. As an adult you do not want your children to know of your financial difficulties so my son graduating is not aware of me possibly not being in attendance. My son was a football player on the University of South Alabama Football team until he was injured. He was switched from a regular football scholarship to a medical scholarship and begin to focus on graduating instead of football. He stuck with it and graduates December 13, 2014. I'm very proud of him and his accomplishments. He (Devin Robinson) wore #27 pictured below before his injuries sidelined his football career.  Please help me and my family attend this life achieving moment.
