story:
The idea is simple. Just like a food bank, we started a school uniform bank to help kids affected by poverty to have the things they need for a good education.

We started in Glasgow and have now spread across Scotland.

It is estimated that this year 100,000 kids in Scotland will be living below the poverty line. Their families will struggle to clothe and feed them, and for many a new school uniform is out of reach. We live in times where teachers report they're having to provide items to children themselves, or wash uniforms during PE lessons as families have no facilities at home. Some kids wear uniforms that they've grown out of, and as a result are easily singled out for bullying.

We think every child should have a decent school uniform, and we aim to provide that to those families who do not have the means to do so. Our intention with this fundraiser is to get enough stock to provide uniforms to those referred to us (we accept referrals from schools, charities, social work, GPs, foodbanks, religious organisations, community groups etc). All funds raised aill go on supplies. We don't have paid staff, just volunteers. We will be raising funds continually and accepting new donated items to replace items as they are distributed. If you can't help us with donation, maybe you could volunteer your time, energy and skills. We need people who can collect donations, fundraise (could you do a coffee morning or a bake sale?), deliver items, make gym bags, knit hats and scarves and to set up banks in their town and promote our work. 

It costs about £150 to provide a proper school uniform, which will include a warm outdoor coat, gloves, hat and scarf (where required), a full PE kit, shoes, the uniform itself (including underwear, socks, tights and vests) and a stationery stocked school bag.

Here are examples of what this money will buy

£10 will buy socks, a tie, undewear, vests, stationery items, hygiene items, scarves, hats and gloves, or a school badge

£15 will buy trousers, shirts, skirts or a school jumper

£20 will buy a pair of trainers or shoes

£25 will buy a school blazer, a PE kit, a warm coat or stocked school bag.

If you can buy even one item, or donate enough for us to buy the items from local stockists, we can start helping the poorest kids in our society go to school with some dignity and with right kit to get the most out of their education. We want them to know they are valued and remove a roadblock to a good education that should just not exist in 21st century Scotland.

Thank you in advance for your help

The Back to School Bank

story:
My name is Usumain (Ismail) Baraka. I need your help in order to finance my undergraduate studies in political science, so that I can pursue my dream of being in the front line to end conflicts in diplomatic ways. This is my story:

 

I was born in 1994 in Dirhata, a small village in Darfur, in the western part of Sudan. In 2003, when the Janjaweed militias came to kill all the males, I was nine years old. My father and older brother were shot dead. I was saved only because my mother dressed me as a girl. The killers hit her and asked where her other sons were, but she said she only had daughters left: these were my sisters and I. The militias burned the house, waiting outside to make sure we were dead. My mother told us to cry and shout. The militias thus thought we were dying and left the place. We escaped the burning house and left the village. On the way, we spotted my fatherʼs body, and few meters ahead my brotherʼs. We arrived to a UN refugees camp in Chad, in which we lived together until 2007. At that point I decided I could no longer live in the hard conditions of the camp. Rather than going back to our village and fight, I wanted to study. 

I realized we could gain back our homes by studying, by understanding the political situation and how it evolved, and by coming up with non-violent ways to make peace and end the genocide. 

I left the UN camp when I was only thirteen, leaving behind my beloved ones.



I crossed Chad and reached Libya. In the city of Bengazi I started learning English and I worked in a shop, earning some money for living. After a year and a half I moved with a friend to Egypt, where studying was cheap, according to what I had heard. But the Egyptian and Sudanese governments collaborated to send the Darfur people back, only to face either limitless imprisonment or death. I had to leave Egypt.

One day, on the television, I watched a documentary about the Shoah, the Jewish Holocaust. The only thing I knew about the Jews was that Israel is the only Jewish country in the world. Watching the documentary, I learned about the Jewish people's past, about their being freed from slavery in Egypt, about the persecutions and discrimination they have suffered over the centuries until they were able to found their own country and live there freely. I could identify myself with this story and I had no doubt that the Jewish people would sympathize with my and my people's story: I had to go to Israel.




I got in touch with someone who smuggled migrants over the border to Israel. We were twelve people in the group, including me and my friend. At night, we crawled towards the Israeli part, trying to avoid the Egyptian soldiers. Then, suddenly, someone in the group got panicked: he jumped to his feet and started shouting. Three bullets in the head, shot by the soldiers, killed him on the spot. The soldiers now came in our direction and we had no choice but to start running towards the Israeli border fence and hope that the bullets would not hit us. We dropped everything we had and ran, ran ran. My friend and I ran as fast as we could, holding hands. On the way, another man in the group was shot dead, followed by his fellow who came back to assist him. The rest of us reached the border fence and climbed on it. The Israeli soldiers gave us water and treated our wounds.

I was taken to a prison, where I spent a month and a half in the adults section. When I was released, I got a temporary visa and moved to Tel Aviv, where I lived without any clear purpose. But I kept learning English. In 2010 I moved to Yemin Orde, a youth village that provides migrants and refugees with a place to live in and with the possibility to study. I felt safe for the first time since I had arrived to Israel. I learned Hebrew and did high school there. In 2014, I finished my exams. Since then, I have been volunteering in the village, trying to give back at least some of what I have received there so generously.




Now I would like to make the next step and acquire higher education. I have already been accepted to undergraduate studies in the prestigious Lauder School of Government, Diplomacy and Strategy at the Interdisciplinary Center Herzliya (IDC).

Studying is the reason I why left the camp in Chad. Despite all the difficulties I encountered ever since, I have never forgotten this goal and dream. 

I learned hard to get good grades in high school, and also the acceptance to the two institutions of higher education is the fruit of hard work. I want to have a degree in political science and international relations. I want to go back to my country and help my people live in peace on their land. I want to build a bridge between my first homeland, Africa, and my second one, Israel – the country of the people who I am still convinced can best identify with my situation, since they had precisely the same unfortunate experience.



While I am pursuing my goals, I am not forgetting my brothers and sisters who have gone through the same hell like me. As I have been doing so far, I will keep helping other refugees who live in Israel and have difficulties, and visiting inmates in detention camps for refugees. I am also not forgetting the youth village that has given me the possibility to live well and study. I am continuing to volunteer in the various facilities of the village.


 

The only thing that separates me from a first degree are the fees. I would be endlessly grateful to have your support, so that I can accomplish my goal, graduate successfully and contribute in peaceful ways to end conflicts that have already demanded too many lives.

story:
Lurucha

Es un cuento del Perú para Niños de todo el mundo.  

Lurucha is a story from Peru for children all around the world.

(Lurucha and the boy encounter each other for the first time)

This illustrated version of the story is perfect for early readers and is of universal appeal as the story is told through the pictures alone.  We want Lurucha to be available to as many children in the world in order to share this touching story about a child and a parrot.


Having worked with the local schools and been personally involved in the running of an independent alternative school in my hometown of Ollantaytambo (near Machu Picchu) we thought this would be a great way for us to contribute to the school and to provide scholarships to students that need it.


By raising sufficient funds we will be able to pay for the publishing costs of the first 2000 books, some of which we will give to you in appreciation for your contributions and have plenty more to share with children around the world that will fund scholarships and further projects.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $10,000 that will cover the cost of publishing run of 2000 copies.
  • By contributing to Lurucha you are contributing to Kuska School you are also assured your own first edition hard copy of Lurucha.  Other perks include limited edition prints.  Our greatest supporters will be treated to a curated trip to Cusco, Machu Picchu and Ollantaytambo where they will be guided by the author, see Kuska School, meet the artist as well as the children and discover the town and landscape that inspired Lurucha in the first place. 
  • All proceeds from book sales will be donated to Kuska School.


About Kuska School

Kuska School is an alternative elementary school located on a sustainable farm on Inca terraces in Ollantaytambo.  In small multiage groups, through project based learning, students live and come to understand the world they are a part of, the beauty of it all and their role in protecting the things that are important and working to improve the space of the world they occupy. 


Thank You!!

Thanks in advance for your support of this project, for helping publish this story and helping Kuska School move forward as we attempt to provide children with a different educational experience that taps into their own creativity, interests and focuses on the need to understand and interact with the world in a peaceful and sustainable way.

story:
Emerging Cooking Solutions is a Swedish-Zambian company with a strong social and environmental agenda. In 2012 we developed a market based concept for replacing charcoal for cooking purposes in Africa. 

The use of charcoal is one of the main causes behind the devastating deforestation of the African continent. Made from virgin forests, charcoal is used as a fuel for cooking, heating, and for industrial purposes. We market high-energy fuel pellets as an environmentally friendly substitute for charcoal.  Our pellets are produced locally from waste biomass: residues from agriculture and also from sustainable plantation forests. 

By using pellets in a new, efficient pellet burning stove, a school can cut its fuel costs by as much as fifty to seventy per cent, and cook more efficiently and more safely than with charcoal. To cook with pellets, a school needs to replace its charcoal stove. Commercial kitchens and wealthy institutions can afford to do this, but underfunded schools and orphanages can not. They are caught in a poverty trap.  Constantly spending funds on expensive charcoal, they can not accumulate the funds necessary to finance the switch from primitive charcoal stoves to the new energy efficient, and cost-saving pellet stoves for cooking.

The goal of this project is that every school and orphanage in Lusaka is provided with a commercial size pellet stove, suitable for school kitchens.

In order to reach this goal, we are inviting outside sponsors in to lessen the burden on schools by financing the initial investment in a new pellet stove. To reach all the schools and orphanages in Lusaka, 30 pellet burning stoves need to be provided. This is a flexible fund-project, so all funds donated will reach the project.

What Is Needed

We know that the total institutional need in Lusaka is approximately 30 commercial-size stoves. We already have a list of 20 potential recipients, that includes for the most part schools, but also five orphanages and one home for the aged, who need the benefit of your support. Sponsors will have the opportunity to make a tangible contribution which will immediately improve the economic and environmental conditions of your recipients. Each of these pellet burning stoves has the capacity to cook for 500 people. An electric fan provides a forced draft in the stove to ensure clean, efficient burning. The forced draft system has a battery back-up unit which is kept topped up by a solar panel.

Making an Impact

  • Deforestation is a huge problem in Zambia and Africa. The effects of deforestation are reduced biodiversity, desertification, disrupted water cycles, increased greenhouse gas emissions and disrupted livelihoods. Natural forests are cut down and made into charcoal fuel for cooking. In order to decrease pressure on forests an alternative to charcoal fuel is essential. A viable and cheaper alternative is to use fuel made from waste biomass and renewable energy sources. 
  • We are already making an impact. To date in Zambia, we have sold 2000 domestic pellet stoves to middle and low income households who are now no longer dependent on charcoal. Since July 2014 the University of Zambia, the Olympic Youth Development Center and Silva Catering (Lusakas largest catering firm) have replaced their out-of-date charcoal stoves with our modern pellet burning stoves.
  • Six tons of virgin forest are cut down to make one ton of charcoal. Substituting this one ton of charcoal will leave 6 tons of forest standing and reduce CO2 emissions by more than 4 tons.
  • A typical school uses 500 kg to a 1 ton of charcoal per month. 1 ton of charcoal costs 1 650 Kwatcha, or 288 US dollars (even more in the rainy season). When using a modern pellet stove, 200 kg of pellets will give the same amount of cooking at a cost of 94 US dollars, a saving of up to 194 US dollars per month.
  • Though small by Western standards, we have one of Africas largest pellet plants with the capacity to produce enough pellet fuel to replace charcoal for all the schools and orphanages in Lusaka.

Ways You Can Help

  • Donate! Form a group of friends or colleagues to make a major contribution. Inspire your company to make a corporate donation or contribute to this campaign as a Christmas gift. 
  • Let others know about this campaign and share the link to the campaign. Spread the word! Send the link http://www.igg.me/at/end-charcoal to your friends on Facebook and Twitter at #endCharcoal. Make sure everyone gets to know that there is a way to end the dependence on charcoal, to help people out of the poverty-trap, and relieve the pressure on the forests of Zambia.

About Us

Emerging Cooking Solutions (ECS) is a Swedish based company founded in 2012, with its daughter company (with the same name) based in Zambia. The founders, Mattias Ohlson and Per Löfberg started the company to address the problem of deforestation caused by charcoal burning, and to promote healthy cooking environments in Africa. ECS now employs 15 people in Zambia.

  • In 2012 we received the WWF Climate Solver award for our concept of combining clean burning stoves with ecologically sustainable bio-waste pellets.
  • In 2013 we were number 5 on the leading news-platform Mashables list of
    "the 10 most important innovations that improved the world".
  • In 2014 we received the regional Skapa-award (in memory of Alfred Nobel) which recognizes the potential of our innovative concept for economic development.


Contact information:

Emerging Cooking Solutions Sweden
Ideon Science Park
Scheelevägen 15
SE 223 70 Lund

Emerging Cooking Solutions Zambia
plot 9160, Lunsenfwa Road
Kalundu
10101 Lusaka

story:
The Basics

My name is Ariana Brown and I need your help to finish college. I am a 20 year old poet from San Antonio, TX who moved to Austin with the intent to graduate from the University of Texas at Austin with B.A. in English and African & African Diaspora Studies in 2015. This is huge, because it means I will be the first person in my family to graduate college. For a lot of my peers on campus, going to class is dreaded, uninteresting, or normal. For me, it is a constant reminder of the libraries my mother took me to as a kid; the free museum days; the Saturdays I spent with my mother at Barnes & Noble learning to speed read chapter books because we couldn't afford to buy any to take home; and the fact that my mom expected me to go to college, even if my immediate surroundings didn't reflect that expectation.

I am in need of $4,000 to pay back a loan I owe to UT Austin. The university requires that I pay the loan back in full before the end of May in order to continue my education. Since I could not pay the loan (originally around $4,700) back before the start of this semester, I temporarily dropped out to work as a cashier and production team member at a local thrift store, making barely enough to cover rent and small payments on the loan. I used all my savings to make loan payments and now I am in need of your help.

During my past five semesters at UT, I have served as the co-founder and leader of UT Spitshine Poetry Slam, an on-campus poetry organization dedicated to building the community of college poets. Earlier last month, UT Spitshine won the collegiate national poetry slam, CUPSI, bringing the much needed diverse voices of UT to the national stage and recognition to our school. On campus, I am a member of the Longhorn Scholars Program, Liberal Arts Honors, and an active voice within the African & African Diaspora Studies department. I would like to graduate from this university imbued with the strength of my ancestors and knowledge of their achievements, a better understanding of both my tongues (English & Spanish), and a plan to continue my creative pursuits. Please help me finish the work I have started!

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize some of us have access to more or less resources than others, so if you are not able to contribute financially, please share this link with your friends & family & social media! Help spread the word! I appreciate support in all the forms that it comes.

Thank you!

- Ariana

story:
Firstly a huge thank you for your time and interest in our exciting project!

We are offering you the chance to exclusively pre-order multi-activity gift vouchers for babies, toddlers and young families to enjoy so we can launch them in the UK and then internationally!  And we'll be giving you a special discount to thank you for being there with us from the beginning and supporting us :)

Quick round up of everything

Here is what we want to do and why in brief:

  • We have provided information and advice on children's classes and activities for 8 years in the UK with our websites www.whatson4littleones.co.uk and www.whatson4schoolkids.co.uk - and also in Australia, Ireland, Singapore and Switzerland.
  • We know how important these activities are to families and have run a unique awards programme to celebrate the best since 2007.
  • We want help more parents and children to experience more activities.
  • We can do this by launching a multi-activity gift voucher in the UK and beyond.
  • Gift experiences are a well established and growing market and our gift voucher would be unique 
  • We are able to make this a success as we have a network of thousands of activity providers and hundreds of thousands of people that are interested in activities and classes.
  • You can help make this happen by pre-ordering your gift vouchers today and those special little people in your life can then benefit from this opportunity too.

No-Quibble Guarantee

You will be able to use the vouchers where you want or you get your money back!

If the activity, class or club that you want to spend your gift vouchers with does not accept them then we will give you all your money back!

You cannot lose!

Please include a comment with any activities that you want to be part of the scheme and we will let them know all about it.

Let's tell you some more ...

Award-winning people, awarding others

What's On 4 is a group of award-winning online guides that provide information on activities, groups and classes in the UK, Ireland, Australia, Switzerland and Singapore and over 1 million people use our websites every year!  

But we are just a very small company set up 8 years ago so so we could enjoy a flexible way of working around our families. 

And it’s not just websites, our fantastic awards programme have been rewarding the people that provide children's activities for 7 years and we have presented over 200 awards across the world with hundreds of thousands nominations and votes cast. 

Even Susan Boyle supported our What’s On 4 Junior awards in 2013 and promoted a group based in Scotland that went on to win Most Outstanding Baby & Toddler Group!

Activities make a difference

Through our websites and awards we have seen first-hand how much the thousands of activities running every day mean to the parents and children. 

Just a few of the reasons why activities for our young children are so important:

  • Socialisation and learning life skills

  • Support network for parents

  • Introduce music, dance, sport, art, arts, education, language and more - fostering interest from a young age

  • Parents and children doing an activity together and enjoying quality, focussed time

  • Improve health and well-being for all the family - at a time when obesity levels are of on going concern

But don’t take our word for it, this just a taste of some of the heart-felt reasons parents gave in 2013 for nominating their local activities in our awards:

“This class has changed my sons life - he has become confident- sociable and he has learnt colours and numbers through this great class”

“Amazing opportunity for little ones to be exposed to foreign languages. I take my six month baby and we sing songs - listen to stories and play games/crafts. Good fun but educational- providing something our schools lack.”

“She dedicated so much time and effort in to her classes and really has enriched new parents life's and offered support not just a weekly class x”

“A fantastic pre-school fitness and dance programme that all mums should know about!  It really gets them moving for the entire session.”
“The classes are so much fun and so educational.  The children really get a lot out of them.”

“Jenny works so hard to give every baby a wonderful experience - every week without fail. She takes time to get to know each child and parents feel welcome as a result. Every class that my baby and I go to really is the highlight of our week! All our friends love her sessions too. Everyone needs a jenny in their life.”

And there is another side to the benefits of activities -  many are led by Mums and Dads looking for a way to earn a living whilst working flexibly around their families and this is goes to the heart of What’s On 4 too.

Giving the gift of education, activity and fun!

The benefits to the parents and young children and the activity leaders themselves are immense SO we want to do even more to help families get out there and try new activities and classes.

One of the ways we can do this is launch a multi-activity gift voucher to encourage more families to try new activities in their local area.  Friends and family can give the gift vouchers as a present and it is a great alternative to the latest plastic toy or video game.  There is an already strong and growing trend of giving experience days and leisure vouchers and our gift vouchers would be very similar.

The gift voucher will be purchased on-line via our websites and can be used with 1000s of activities.  We will use our huge database of activities and our close connections with the biggest providers to sign up 100s of companies and individuals that offer these activities and classes. 

Activities we work with include Baby Sensory, Jo Jingles, Monkey Music, Water Babies, Gymboree, LCF Clubs, Little Kickers, Socatots, Debutots, Talking Tots, TinyTalk, Sing and Sign, Baby College, Tumble Tots, Musical Minis, Creation Station, Caterpillar Music, Mad Academy, Diddidance and many, many more.

But don't forget you have a no-quibble guarantee that you will receive a full refund if the activity where you want to spend your gift vouchers is not accepting them.

We can even promote the gift vouchers as a present on our party website www.whatson4kidsparties.co.uk

We will start in the UK but then rapidly roll out the gift vouchers across our websites in Ireland, Australia, Singapore and Switzerland, and new countries as they join us.

So far we have tested the concept by running a small promotion in November and December in the UK, Ireland, Australia in Singapore promoting individual activities gift vouchers in the run up to Christmas. 

Many companies offer gift vouchers for their own activity but there is no combined gift voucher scheme that we know of anywhere in the world.  We would be ground-breaking just like we were with our What’s On 4 Awards over 7 years ago.

OK – so this won’t bring about world peace but it will help many adults and children in small but significant ways – and could be life changing to some….(Andy Murray started learning tennis aged 5 – together we could inspire the next generation of sports elite!)

What’s On 4 has a history of supporting people, communities and other small businesses.  We launched our awards to recognise the many people out there making a difference by providing brilliant activities both commercially and on a volunteer basis.  Our awards have grown and grown and it is our pleasure that we continue to recognise people in this way.

Our gift vouchers would give many more parents and their young children a chance to experience the benefits of activities.  Often it is the small everyday things that help and we know that these activities do just that.

What do you get by pre-ordering your gift vouchers?


As well as a lovely warm feeling that you are helping us, 1000s of people and their families and 1000s of activity leaders and their families you will also get your gift vouchers at a discount as a thank you - you will receive your gift vouchers as soon as we launch in your country.  You can use these yourself or give the gift of education and activity to a member of your family or a friend.

And don't forget the no-quibble guarantee - you will be able to use the vouchers where you want or you get your money back!

We also have a number of additional perks… you could come to our What's on 4 Awards ceremony in June or even become a What’s On 4 Award sponsor!

And if you're not interested in the gift vouchers but still think it's a good idea and want to support us you can contribute just £5 to receive a thank you on Twitter and a thank you in the post in the rather yummy form of an especially made Owow Chocolate just for you!  A full size Oreo covered in thick Belgian chocolate, oh yes!

Our project is a big one but we are only a small business and need your help to get up and running

By pre-ordering your gift vouchers, you will help us generate the funds to develop this idea but even more importantly you will be showing that it is a good idea this in turn will help us to sign up multiple national and international activity providers so we can really launch with a bang.

These are the things that pre-ordering your gift vouchers will fund:

  • Design – Finalise the design of the gift vouchers with our designer (the one we have done here is a draft version) Plus additional design work for the website, leaflets, brochures etc

  • Tech – We have quite a bit of work here to design, build and test this lot but it will be worth it:  create a gift voucher purchase and fulfilment area of our websites, a gift voucher validation area within our new app and update our websites to enable gift voucher holders to find activities where their vouchers can be used.

  • Partners – Create a prospectus and sign up our activity providers, many have given early indications they want to be part of the scheme.  There is no cost to the providers, we just take a commission from the redeemed vouchers.

  • Process – Document the process including clear instruction for providers

  • Legal – Boring but necessary as we need our lawyer to a) create a commercial contract between us and the activity providers b) create the T&Cs for the gift voucher

  • Train – Train our team, franchisees, sales teams and providers on the process

  • Launch – Let our database of over 60,000+ newsletter subscribers, 100,000+ social media followers and our press network know all about the gift vouchers. 

  • Build an on-going promotion campaign.

  • Prepare for the International roll out

We hope to be ready to launch in the UK in June 2014 and before the end of 2014 in other countries.

What will happen if we don’t meet our target

We will still develop our gift vouchers, it will just take longer.  We believe that the gift vouchers are a great idea and that we are ideally placed to make it happen.  We now just need a little help from you.

Whatever happens we will keep you posted and updated regularly as we progress.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute to our project directly you can still help us.  The more people that know about our project, our websites and our awards then the more people that will get involved in the many activities out there.  Please tell your friends.

If you run an activity for children and would like to be one of our providers by accepting our gift vouchers please let us know by emailing gift@whatson4.co.uk 

Thank yous

A few special people that have enabled us to get this far.  Thank you all so much :)

The friends and family that have given us feedback, our HQ team, our franchisees, Toby at TRS Design Agency  (working with us for over 6 years!) and Owow Chocolates (yum!).

And everyone who uses our websites already and the many thousands of activity providers that list their activities with us.

More information

For more information about us please visit www.whatson4.co.uk.

You can go directly to our 2 UK websites that will be part of the gift voucher scheme at www.whatson4littleones.co.uk and www.whatson4schoolkids.co.uk

Australian contributors please visit www.whatson4.com.au
Irish contributors please visit www.whatson4.ie
Swiss contributors please visit www.whatson4.ch
Singaporean contributors please visit www.whatson4.com.sg

Thank you so much for your support

From Sam and Suzanne and all of the What's On 4 team

What's On 4 is a group of award-winning
online guides that provide information on activities, groups and classes in the
UK, Ireland, Australia, Switzerland and Singapore and over 1 million people use
our websites every year!  But we are just
a very small company set up 8 years ago so so we could enjoy a flexible 
way of working around our families.  And it’s not just websites, our fantastic awards programme have been rewarding
the people that provide children's activities for 7 years and we have presented
over 200 awards across the world with hundreds of thousands nominations and votes cast.  Even
Susan Boyle supported our What’s On 4 Junior awards
in 2013 and promoted a group based in Scotland that went on to win Most Outstanding Baby
& Toddler Group!Activities make a differenceThrough
our websites and awards we have seen first-hand how much the thousands of
activities running every day mean to the parents and children.  
Just a
few of the reasons why activities for our young children are so
important:

Socialisation
and learning life skills
Support
network for parents
Introduce
music, dance, sport, art, arts, education, language and more - fostering interest from a young age
Parents
and children doing an activity together and enjoying quality, focussed time 
Improve
health and well-being for all the family - at a time when obesity levels are of on going concern
But don’t
take our word for it, this just a taste of some of the heart-felt reasons
parents gave in 2013 for nominating their local activities in our awards:
“This class has changed my sons life - he has become
confident- sociable and he has learnt colours and numbers through this great
class”
“Amazing opportunity for little ones to
be exposed to foreign languages. I take my six month baby and we sing songs -
listen to stories and play games/crafts. Good fun but educational- providing
something our schools lack.”
“She dedicated so much time and effort
in to her classes and really has enriched new parents life's and offered
support not just a weekly class x”
“A fantastic pre-school fitness and dance programme that all mums should know
about!  It really gets them moving for
the entire session.”
“The classes are so much fun and so educational.  The children really get a lot out of them.”
“Jenny
works so hard to give every baby a wonderful experience - every
week without fail. She takes time to get to know each child and parents feel
welcome as a result. Every class that my baby and I go to really is the
highlight of our week! All our friends love her sessions too. Everyone needs a
jenny in their life.”
And there
is another side to the benefits of activities -  many are led by Mums and Dads
looking for a way to earn a living whilst working flexibly around their
families and this is goes to the heart of What’s On 4 too.
Giving the gift of education, activity and fun!

The benefits to the parents and young children and the
activity leaders themselves are immense SO we want to do even more to help families
get out there and try new activities and classes.

One of
the ways we can do this is launch a multi-activity gift voucher to encourage
more families to try new activities in their local area.  Friends and family can give the gift vouchers
as a present and it is a great alternative to the latest plastic toy or video
game.  There is an already strong and
growing trend of giving experience days and leisure vouchers and our gift
vouchers would be very similar.
The gift
voucher will be purchased on-line via our websites and can be used with 1000s of
activities.  We will use our huge
database of activities and our close connections with the biggest providers to
sign up 100s of companies and individuals that offer these activities and
classes.  Activities we work with include Baby Sensory, Jo Jingles, Monkey Music, Water Babies, Gymboree, LCF Clubs, Little Kickers, Socatots, Debutots, Talking Tots, TinyTalk, Sing and Sign, Baby College, Tumble Tots, Musical Minis, Creation Station, Caterpillar Music, Mad Academy, Diddidance and many, many more.But don't forget you have a no-quibble guarantee that you will receive a full refund if the activity where you want to spend your gift vouchers is not accepting them.We can even promote the gift vouchers as a present on our party website www.whatson4kidsparties.co.uk

We will start in the UK but then rapidly roll out the gift vouchers across our
websites in Ireland, Australia, Singapore and Switzerland, and new countries as
they join us.
So far we
have tested the concept by running a small promotion in November and December
in the UK, Ireland, Australia in Singapore promoting individual activities gift
vouchers in the run up to Christmas.  
Many companies offer gift vouchers for their own activity but there is no combined
gift voucher scheme that we know of anywhere in the world.  We would be ground-breaking just like we were
with our What’s On 4 Awards over 7 years ago.


OK – so this won’t bring about world peace but it will help
many adults and children in small but significant ways – and could be life
changing to some….(Andy Murray started learning tennis aged 5 – together we
could inspire the next generation of sports elite!)

What’s On
4 has a history of supporting people, communities and other small businesses.  We launched our awards to recognise the many
people out there making a difference by providing brilliant activities both commercially
and on a volunteer basis.  Our awards
have grown and grown and it is our pleasure that we continue to recognise
people in this way.
Our gift vouchers would give many more parents and their young children a
chance to experience the benefits of activities.  Often it is the small everyday things that help
and we know that these activities do just that.What do you get by pre-ordering your gift vouchers?
As well as a lovely warm feeling that you are helping us, 1000s of people and
their families and 1000s of activity leaders and their families you will also
get your gift vouchers at a discount as a thank you - you will receive your gift vouchers as soon as we launch in your country.  You can use these yourself or give the gift of
education and activity to a member of your family or a friend.And don't forget the no-quibble guarantee - you will be able to use the vouchers where you want or you get your money back!
We also
have a number of additional perks… you could come to our What's on 4 Awards ceremony in
June or even become a What’s On 4 Award sponsor!And if you're not interested in the gift vouchers but still think it's a good idea and want to support us you can contribute just £5 to receive a thank you on Twitter and a thank you in the post in the rather yummy form of an especially made Owow Chocolate just for you!  A full size Oreo covered in thick Belgian chocolate, oh yes!Our project is a big one but we are only a small business and need your help to get up and runningBy pre-ordering your gift vouchers, you will help us generate the funds to develop this idea but even more importantly you will be showing that it is a good idea this
in turn will help us to sign up multiple national and international activity
providers so we can really launch with a bang.These are the things that pre-ordering your gift vouchers will fund:
Design – Finalise the design of the gift vouchers with our designer (the one we have done here is a draft version) Plus additional design work for the website, leaflets, brochures etc
Tech – We have quite a bit of work here to design, build and test this lot but it will be worth it:  create a gift voucher purchase and fulfilment area of our websites, a gift voucher validation area within our new app and update our websites to enable gift voucher holders to find activities where their vouchers can be used.
Partners – Create a prospectus and sign up our activity providers, many have given early indications they want to be part of the scheme.  There is no cost to the providers, we just take a commission from the redeemed vouchers.
 Process – Document the process including clear instruction for providers
Legal – Boring but necessary as we need our lawyer to a) create a commercial contract between us and the activity providers b) create the T&Cs for the gift voucher
Train – Train our team, franchisees, sales teams and providers on the process
Launch – Let our database of over 60,000+ newsletter subscribers, 100,000+ social media followers and our press network know all about the gift vouchers.  
Build an on-going promotion campaign.
Prepare for the International roll out
We hope to be ready to launch in the UK in June 2014 and before the end of 2014 in other countries.What will happen if we don’t meet
our target

We will still develop our gift vouchers, it will just take longer.  We believe that the gift vouchers are a great
idea and that we are ideally placed to make it happen.  We now just need a little help from you.Whatever
happens we will keep you posted and updated regularly as we progress.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t contribute to our project directly you can
still help us.  The more people that know
about our project, our websites and our awards then the more people that will
get involved in the many activities out there. 
Please tell your friends.If you run an activity for children and would like to be one of our providers by accepting our gift vouchers please let us know by emailing gift@whatson4.co.uk Thank yousA few special people that have enabled us to get this far.  Thank you all so much :)The friends and family that have given us feedback, our HQ team, our franchisees, Toby at TRS Design Agency  (working with us for over 6 years!) and Owow Chocolates (yum!).And everyone who uses our websites already and the many thousands of activity providers that list their activities with us.More information
For more information about us please visit www.whatson4.co.uk. 
You can go directly to our 2 UK websites that will be part
of the gift voucher scheme at www.whatson4littleones.co.uk
and www.whatson4schoolkids.co.uk
Australian
contributors please visit www.whatson4.com.auIrish contributors please visit www.whatson4.ieSwiss contributors please visit www.whatson4.chSingaporean contributors please
visit www.whatson4.com.sg 
Thank you so much for your supportFrom Sam and Suzanne and all of the What's On 4 team

story:
_______________________________________________________________________

Thank you everyone!!

We reached our goal of $4000 (and then some). THANK YOU so much to all the generous people who contributed to this project...

... To my friends in California who donated books, and the local bookstores Know Knew and Bell's Books, who let me wheel and deal until I had the collection we wanted

... To everyone who contributed to this Indiegogo campaign, to cover the costs of books, shipping, furniture, and other supplies for the library

... To my friends at Around Morocco Tours, for introducing me to this school in the first place and for providing my transportation in Morocco

With everything we take for granted in the West, we cannot imagine what it would be like to study without a single book. This library will make a huge difference in the lives of a lot of hard-working and very nice people -- and it will strengthen friendship and peace in the world. THANK YOU!!

_______________________________________________________________________


Share the Gift of 
Literacy and Learning

A great library inspires a love of learning and opens minds to the possibilities in life and the wonders of the world. Let's extend a hand from West to East, and share our bounty with this English school for at-need students in Erfoud, Morocco, by helping them build a library.

This program, called English Access, is the best opportunity for students in Morocco to learn English -- a skill that will help them enormously in life and will bridge the gap between East and West. The program has about 50 students a year, boys and girls equally. They study here after school and on weekends -- so they are very motivated to master English. In order to qualify for this program, these young people must be excellent students in high school and must come from families who wouldn't normally be able to afford a program like this. So, this opportunity to study English is a huge boost for the students and their families, and one they fully appreciate.

The teachers at this school are excellent, and the city of Erfoud has provided space for the school in its cultural center. But the school has NO BOOKS to read and precious few other learning materials. Together, we can change that! A little from us will go a long way.


Say Hello to Some
of the Students...

After becoming friends with a family in Erfoud last year, I went back in January 2014 and visited this school. We brought a few English dictionaries for the school, and I couldn't believe how the students lit up with happiness over such a modest gift. I wanted to learn more, so I spent time with this great group of people. It was clear to me that the students here have big dreams and are thirsty for books to read in English.

These students are college bound -- the first in their families -- and in a few years, they'll be leaders in their community and a bridge to the English-speaking world. And keep in mind that this school educates a talented group of 50 students like this year after year!

I was so impressed by both the students and the teachers here that I wanted to help them build a library and resource center for learning English. I'm working closely with Abdelghani, the teacher you see on the left side of the photo above, so that everything provided is appropriate and truly needed.


A Resource for
the Whole Community

There's a huge amount of interest in learning English in Morocco, but very few resources to make it possible. After gathering input on our idea, we decided the library should include books for all reading levels. Although the core group of users will be the Access students, this library will be open to the whole community around Erfoud, including young children, students from English classes in high schools, and students from college home for the summer. We have a starting collection of 500 great books given by generous donors and bookstores in the US: from preschool to beginning reader to high school to adult -- including literature (classics and modern), science and technology, art, nature, poetry, plays, and puzzle books. 

Abdelghani and I are doing this project with blessings from the Moroccan Association of Teachers of English (MATE), which does a lot of positive things in support of English and technology learning in Morocco. The library will be an official MATE Access Resource Center for eastern Morocco. We're off to a phenomenal start!


How We'll Use the Funds

Everyone on this project is donating their time and paying their own expenses, so every dollar you give will go directly into books, furniture, shipping, and supplies for the library. 

The city of Erfoud is providing a location for the library, with two rooms (albeit empty). Now we need to raise funds. Our plans for $4000 are to:

  • Ship our collection of books from the US, and purchase additional books in Morocco. For the most part, collecting and shipping books from the US is still more cost-effective than buying the books in Morocco, and many of these books are not available there.
  • Purchase other reading and learning materials in Morocco. This will include a variety of English as a Foreign Language materials that the teachers need and other school supplies.
  • Buy basic furniture for the library; a table, chairs, and two bookshelves.

Our goal beyond $4000 will be to continue building out the library, making it a valuable resource center for English learners from all over eastern Morocco. There is much to do! Additional funds would be used to:

  • Purchase Kindles for students to use while in the Access program, and set up Amazon credit for the school to purchase ebooks when needed.
  • Purchase more books and instructional materials, in collaboration with the teachers and in response to community needs as the resource evolves.
  • Buy additional furniture to fully outfit the library.
  • Buy a computer and scanning software for a database and check-out system.
  • Provide reading materials for the school's popular English summer camp for younger students.

It is our hope that this library will grow over time and become an inspiring resource for even more people to learn English. In spite of a widespread desire to learn English, there are very few English libraries or bookstores in Morocco -- and this library will be the first in this part of the country.


What You'll Get in Return

For one thing, good karma... By donating to this library:

  • You'll make a huge difference in the lives of 50 smart, motivated students and their larger community -- year after year.
  • You will also make the world a better and more peaceful place, by helping people in this North African nation who genuinely want to engage with us in the Western world.

When you make your donation, if you'd like please communicate with the students -- they would love it:

  • Add a message for the students in the Comments section of this Indiegogo page, and I'll make sure your message is included on a card I deliver to them this summer.

For some donations, I'll also bring a handmade item back from Morocco for you. The traditional arts are alive and well in Morocco, including some of the world's most gorgeous mosaics, ceramics, textiles, and ironwork. A walk through the souks in a place like Marrakech is an experience to cherish.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

To Learn More

If you'd like to learn more about MATE, the English Access program in Erfoud, and the Access program throughout Morocco:

MATE Access Morocco Facebook Page
US Micro-scholarships for Access Schools

Erfoud (or Arfoud) is a rapidly growing oasis city of about 25,000 close to the Sahara desert. It has become one of the main cities in eastern Morocco, and the population is primarily Berber. Many of the families have settled here fairly recently after a more nomadic way of life. To learn more:

Wikipedia page on Erfoud

This Access student is one of several from Erfoud currently participating 
in the National English Spelling Bee of Morocco (May 2014).

story:
Intro

Those who ride understand the joy of getting out on a bike and pedaling into the woods! Help us spread that joy to the new generation of riders by bringing the Sprockids program to Port Alberni.

The Port Alberni Cycling Club (PACC) is a volunteer group dedicated to promoting local bike riding and we want to bring the Sprockids program to the Alberni Valley during the spring/summer of 2014! The program’s mission statement is: “Through the sport of mountain biking young people will have the opportunity to develop the skills, values, and strategies that will guide them throughout their lives and enable them to successfully reach their full potential.” We hope to use this program to help kids get into the sport by providing them with instruction and support so they can shred on their own, safely and responsibly.


We need your help with getting this volunteer-run program up and running! Hopefully you’ll see the value in getting kids out on their bikes, having fun, enjoying the natural beauty of Vancouver Island and building confidence in themselves.

What We Need

We are looking for a minimum of $850 to help with the following:

1.  Funds to offset volunteer training costs: asking people to donate time isn’t cheap! We’ll be sending a group of enthusiastic bikers from Port Alberni to participate in Sprockids leader training in Campbell River in March 2014, and would appreciate your help in lowering the cost of this training.

2.  Program startup costs: this includes promotional materials, safety equipment, and club & insurance fees.

If we don’t reach our goal, the funds we do raise will be divided evenly among the volunteer leaders to help lower their training costs. If we exceed our goal, we'll put the extra funds towards making the program even more accessible to future shredders, by reducing equipment costs and program fees for participants!

What You Get

Everybody who contributes will be helping us get kids on their bikes, helping them enjoy an awesome recreational activity, and building a community of responsible and enthusiastic riders! In addition you’ll receive the following when you contribute the following amounts:

$10 contribution: (40 available) PACC sticker

$35 contribution: (20 available) PACC T-shirt

$100 contribution:  (5 available) A guided mountain bike ride with a PACC member!

$500 contribution: (1 available) A custom, one-of-a-kind wood carving by local artisan Randy Atleo. Full size (5.5') western red cedar paddle!

Eligible contributors will be contacted by the PACC to make arrangements to receive their perk.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks for checking out our campaign! We hope you’re just as stoked as we are to helping a new generation of riders get out and enjoy their bikes. Even if you can’t contribute right now, you can help us out by spreading the word about the campaign and supporting local initiatives and businesses that encourage a healthy lifestyle! Check out sprockids.com for more information about the program and pacyclers.com for more info about our club.

story:
Thai Education 

A few weeks ago I went to Thailand for a month long adventure. I had won a travel grant through my high school. Without the grant I would not have been able to travel to the most beautiful country I have ever seen or meet such wonderful children. I traveled with Rustic Pathways on a trip called Come with Nothing, Go Home Rich. The program name is not a joke. If you come, you can only pack one light bag. I quickly became close friends with Julie who is currently working on this project with me. During our trip we stopped at the Rustic Pathway's Children Home. Here is some of the background history about the Children's Home. 

"In 2001, David Venning – the Chairman and Founder of Rustic Pathways – stumbled across the Baan Rai School, which provides an education and support system for more than 300 Karen children. Since then, Rustic has supported this school and come to love these children and the amazing teachers who sacrifice so much to give them an education and an opportunity for a better life. They are respectful, gentle, happy young folks with great spirits and broad smiles.

To celebrate its 25th anniversary in 2008, they began construction on a new facility that serves as a boarding house. Since then, a total of 49 students have been supported through the Children’s Home. Their mission is to provide these students the opportunity to graduate high school and increase their likelihood of attending a facility of higher education and learning skills to better prepare them for adult life.

Rustic Pathways supplies accommodation, covers operating costs such as electricity and water, and provides several full-time supervisors at the facility to oversee the needs of the children. Rustic Pathways welcomes sponsors who can step in to cover food costs and school fees for the sponsored child."

(Source: http://rusticpathways.com/thailand/the-hill-tribe-support-project)

Once Julie and I came back home we started thinking about ways to give back to the Thai children we had met. Finally we figured out what we wanted to do. We decided we would raise money to sponsor Thai children and help them get the education they deserve.  

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise here will go directly to The Child Sponsorship Program through Rustic Pathways. The cost of a one-year sponsorship for one child is US $ 550 – about $ 1.50 per day.  This cost covers food for the child we sponsor, school uniforms, school fees, and a weekly allowance for the child to use for personal items. More than that, it enables a child to receive the intangibles of the Rustic Pathways Children’s Home - loving staff, close friends, a window into the outside world, and a path to a brighter future for themselves and their Karen people. This is where you all come in. We are hoping to sponsor at least two children this year. 

The additional money will be used to pay for the second year of education for the two children. 

The Impact

"The Karen people are one of many Hill Tribe groups who have lived in the mountains along the Thai-Burma border for centuries.  Karen people living on the Thai-side of the border have long been marginalized by Thai authorities and have struggled to gain access to basic public services like health care and education. The Karen people living on the Burma-side of the border face violent persecution at the hands of the ruling junta. Many Karen youth are struggling to balance the recent past in which their parents lived in a subsistence economy in traditional, isolated Karen villages with their goals for a future in an increasingly modern and global world. They need earnest support, strong education, and to develop relevant skills to enable them to take an active role in the larger Thai society, as well as contribute to the development and preservation of their home-villages and precious culture.

Many Karen children must leave their families behind and travel to urban areas to continue their education. Most Karen families, thrust into an economy without the resources or skills to compete, are now poor, and they cannot support the basic costs for further education in urban centers, such as food, housing, uniforms and books or basic spending money. These young children live on the edges of urban life as they seek access to affordable, quality and relevant education that will enable them to find employment to support their families and build a future."

(Source: http://www.rusticpathways.org/hilltribesupport....) 

*****By donating you will help families across the world send their children to school****

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate any money that's okay! You can still help us by sharing our campaign through social media. We want word to get out so others who can donate will come across our page. 

What Else Are We Doing

Julie and I are working on having a bake sale in Central Park, New York. We are hoping to raise some money through the bake sale but it won't be nearly enough to sponsor two Thai students. Please help us and donate! Remember, the Thai Children we will sponsor only need about $1.50 each day in order to receive a great education at the Children's Home.
story_txt:
Thai Education 
A few weeks ago I went to Thailand for a month long adventure. I had won
a travel grant through my high school. Without the grant I would not have been
able to travel to the most beautiful country I have ever seen or meet such wonderful children.
I traveled with Rustic Pathways on a trip called Come with Nothing, Go Home
Rich. The program name is not a joke. If you come, you can
only pack one light bag. I quickly became close friends with Julie who is currently working on this project with me. During our trip we stopped at the Rustic Pathway's
Children Home. Here is some of the background history about the Children's
Home. 
"In 2001, David Venning – the Chairman and Founder of Rustic
Pathways – stumbled across the Baan Rai School, which provides an education and
support system for more than 300 Karen children. Since then, Rustic has supported
this school and come to love these children and the amazing teachers who
sacrifice so much to give them an education and an opportunity for a better
life. They are respectful, gentle, happy young folks with great spirits and
broad smiles.
To celebrate its 25th anniversary in 2008, they began construction on a
new facility that serves as a boarding house. Since then, a total of 49
students have been supported through the Children’s Home. Their mission is to
provide these students the opportunity to graduate high school and increase
their likelihood of attending a facility of higher education and learning
skills to better prepare them for adult life.
Rustic Pathways supplies accommodation, covers operating costs such as
electricity and water, and provides several full-time supervisors at the
facility to oversee the needs of the children. Rustic Pathways welcomes
sponsors who can step in to cover food costs and school fees for the sponsored
child."(Source: http://rusticpathways.com/thailand/the-hill-tribe-support-project)
Once Julie and I came back home we started thinking about ways to give
back to the Thai children we had met. Finally we figured out what we wanted to
do. We decided we would raise money to sponsor Thai children and help them get
the education they deserve.

will be used to pay for the second year of education for the two
children.

story:
Any Donation Welcome! A $5 Tax Deductible Donation Brings the Joy of Oneness to More Than 3,500 People! 

What is Oneness?

Oneness is the transfer of universal energy that has been scientifically proven to reduce mind chatter and stress, and increase peace, love, and joy. 

How does it work?

There are two ways this universal energy is transferred:

  • Trained Blessing Givers act as a conduit to transfer the universal energy into the receiver. 

  • Trained Oneness Meditators (OMers) have the ability to transfer the universal energy through their gaze. 

The Event

On May 17 people from all walks of life who can benefit from the gifts of Oneness are coming together at Speckles Organ Pavilion from 10 AM to Noon to experience Oneness through blessings and meditations. 

We're in the process of inviting people from: 

  • Recovery Programs and 12-Step Groups
  • Women's and Homeless Shelters
  • Active Military, Veterans and their families
  • Healthcare and Alternative Health Providers
  • Schools and Higher Education.

How it all started ...

Hi, my name is Deepaa Maria Mazzi and I'm a yoga therapist/teacher, sound bath facilitator and Oneness Blessing Giver. 

(Deepaa in front of the Oneness Temple at Oneness University in southern India.)

Two years ago, Doug Bentley, a monk from the Oneness University in India, asked the Oneness communities across North America to reach out and expand Oneness into their greater communities so that more people can experience Oneness. 

In that moment, I saw the Organ Pavilion in Balboa Park filled beyond capacity - with all the seats taken and people standing in the back and on the wings. Everyone was receiving the blessings of Oneness. When I saw this vision, I felt awed and elated - and I wanted to know how to make this happen. This vision kept popping up over the next two years - getting stronger, clearer, and more compelling each time I saw it. 

I had to go to India to talk to Doug. He told me, if the Divine gave me this vision, it was an invitation and my choice to accept that invitation or not.
I chose to accept. 

The Impact

Your incredibly gracious tax deductible contributions enable us to introduce the blessings of Oneness in a massive way to 

more than 3,500 people! 



   We'll be at the Organ Pavilion in Balboa Park live Saturday, May 17; 10:00am - Noon PST and via Livestream for people worldwide to experience Oneness with us. 

The Livestream address is: www.liveOMTV.com

At the Event there will be:

  • An introduction to Oneness with time for Questions & Answers 
  • 125 Blessing Givers
  • 10 (and counting) Oneness Meditators from around the country on site
  • Geo-centric Information/Resource Tables

Participants and those viewing the LiveStream will receive a new way to: 

  • Reduce Stress
  • Alleviate Suffering
  • Intensify Levels of Happiness, Peace and Love

There is NO CHARGE for this event.

What We Need 

We wanted this event to be free of charge, and the venue doesn't allow donations on site. Below is our entire budget for the program. 

  • Special Audio/Video Equipment for an Outdoor Event - $3,500
  • Printing: Flyers, Brochures, Weekly Blessing Circle Directories, Signs, World Peace Prayer Cards - $2,345
  • Marketing, PR & Advertising - $2,363
  • Oneness Meditator small gift of appreciation - $2,592  (more if we go viral!) 

and What You Get

Each Donation is Tax Deductible 

  • Bronze Level - scroll up to see the goodies!
  • Silver Level - everything in the Bronze level, plus new stuff (scroll up to see)
  • Gold Level - Want to be a Blessing Giverr?  Check out the Gold Level (above)
  • Platinum Level - Want to be a Blessing Giver AND become infused with Wealth Consciousness AND be an honored sponsor of our event? 

If we don't reach our entire goal, we'll still hold the event. 
We'll reduce some activities to lower costs except the Audio/Visual so we can still LiveStream.


And all donation levels will be honored.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can’t contribute, you can still help:

Help us by getting the word out:
  • Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, any social media platform you can think of!
  • Call and email your friends, family, and network 
  • ... please make some noise about our campaign!

Hey, and Indiegogo is awesome! Tell your friends about them, too!

We are so GRATEFUL for your support! You rock! Thank you, thank you, thank you!

Register for this Event please go to: www.ExperienceOneness.us

For information on Oneness please go to: www.OnenessUSA.org

Help us by getting the word out:
Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, any social media platform you can think of!
Call and email your friends, family, and network 

... please make some noise about our campaign!



Hey, and Indiegogo is awesome! Tell your friends about them, too!

We are so GRATEFUL for your support! You rock! Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Register for this Event please go to: www.ExperienceOneness.us

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Theresa Preston I am a mother of a child with Down syndrome.The Lower Mainland Down Syndrome Society has been part of our lives for 25 years.

This organization has helped thousands of individuals including my own child with Down syndrome by providing support, therapy, education,outreach and resources.

The Changing Lives campaign is very important to me as I know first hand the issues that families are faced with as they raise their children with special abilities.


Your donations will go towards providing the necessary workshops, therapies, resources, and the special education that children with Down syndrome require to be given the opportunity to develop their full potential.


What We Need & What You Get

  1. Speech & Language Pathologist 
  2. Oral Placement Therapy 
  3. Music Therapy 
  4. Outreach 
  5. Educational Support 
  6. Occupational Therapy
  7. Resource Materials 

By donating to the Lower Mainland Down Syndrome Society you will be helping to change a live of a person with Down syndrome.

If our goal is not reach we will use the funds that we do get in supporting as many families as possible with the above mentioned items.

The Impact

To change a life of a child will open up doors that you would never think possible. The everyday things that we take for granted are treasured by those who only dream how their life would be if only?


Other Ways You Can Help

At the Lower Mainland Down Syndrome Society we understand that not everyone is able to contribute to our campaign but still want to help. So we encourage you to help us by spreading the word.

story:
Note: Canadian donations receive charitable tax receipts. Read below for more information

Let's provide renewable, reliable energy to four hospitals in Gaza today!

Power outages remain a daily reality in the Gaza strip, lasting more than 16 hours a day. Sick patients are especially vulnerable in hospitals, where insufficient power often decides between life or death. Patients in Gaza are needlessly suffering. We believe there has to be a better way.

Along with doctors and policy-makers in the Palestinian territories and internationally, we have taken a hard look at this problem. The problem is complex, but lots of people have been thinking about it for a long time. We know the solution, and now is the time to implement it – modelled after projects in other parts of Gaza and the world.

As featured on:

                  

      ...and more!

Despite the intense hardships from the ongoing blockade against Gaza, we are inspired by the resilience of Gazans seeking basic health care. The EmpowerGAZA health project will save lives by installing solar panels on four major hospitals in Gaza. This solar energy will provide reliable and green energy 24 hours a day to emergency rooms, intensive care units, and operating theatres.

Solar power will make hospitals self reliant and will empower Gaza hospitals in a sustainable way! Solar power has already had great success in hospitals in Gaza (Shifa, Nasr), Haiti, India, Lebanon and Nepal — now it's time to energize Gaza!

Solar power is a long term solution to:

  • Expensive and polluting diesel for the current generators used to power hospitals.
  • Ongoing, regular power outages in the hospitals.
  • Providing health care services and life saving treatments in the hospital's critical units.

In partnership with:

        

The Energy Crisis

The current energy supply infrastructure in each hospital provides precarious, unpredictable and unreliable power to the most critically ill and vulnerable members of Palestinian society, particularly during periods of conflict, when there are drastic increases in Emergency Department, Operating Room and Intensive Care Unit (ICU) admissions. Securing a sustainable and reliable energy source to power these critical units is necessary in order to provide safe emergency and intensive medical care.

The Solar Energy Solution

Providing Gaza’s hospitals with a source of sustainable, reliable and renewable energy will decrease risks to the most vulnerable patients. Solar powered energy systems provides an eco-friendly, renewable and sustainable alternative, replacing expensive and unreliable emergency power provided by dirty and expensive diesel generators.

The long-term conversion to solar-powered energy will guarantee a working and self-supporting power supply to the hospital's daily operation.

The Objective: Empower Gaza

  1. Empower Gaza to run the most critical units in hospitals 24 hours a day without the need for expensive diesel.
  2. Empower Gazans to have a renewable, reliable source of energy for intensive care units, operating rooms and emergency departments.

Empowering Gaza: One Major Obstacle is Funding

EmpowerGAZA is a joint initiative of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and Islamic Relief Canada to provide a renewable, reliable source of energy for intensive care units (ICUs), Operating Rooms and Emergency Departments.

We have planned as much as possible for the success of this project. The UNDP will be handling the logistics on the ground and we have all permits and permissions necessary to move forward.

The next important step for the project to succeed is raising the funds to complete the project.

Each hospital will cost USD$200,000 (with the exception of the larger European Hospital which will cost $600 000 USD), with solar panels to go up beginning January 2016.

This Indiegogo campaign aims to fund the first hospital, with stretch goals to fund the other three.

We have broken down the project by hospital, cost and current timeline:

Name of Hospital Location Cost (USD$) Timeline
Al Aqsa Hospital Deir Al Balah $200 000 January 2016
Kamal Adwan Hospital Beit Lahiya $200 000 June 2016
European Hospital Khan Younis $600 000 January 2017
Rantisi Pediatric Hospital Gaza City $200 000 June 2017

Total: USD$1.2 million (~CAD$1.55 million)

Help by Donating

Donate whatever amount you can. This is a ground-breaking project that will change the course of current health care in Gaza. Be a part of it!

Donate by Cheque

You may donate by cheque! Please make your cheque out to Islamic Relief Canada, and put 'Empower Gaza' in the memo line.

Send to:

Tarek Loubani
Division of Emergency Medicine
London Health Sciences Centre
800 Commissioners Rd. E
London, Ontario
N6A 5W9

Help by Sharing

Share this campaign with your friends, family and colleagues around the world via email and social media!

Press releases are available in English, French, Spanish, and Arabic.

Who Can I Contact?

For more information about this project, please get in touch with us:

  • By email: info@empowergaza.org
  • By Twitter: @empowergaza
  • On Facebook

You may also contact Dr. Tarek Loubani (tarek@tarek.org), Dr. Ben Thomson (ben@benthomson.org), Dr. Dalal Dahrouj (dalal.dahrouj@medportal.ca) or Amy Miller (amy@resist.ca) if you are interested in more details.

Can I Receive a Charitable Tax Receipt if I donate?

YES! We can offer Canadians charitable tax receipts, issued via Islamic Relief Canada. All tax receipts will be issued and mailed out in January 2016  after receipt of payment by Islamic Relief Canada, and a follow up email will be sent to ensure reception.

Let's do this together!

A project of this scale and scope relies on the support of hundreds of people from around the world. Thank you for your interest and your support. The time is now. Solar panels for Gaza hospitals today!

EmpowerGAZA in the Media

EmpowerGAZA has generated considerable buzz and interest already!

United States

  • Huffington Post- Solar Panels Could Save Patients In Gaza's Hospitals Thanks to a New Fundraising Campaign
  • Mother Jones- How Solar Panels Could Save Lives in War Torn Gaza
  • Electronic Intifada- Solar panels on Gaza Hospitals aim to ease healthcare disaster

Canada

  • CBC Radio As it Happens- Canadian doctor wants to bring solar energy to Gaza hospitals
  • Montreal Gazette: Doctors Generating Support for Gaza Hospitals
  • SustainableJoes #RETHINK: EmpowerGAZA- A necessary, sustainable healthcare solution
  • London Free Press: London Solar Panel Project Expected to Save Lives in Gaza Strip
  • Radio Canada International: EmpowerGAZA veut ramener la lumière dans les hôpitaux
  • EmpowerGAZA para terminar con los apagones en los hospitales de Gaza
  • Presse Gauche: Des médecins canadiens lancent une campagne pour l’installation de panneaux solaires sur les toits des hôpitaux de Gaza
  • CKUT: Off the hour discusses EmpowerGAZA
  • Under the Olive Tree: Hospitals of Gaza

United Kingdom

  • Middle East Monitor: Doctors launch campaign to install solar panels on Gaza hospitals

Italy

  • Fotovoltacio off grid per salvare i malati e i feriti di Gaza

Turkey

  • The New Turkey: Doctors launch campaign to install solar panels on Gaza hospitals
  • Kanadli Doktor Gazza Hastanelerine Günes Enerjisi Getirmek Istiyor

EmpowerGAZA has generated considerable buzz and interest already!
United States
Huffington Post- Solar Panels Could Save Patients In Gaza's Hospitals Thanks to a New Fundraising Campaign

Mother Jones- How Solar Panels Could Save Lives in War Torn Gaza


Electronic Intifada- Solar panels on Gaza Hospitals aim to ease healthcare disaster

Canada


CBC Radio As it Happens- Canadian doctor wants to bring solar energy to Gaza hospitals


Montreal Gazette: Doctors Generating Support for Gaza Hospitals


SustainableJoes #RETHINK: EmpowerGAZA- A necessary, sustainable healthcare solution

London Free Press: London Solar Panel Project Expected to Save Lives in Gaza Strip
Radio Canada International: EmpowerGAZA veut ramener la lumière dans les hôpitaux

EmpowerGAZA para terminar con los apagones en los hospitales de Gaza

Presse Gauche: Des médecins canadiens lancent une campagne pour l’installation de panneaux solaires sur les toits des hôpitaux de Gaza
CKUT: Off the hour discusses EmpowerGAZA
Under the Olive Tree: Hospitals of Gaza

United Kingdom

Middle East Monitor: Doctors launch campaign to install solar panels on Gaza hospitals

Italy

Fotovoltacio off grid per salvare i malati e i feriti di Gaza

Turkey

The New Turkey: Doctors launch campaign to install solar panels on Gaza hospitals

Kanadli Doktor Gazza Hastanelerine Günes Enerjisi Getirmek Istiyor

story:
Welcome.

Short Summary

Hello, our names are Lily and Rachel and we are both undergraduate students at Mills College in Oakland, CA. 

A little about Lily is that she is majoring in nursing with the hope to work in low income districts around the United States, with a focus on the social determinants of health in specific communities as well as working on international level to help provide accessible healthcare to mothers and children. Lily has been to Haiti and worked in the Reveil Matinal Orphanage twice since the winter of her senior year in high school in 2011. She is passionate about continuing to be a part of the girls lives as they grow up. 

A little about Rachel is that she is double majoring in Public Policy and Environmental Science, and minoring in Spanish and Spanish American Studies. She aspires to become a senator and reform public education in California, as well as improve environmental legislation, and make a link in communities between environment and education. She has been on a service trip to Costa Rica to build recreational facilities for children in a public school in Copey, Costa Rica. She has also lived in Mexico and worked on an organic farm their to understand the links between agriculture and education. 

We both want to go to Haiti to work on building a new and improved orphanage for the girls so that they will have more living and playing space, be able to have their own garden, and be in a safer area of Port-au-Prince, Haiti. The winter of 2013, will be the time when Rachel and Lily are on their holiday break from college, and will also be the time that the new orphanage will be in it's beginning stages of construction. 

With your support of our endeavor you will be directly helping the twenty-three girls of the Reveil Matinal Orphanage have a new home with more space to live and play. 

What We Need & What You Get

What we are fundraising for is to pay for our plane tickets to fly to Port-au-Prince, Haiti, along with money for some the building materials that we will need to purchase when in Haiti. 

We need $1000 each for the plane tickets. This is because a ticket to Haiti can range from $600-$1000 plus the extra cost of luggage, because they charge heavily for the extra baggage around holiday season when traveling to Haiti. 

We then need money to pay for a driver while in Haiti, which can be expensive. 

Also every time volunteers go to the orphanage, they bring the materials that the girls need for school, such as binders, pencils, books (in French and English), pens, paper, etc. This is something that we would like to be able to bring them as a Christmas Present, along with board games, and other activities. 

In previous years, when the orphanage receives gifts for the girls, even when it is as simple as a new toothbrush, or a rope for jump roping, the girls will light up and be so grateful for the small gift you have given them. 

The money adds up fast when shopping for twenty-three young girls so we are hoping to reach our goal of $4000, but if we can't then all the money we raise will be sent to the orphanage to ensure that they have enough food and water to get through the winter, as this is always a constant worry. 

The Impact

Because Lily has gone to Haiti twice already she can ensure that the orphanage is a well run, established house in Haiti, which keeps its girls safe and is providing them with an education at a private school in Haiti, which is not something that happens for many children in Haiti. The orphanage believes in not dislocating the girls out of their country to have a "better life" in the States, but to educated them in their own country so that these young ladies can become some of the next leaders of Haiti. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us by spreading the word about our campaign and help us to go to Haiti during the winter of 2013!
