story:
SPAC Board Project.
 
1. What are we doing?
 
I am 24 years now and 20 years ago in Kenya I went to primary school without books,no uniform or inherited uniform from my older friends,I walked barefoot for over 3miles to seek education and there were no blackboards or proper writing materials I.e we used to write/draw sketches on the ground/soil using our fingers to imitate alphabets and numbers or count bean seeds/bottle tops to learn and master numbers.
 
Our exams used to be oral since the schools even lacked money to print exam papers to us,parents lived below quoter dollar per day and they would contribute nothing to get us do proper exams,we went hungry and we attended classes under trees such that when it rained,that would be the end of school for that day-even if rain fell as early as 8:00am.
 
We were just a few people in school then but now the population has increased from 10 to 50 or over 60 children per class,poverty enrages due to lack of education and still it is part of us.
 
The irony is,the same same way and situation I went to school in the year 1992 is the same way children in Kenya are still doing it in the year 2012,Just what does it take to change this?
 
My belief is that nobody is so poor that he has nothing to give and nobody is so rich that he has nothing to receive,let's live a life of forgiveness and understanding as we answer the question "What gift do you give to someone who has it all?" My answer is "A CHANCE TO HELP THOSE WHO DO NOT"
 
Sponsor a child Kenya (SPAC) is a Kenyan non- profit community based
organization which works with experts in children rights, social development, macro and micro- entrepreneurs, medical practitioners and legal experts. Through its humanitarian works, SPAC aims to assist, enable and empower the less fortunate children and impoverished communities to improve their livelihood through Education, juvenile rehabilitation,community care and treatment, championing for children’s rights, HIV/AIDS
sensitization with an aim to enhance prevention of mother to child transmission. Overall, SPAC aims to promote child rights, nature talents and build capacity of communities through children to transform poor communities into success hubs.
 
 
2. How are we doing it?
 
Through its education pillar, SPAC has been able to identify needy children
in schools and sponsored their education though well-wishers kitty,we started with 6 children and now we have 217! SPAC,through its networks and the support of local administration has been able to identify needy children who fell out of school for various reasons and.    
facilitated their return to school through well- guided counseling and rehabilitation
 
(See SPAC website http://sponsorachildkenya.org
 
Facebook page www.facebook.com/SPAC.KENYA
 
The Kenyan government has recently launched free primary school education
to raise literacy levels since education is one basic need for every child.
In so doing, a lot of children have returned to school increasing volumes
of pupils per class to at least fifty pupils per class. This has stretched
capacity of the classes to the level that most students do not have the
clear visibility of the small writing boards available in average Kenyan
schools. Again because of the over- stretched class capacities, some pupils
are forced to stay outside classrooms and learn through the windows or take
classes under trees.
 
SPAC has hence seen a need to respond to the plight of these children by
providing black writing boards ( SPAC boards) which are large enough to
enable visibility from a distance and also supply the same to schools that
have either constructed new class rooms or poor schools that have “Sunlight
classes” – Taking classes under trees.
 
We are constructing 250 blackboards to poorest rural schools in Kenya with erected classroom walls by use of sand,cement and black paints or we take wooden blackboards to schools that learn under trees since we do not have the capacity to build classrooms but we believe it will be possible one day. 
 
These 250 blackboards will impact 12,600 children into comfortable education by the end of our first year.
 
Our approach is unique in that we involve the community in need to take part in this,women bring the water for mixing the sand and cement while men do the mixing,the drug addicted youths who wish to rehabilitate give up drugs worth $20 every month in order to channel the money wasted on drugs to a better cause as teachers contribute $1 from their pockets to pay the constructors,we provide cements,sand,paints,chalks,architectural advise and monitoring of the full activity implementation with a group of our worldwide volunteers.
 
 
3. What happens when we reach goal of $5000?
 
SPAC believes that capacity building is not a one- off event but a process.
Once the SPAC boards are acquired and distributed in schools. SPAC intends
to ensure consistent follow up to see that there is tangible outcome from
the investment put in child education. This will be done through reviewing
performance of the pupils on a quarterly basis and address any unforeseen
needs within SPAC’s mandate. Alongside the intellectual investment, SPAC
intends to identify talents in young children and coach them to be able to
use their talents to better their lives. Successful pupils will then be
welcomed in the SPAC academy ( A group of successful students all through different communities) to act as role models to other less fortunate children in the society. 
 
Here are the details of SPAC Academy;
 
1. Selection
Talented students are picked by SPAC members, recommended by the school heads and teachers or apply on their own. We select over 18 year old pupils through a participatory interview process that includes group and individual challenge games. We look at one’s leadership and team-work capabilities, entrepreneurial creativity, positive attitude, and performance during challenge games.
2. Training & Education
The Talented pupils who successfully complete the interview process enter into a five weekend rigorous training program. The training covers life skills, entrepreneurship skills, the basics of personal finance and savings, marketing and sales, leadership development and team-building.
3. Funding
The Talented students who graduate from the training program are offered business start up funding at SPAC Academy program for two months.  SPAC academy, children get hands on experience in marketing, customer relations, accounting, and production of Tailor made Items such as laptop bags, phone sleeves, wall murals, curtain holders, jewelry holders, candle stands and messenger bags.
 
4. World reception
If we had it our way we would keep these talented students around forever. However, we want our youth to continue to grow to their fullest potential.This is why we select the TALENTED who can in turn Employ their fellows. SPAC customizes each youth’s exit strategy to ensure their continued success with a wish that Previous graduates will start their own business, find full time employment, or continue their education with the help of SPAC’s Education Scholarship Program.
At SPAC academy "WE DO NOT JUST FUND PROJECTS,WE FUND PROGRESS"
 
This will ensure continuity,sustainability and full capacity of the communities with the intervention.The intervention will be piloted in a number of schools and rolled out to other schools across the nation once the SPAC academy finds root.
 
 
4. Why is education/blackboards at this time important than the others like
health,protecting children from abuse etc?
 
SPAC believes in the adage “knowledge is power”. Providing knowledge to the
students will empower them and enable them to know how to prevent diseases
and live healthy hence reduce on hospital bills. Through education, the children will also get entrepreneurship skills that they will use to vend for themselves in their hay days as well as build business skills in their parents who may though be in their sunset days. The children will also learn how to identify and protect themselves from social abuses like rape,child labor and domestic violence as well as handle them amicably.
 
Through talent couching, the children will from an early age start making a living out of their wealthy talent outfit ranging from athletics, music,arts, theatre among others.
 
Education as coming out is a self- replenishing fountain that represents a
proverbial spring of life.
 
 
 
 
Feel free to support,share and Join our international board of directors of this cause so that we share ideas and possible project volunteer opportunities in Kenya for you:-) 
 
Show your Free support here http://goo.gl/XiR1C by registering your details!
 
 
My contacts;
 
Twitter: @SpertallKiziah
Facebook: www.facebook.com/supertall
LinkedIn: Kiziah Philbert 
Skype: supertall.kiziah
Mobile: +254720515026
Email: kiziah@sponsorachildkenya.org
Website: www.sponsorachildkenya.org
Also remember to share this using indie gobo share tools!
Thank you!
story_txt:
SPAC Board Project.
 
1. What are we doing?
 
I am 24 years now and 20 years ago in Kenya I went to primary school without books,no uniform or inherited uniform from my older friends,I walked barefoot for over 3miles to seek education and there were no blackboards or proper writing materials I.e we used to write/draw sketches on the ground/soil using our fingers to imitate alphabets and numbers or count bean seeds/bottle tops to learn and master numbers.
 
Our exams used to be oral since the schools even lacked money to print exam papers to us,parents lived below quoter dollar per day and they would contribute nothing to get us do proper exams,we went hungry and we attended classes under trees such that when it rained,that would be the end of school for that day-even if rain fell as early as 8:00am.
 
We were just a few people in school then but now the population has increased from 10 to 50 or over 60 children per class,poverty enrages due to lack of education and still it is part of us.
 
The irony is,the same same way and situation I went to school in the year 1992 is the same way children in Kenya are still doing it in the year 2012,Just what does it take to change this?
 
My belief is that nobody is so poor that he has nothing to give and nobody is so rich that he has nothing to receive,let's live a life of forgiveness and understanding as we answer the question "What gift do you give to someone who has it all?" My answer is "A CHANCE TO HELP THOSE WHO DO NOT"
 
Sponsor a child Kenya (SPAC) is a Kenyan non- profit community based
organization which works with experts in children rights, social development, macro and micro- entrepreneurs, medical practitioners and legal experts. Through its humanitarian works, SPAC aims to assist, enable and empower the less fortunate children and impoverished communities to improve their livelihood through Education, juvenile rehabilitation,community care and treatment, championing for children’s rights, HIV/AIDS
sensitization with an aim to enhance prevention of mother to child transmission. Overall, SPAC aims to promote child rights, nature talents and build capacity of communities through children to transform poor communities into success hubs.
 
 
2. How are we doing it?
 
Through its education pillar, SPAC has been able to identify needy children
in schools and sponsored their education though well-wishers kitty,we started with 6 children and now we have 217! SPAC,through its networks and the support of local administration has been able to identify needy children who fell out of school for various reasons and.    
facilitated their return to school through well- guided counseling and rehabilitation
 
(See SPAC website http://sponsorachildkenya.org

 
Facebook page www.facebook.com/SPAC.KENYA

 
The Kenyan government has recently launched free primary school education
to raise literacy levels since education is one basic need for every child.
In so doing, a lot of children have returned to school increasing volumes
of pupils per class to at least fifty pupils per class. This has stretched
capacity of the classes to the level that most students do not have the
clear visibility of the small writing boards available in average Kenyan
schools. Again because of the over- stretched class capacities, some pupils
are forced to stay outside classrooms and learn through the windows or take
classes under trees.
 
SPAC has hence seen a need to respond to the plight of these children by
providing black writing boards ( SPAC boards) which are large enough to
enable visibility from a distance and also supply the same to schools that
have either constructed new class rooms or poor schools that have “Sunlight
classes” – Taking classes under trees.
 
We are constructing 250 blackboards to poorest rural schools in Kenya with erected classroom walls by use of sand,cement and black paints or we take wooden blackboards to schools that learn under trees since we do not have the capacity to build classrooms but we believe it will be possible one day. 
 
These 250 blackboards will impact 12,600 children into comfortable education by the end of our first year.
 
Our approach is unique in that we involve the community in need to take part in this,women bring the water for mixing the sand and cement while men do the mixing,the drug addicted youths who wish to rehabilitate give up drugs worth $20 every month in order to channel the money wasted on drugs to a better cause as teachers contribute $1 from their pockets to pay the constructors,we provide cements,sand,paints,chalks,architectural advise and monitoring of the full activity implementation with a group of our worldwide volunteers.
 
 
3. What happens when we reach goal of $5000?
 
SPAC believes that capacity building is not a one- off event but a process.
Once the SPAC boards are acquired and distributed in schools. SPAC intends
to ensure consistent follow up to see that there is tangible outcome from
the investment put in child education. This will be done through reviewing
performance of the pupils on a quarterly basis and address any unforeseen
needs within SPAC’s mandate. Alongside the intellectual investment, SPAC
intends to identify talents in young children and coach them to be able to
use their talents to better their lives. Successful pupils will then be
welcomed in the SPAC academy ( A group of successful students all through different communities) to act as role models to other less fortunate children in the society. 
 
Here are the details of SPAC Academy;
 
1. Selection
Talented students are picked by SPAC members, recommended by the school heads and teachers or apply on their own. We select over 18 year old pupils through a participatory interview process that includes group and individual challenge games. We look at one’s leadership and team-work capabilities, entrepreneurial creativity, positive attitude, and performance during challenge games.
2. Training & Education
The Talented pupils who successfully complete the interview process enter into a five weekend rigorous training program. The training covers life skills, entrepreneurship skills, the basics of personal finance and savings, marketing and sales, leadership development and team-building.
3. Funding
The Talented students who graduate from the training program are offered business start up funding at SPAC Academy program for two months.  SPAC academy, children get hands on experience in marketing, customer relations, accounting, and production of Tailor made Items such as laptop bags, phone sleeves, wall murals, curtain holders, jewelry holders, candle stands and messenger bags.
 
4. World reception
If we had it our way we would keep these talented students around forever. However, we want our youth to continue to grow to their fullest potential.This is why we select the TALENTED who can in turn Employ their fellows. SPAC customizes each youth’s exit strategy to ensure their continued success with a wish that Previous graduates will start their own business, find full time employment, or continue their education with the help of SPAC’s Education Scholarship Program.
At SPAC academy "WE DO NOT JUST FUND PROJECTS,WE FUND PROGRESS"
 
This will ensure continuity,sustainability and full capacity of the communities with the intervention.The intervention will be piloted in a number of schools and rolled out to other schools across the nation once the SPAC academy finds root.
 
 
4. Why is education/blackboards at this time important than the others like
health,protecting children from abuse etc?
 
SPAC believes in the adage “knowledge is power”. Providing knowledge to the
students will empower them and enable them to know how to prevent diseases
and live healthy hence reduce on hospital bills. Through education, the children will also get entrepreneurship skills that they will use to vend for themselves in their hay days as well as build business skills in their parents who may though be in their sunset days. The children will also learn how to identify and protect themselves from social abuses like rape,child labor and domestic violence as well as handle them amicably.
 
Through talent couching, the children will from an early age start making a living out of their wealthy talent outfit ranging from athletics, music,arts, theatre among others.
 
Education as coming out is a self- replenishing fountain that represents a
proverbial spring of life.
 
 
 
 
Feel free to support,share and Join our international board of directors of this cause so that we share ideas and possible project volunteer opportunities in Kenya for you:-) 
 
Show your Free support here http://goo.gl/XiR1C by registering your details!
 
 
My contacts;
 
Twitter: @SpertallKiziah
Facebook: www.facebook.com/supertall

LinkedIn: Kiziah Philbert 
Skype: supertall.kiziah
Mobile: +254720515026

Email: kiziah@sponsorachildkenya.org

Website: www.sponsorachildkenya.org

Also remember to share this using indie gobo share tools!
Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

  • Steve Selpal. Despite having Asperger's Syndrome, he has had a career in Commercial Art and Fine Art, with a degree from Kent State University. 
  • This campaign will bring Selpal and some works of art to the 2012 ANCA Convention in Vancouver, British Columbia. He will exhibit his works and deliver a lecture plus workshop. The subject of his workshop is Vocational Guidance for aspiring artists who are diagnosed on the Autism Spectrum, as he is.
  • This workshop is the first of it's kind and will inform parents of children who are on the autism spectrum as well as those individuals who are functioning on their own as to how to convert their talent for art and art skills into tangible steps how to create a livlihood and gain more success and independence.

What We Need & What You Get

This funding will pay for airline tickets, accommodation for Steve Selpal and his partner and shipping of artworks to be installed as an exhibit at the 2012 ANCA Convention in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.

Steve Selpal has had a long life and career as an artistic talent who has lived with the condition of Asperger's Syndrome. He has a unique position to give back to society and the world his experience to help others like himself with his candor and spontaneous humor. Steve is preparing a hands-on approach with a data disc to be given out freely to all attendees at his presentation. This will help anyone who wants to get into the work force as a commercial artist survivor like himself, and even aspire to fine art.

If the goal is not reached this year, the funds will be applied to the 2013 ANCA Convention, which is the same venue the following year. This venue is a special event which is ongoing and has helped many parents of autistic children and teens. This venue gives hope and Steve's campaign goal is to give hope in a tangible way with special practical life skills for these special aspiring artists.  

The Impact

  • This project is valuable because every person who has autism and every parent with an autistic child wants to have some assurance or strategy to gain a foothold in life and a lifelong career. This project is focused towards those who are talented in art and self expression. This is because Steve Selpal is an artist who has enabled hismelf to live indepentently and survive in society.
  • Steve has begun to make public speaking presentations pertaining to Autism and Art. There are examples shown on his youtube channel.
  • Steve's presentation at 2012 ANCA will add to the available activities and workshops there and make the convention a bigger success. He will add a viable and important dimension to an already successful event.

Other Ways You Can Help

. Contact people on Facebook. Especially those who are touched by autism and understand the desires and fears of the parents and especially those who the talent to be an artist in society.

Use the Indiegogo share tools and the Facebook share tools!

story:
My Goal

To Raise $3000 so I can fund my tutition & board which is not part of my scholarship for my Sophmore/Junior year, so that I may complete my Bachelor's degree in Environmental Science/Geography.

 

Who Am I?

My name is Cheyenne Stewart. I am currently 20 years old living in Barbados. I have 4 siblings of which I am the second oldest.

I LOVE jumping. Love it! I can't say it enough times! High Jump, Long Jump, Triple Jump, I am always so excited to be out there soaring over bars or jumping amazing meters into a pit. It was always my dream to become a world renouned athlete. From as young as 7, I was always involved in extra circicular; learning to swim and cook from a young age. I had earned my first Track and Field medal in middle school at the age of 10 where I placed 3rd in Long Jump. From High School onwards, I earned good grades and participated in almost every extra circullar at school: Netball, Basketball, Cross Country, Chess, Swimming and excelled tremously in them, but Track and Field had continued to be my one love.

With many great records held and amazing personal bests, I am now a Sophmore looking to attend Northern Michigan University in Fall 2012. There, I'll be training with the best coaches on the World's largest Indoor Track (The Wooden Dome). I have recieved an 85% scholarship from the school's excited coach to fund my 3rd year at school but as an international student, the remaining 15% is a tremendous bar standing in my way.

This campaign holds extreme importance to me because I know they are many people in the Caribbean who would love to be offered the chance to recieve more than a High School education so they can persue their athletic dreams. I am one of them. With your help, I can finally leap over this last obstacle and finally reach my dreams.

 

Where does your Money Go?

The money gained from this campaign will go towards:-

  • My tuition and housing for sophmore - Junior year.
  • Signing of international documents by Northern Michigan University.
  • Allowance to buy books, school supplies, winter clothes, food, sanitary and other basic needs.

 

What If I exceed my goal of $3000?

Even though this campaign runs until a few days after school starts, I can continue to run this campiagn until the time runs out. My draft of plans for this campiagn if it reaches its goal are below:

  • Winter clothes: Many people warn me that the winters in the Upper Pennisula of Michigan can be extremly harsh. Scary! Living in a tropical environment for 20 years where the temperature hardly ever drops below 80 degrees Farenheight; you can imagine that I will not have many warm clothes in my closet.
  • New shoes: I've literally worn my 1 and only pair of sneakers into the ground! Finding a track worthy pair of sneakers will be a challenge for my soon to be active college life. Also, track shoes for Pole Vault (A new event for me!) and Triple Jump (which I have never recieved shoes for) will go a long way.
  • A return ticket: After a long year of college life away from home, if there isn't any summer classes I might have to take, I get to go home!
  • Other than those three ideas, I am basically open to suggestion. Hit me with what you've got! I love to hear any ideas :)

 

Frequently Asked Questions

  • How can we get into contact with you?

Any questions or anything else you would like to know, you can always email me cheystew@live.com.

 

  • Can we donate in other currencies other than $USD?

Of course! Indiegogo accpets most currencies, just be aware of the currency exchange rate that you are trying to do.

E.g. $2 BDS= $1 USD, therefore to donate $20 USD you will have to donate $40 BDS.

 

  • Where are all those photos and movies taken in your video from?

That is my life story! Some of them were my friends taking vidoes and pictures of me which I was given afterwards, but most pictures and videos were taken with my own camera. What you see in the movie was everything that I've experienced. Who could fake that love of jumping!

 

  • Can I post this page other places and share this link?

Yes you can. Make as much noise about this campaign! The more people know, the closer we can reach my goal for school. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Thank You!

On behalf on myself I'd like to give a big thank you (and cookies!) to everyone who supported my venture. I can't express in words how thankful I am to know that there are people who are willing to help me reach my future dreams of one day becoming a Vulcanologist and Olympican and change the direction of my life for the better. Today, we take that one step of jumping that bar...

I can't express in words how thankful I am to know that there are people who are willing to help me reach my future dreams of one day becoming a Vulcanologist and Olympican and change the direction of my life for the better. Today, we take that one step of jumping that bar...

story:
About The Chicago Free School

  • We are a group of parents and educators working to build a democratic free school for the South Side of Chicago.
  • At the Chicago Free School, students choose their classes and activities based on their individual interests.  We do not have required classes, grades, or standardized tests.
  • Students participate in democratic decision-making to create school rules, resolve conflicts, and suggest topics to study.
  • Our small size of 60 students with 5 full-time teachers ensures that students get lots of personal attention in a caring community.
  • We emphasize learning that is authentic, exploratory, and connected to the community. Our location on the second floor of Augustana Lutheran Church of Hyde Park is ideal for accessing local parks and museums and taking public transit on field trips throughout the city.
  • We are committed to social justice and racial and socioeconomic diversity. We offer sliding-scale tuition so that we are affordable for every family, regardless of income.
  • Every day, families express to us their urgent need for a new kind of school for their children. Your donations help us prepare to open in September 2014 and keep our school affordable to everyone through sliding-scale tuition.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money we raise from this campaign supports start-up costs for our school.  In the long run, we'll meet over 90% of our costs with money collected from tuition, but we need your help to get us ready for the first day of school! 
  • The money we are raising now goes to pay for furniture, books, technology, supplies, and staff pay for our teacher planning and orientation period.
  • The money we raise helps us implement sliding-scale tuition so that our school can be affordable for every family.
  • Our thank-you gifts to you feature our cool new logo.
  • Thanks to our 501(c)3 sponsor, the Experimental Station, your gift is tax-deductible. 

The Impact

  • In our current climate of high-stakes test pressure and resource cuts, it is increasingly difficult for many schools to meet the social and emotional needs of students and provide an environment where learning can be authentic and fun.  Families are eager for a school that will give students the autonomy and flexibility to pursue their own interests in a supportive community.
  • Free School students grow up to be self-possessed, caring, self-motivated adults and truly engaged citizens.
  • Our group includes educators with years of experience serving Chicago's students who will apply their expertise to create a school that will really meet the needs of children in a caring, joyful environment. 
  • Our school functions as a truly democratic community - we involve students, parents, and teachers in making decisions and give everyone a voice.

Help Us Reach Our Goal!

  • Your tax-deductible donation of any amount helps us demonstrate the need and the enthusiasm for this unique model of education.
  • Our goal is to reach 300 donors at any level. 
  • Please feel free to share our campaign via email or facebook.  You can click the buttons or copy and paste the web address shown in the box.
  • If your employer matches contributions, email or message us and we will send you a digital copy of the W9 form.

At the Chicago Free School, students choose their classes and activities based on their individual interests.  We do not have required classes, grades, or standardized tests.
Students participate in democratic decision-making to create school rules, resolve conflicts, and suggest topics to study.

Our small size of 60 students with 5 full-time teachers ensures that students get lots of personal attention in a caring community.

We emphasize learning that is authentic, exploratory, and connected to the community. Our location on the second floor of Augustana Lutheran Church of Hyde Park is ideal for accessing local parks and museums and taking public transit on field trips throughout the city.

We are committed to social justice and racial and socioeconomic diversity. We offer sliding-scale tuition so that we are affordable for every family, regardless of income.

Every day, families express to us their urgent need for a new kind of school for their children. Your donations help us prepare to open in September 2014 and keep our school affordable to everyone through sliding-scale tuition.

The money we are raising now goes to pay for furniture, books, technology, supplies, and staff pay for our teacher planning and orientation period.

The money we raise helps us implement sliding-scale tuition so that our school can be affordable for every family.
Our thank-you gifts to you feature our cool new logo.
Thanks to our 501(c)3 sponsor, the Experimental Station, your gift is tax-deductible.

Free School students grow up to be self-possessed, caring, self-motivated adults and truly engaged citizens.

story:
Hi! I'm Kathleen!

I am working towards my Bachelor's degree in Social Work. The first step in a life motivated by my passion for peoples' stories and struggles, as well as a desire to empower and advocate for those individuals. This in conjunction with my fascination for other cultures and the international application of Social Work are what bring me here.

UMBC and UMB are partnering to send a group of undergraduate and graduate Social Work students to India for 16 days in January 2013 as part of an independent study. Students will participate in an international conference organized by Rajagiri College of Social Sciences, Kerala, India, visit field agencies of interest, and have the opportunity to interact with Rajagiri MSW students and faculty.

While I realize the idea of turning to the community at large to ask for contributions towards a personal excursion is sort of ridiculous, the fact remains that I cannot make this trip happen on my own. That all being said, I feel this trip would be an invaluable experience toward my academic and professional career. Having participated in some international service already, I am now driven to expand upon those horizons and see what else is out there in terms of need and aide. It would give me an opportunity to witness and participate in how my field is being applied in an area of the world wracked by poverty, trafficking, sex trade, and a variety of other issues of personal interest. I also intend to do my part to share my experiences and inevitable lessons upon my return. 

My campaign is set under fixed funding. Meaning if I don't meet the goal/can't go on the trip within the 60 day deadline, everyone who contributed walks away without having had to pay a dime/with any funds returned. 

Every little bit helps and I cannot begin to express how much this experience would mean to me.

story:
It is with great joy I share news that my doctoral project entitled Organ Seminar for Pianists has been approved and will take place on Saturday, November 5th 2016. The project, a seminar dedicated to pianists who wish to learn more about the organ and liturgical music, is the culmination of my doctoral studies at the College-Conservatory of Music, and represents the experiences I accumulated as a graduate student, teaching assistant, student body president, and interim director of career & placement services. 

 

Your gift will help me pay for two amazing guest lecturers who will be assisting me on November 5th, and also for audio/visual support, breakfast items, and lunch for participants. My goal is to raise $1500 

Each and every one of you continue to have a positive impact in my journey. Keeping you in my thoughts has helped me remain focused on my goal. Thank you!
story_txt:
It is with great joy I share news that my doctoral project entitled Organ Seminar for Pianists has been approved and will take place on Saturday, November 5th 2016. The project, a seminar dedicated to pianists who wish to learn more about the organ and liturgical music, is the culmination of my doctoral studies at the College-Conservatory of Music, and represents the experiences I accumulated as a graduate student, teaching assistant, student body president, and interim director of career & placement services. 
 
Your gift will help me pay for two amazing guest lecturers who will be assisting me on November 5th, and also for audio/visual support, breakfast items, and lunch for participants. My goal is to raise $1500 
Each and every one of you continue to have a positive impact in my journey. Keeping you in my thoughts has helped me remain focused on my goal. Thank you!

story:
Kids International Development Society

Hi were Adrianne and Rick, Co founders of Kids International Development Society (KIDS). In March 2000 our only child and dearest daughter Danielle was killed by a drunk driver, she was 21. Our search to find healing and meaning in our lives led us to the formation of KIDS and today we are a registered Canadian Charity. Each year we volunteer for three to four months mostly in S.E. Asia and primarily Cambodia. Our focus is on education, clean drinking water and health care. We work with local people and organizations and oversee the projects ourselves making sure that the funds donated are wisely spent and directly assist children, families and communities in need. Over the past fourteen years we have successfully funded and supported: schools, clinics, solar water systems for schools, classrooms, children’s hospitals, a girl’s home, women’s weaving cooperative and other family and educational supplies.
Want to learn more?  Check us out at www.kidsdevelopmentsociety.org


What We Need & What You Get

Can I take your order?

  • Donate 1 Grande Latte- $4.08 and you have paid for a child to attend school for 16 days
  • Donate 1 Grande Latte every week for the next 4 weeks $16.32 you have paid for a child to attend school for 64 days
  • Donate 1 Grande Latte-$4.08 and you have paid for 27 days of lunches for a child at school
  • Donate 1 Grande Latte every week for the next 4 weeks $16.32 and you have paid for a child to have 108 lunches for a child at school
  • Donate 10 Grande Latte-$36.72 and you have paid for a bike for a child to allow them to get to school.
  • Or be a Super Donor and donate  a coffee a week for a year $195.84 and support children to wear a uniform, ride their bike to school, eat lunch at school and create a better future.

The Impact

Education is a priority for KIDS and we see first hand how developing minds changes lives. We are presently working with thousands of children in both rural and urban Cambodia.  We have witnessed first hand how education has changed children and youth’s lives. We have known young people, who thanks to educational support, have finished University and now have good paying jobs and can help support their families. We have seen children learn and grow and be able to escape the difficult life of working in a brick factory as a child labourer.  We work with many Cambodian people who have faced unthinkable tragedy and now dedicate their lives to helping their own people. These changes are made possible through education and hard work. Who knows where one coffee will lead!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate a coffee today?  That is okay, please help us meet our goal by sharing our message on Facebook, Twitter, email or the Canada Helps button on our website,www.kidsdevelopmentsociety.org.  Help us make some noise!

story:
I would like to raise money for a ticket to the National Women's Studies Association this coming November 12th. As a double major in Human & Family Development and Women's Studies, this conference would be extremely insightful to my education. The more experience I have with leadership, policy, and advocacy the more capable I am to better pursue my goals as an advocate. Some of my own personal goals in attending this conference are to learn more about women in leadership positions, sexual assault awareness campaigns, how to effectively campaign for better family policy issues such as The Family Leave Act, and current  research regarding interpersonal relationships within the LGBTQ.  Any donation, no matter how large or small, will be extremely appreciated!

I included a little information about the National Women's Studies Association, as well as a link to connect you to their site. If you have any questions or are just curious about the conference, please feel free to email me or click on the link below!

*Although the website says I'm raising $500, my ticket is only $150. I had to place $500 as my limit via the website. 

http://www.nwsa.org/conference2014

The National Women's Studies Association leads the field of women’s studies in educational and social transformation.  Established in 1977, NWSA has more than 2,000 members worldwide.  Our annual conference regularly draws more than 1,600 attendees and is the only annual meeting in the US exclusively dedicated to showcasing the latest feminist scholarship. 
 
The 2015 conference will open on Thursday, November 12, 2015 with two pre-conferences hosted by the Program Administration and Development and the Women’s Centers Standing Committees.  These daylong events offer networking and professional development opportunities for women’s and gender studies and women’s center administrators.

story:
Our time as students at Central Institute of Technology in both the Animation and Game programs is soon coming to a conclusion. In order to show off the hard work we've put into our studies for the past 2 (in some cases, 3) years we are organising an exhibition that will display the work of 60+ students to both the industry and the public. The show will be taking place at Central Institute of Technology's East Perth Campus in the first week of December.

With your help we can create a successful launch into our professional careers.

What We Need 

We are looking to raise a minimum of $1000 to help cover a variety of event costs including catering, printing, advertising, media and displays etc.

Why Help Us?

Here in Perth the creative industry is extremely competitive, and being relatively young in this field of work, we believe this show will help us break into this industry.

Your donations will be a great help in starting our journey into what we hope will be a long and fruitful career. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Being students ourselves, we can understand being broke. You can still assist us! You can help spread the word of our campaign to friends, families or even kind strangers! 

If you are interested in seeing all of our student work please feel free to visit our website!

http://www.polycon2015.com/

If you know a business or own a business that would like to sponsor or help in any way please email:

advdipexpo2015@outlook.com

Hope to see you all there!

story:
Short Summary

Love the Oceans is a non-profit marine conservation organisation working in Guinjata Bay, Inhambane, Mozambique. We are working with the locals to help them achieve sustainable fishing. We are educating local children, who are the next generation of fishermen, to love the oceans.

We are currently working with the local school to help develop a positive learning environment for the children of Guinjata. We need a little more funds to build a 4th classroom to make more room for the 900 children aged 6-18 that attend the school. 

Love the Oceans volunteer's will be helping build, plaster and paint this classroom along with local contracted builders. The more money we can raise the bigger difference we can make to an area that is virtually untouched. By creating this classroom we will be making a huge difference in the lives of these children and the quality of their education. 

What We Need

We're doing a short term fundraiser to raise money to build a classroom at the local school. All the money from this fundraiser will go into the local school and if we don't reach our target the money will still be put to use at the school.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Social media is our biggest ally, share as much as you can! Raising awareness about our campaign is key to our success and we also have a donations page on our website (lovetheoceans.org) that you can donate to any time.

VOLUNTEER! Check out our website for volunteering opportunities and more ways to get involved.

story:
Welcome:

           Following our previous campaign
which generated a positive impact towards transforming lives of many needy children in school by supporting 120 children in school during our last donation event alone!, we have  back to you to provide you another chance to transform lives. Our efforts is to see every child having equal opportunity in their education regardless their social status through provision of learning materials and support while in school. Every donation received by our team is utilized for the very purpose of supporting and empowering the needy children in school.

What We Need:


       Our core mission here is to raise funds for this project to enable us to have sponsorship and also buy learning material donations which we deliver directly to the needy children in various schools here in Kenya. Our budget for our March donations event  is $3,500 which will be utilized as follows;

    School supplies (writing books,text books, pens, pencils etc) ----$1800

    School uniforms for the children (shirts, shorts,dresses,shoes,socks) ---$600

     Food (feeding program while in school)-----------------------------------$400

      Solar learning lamps initiative----------------------------------------------$500

      Event running expenses------------------------------------------------------$200

                                                                                                 Totals ----------     $3,500

Help us reach our goal by either donating via credit card or PayPal check out.

The Impact:

 Our projects are live transforming, changing attitudes and helping many raise above their challenges  and changing destinies of many children in school, we have seen stars raising in these children we are helping and their future is promising according to the current performance in their studies. We encourage you to donate and be the start of change in their lives.

Other Ways You Can Help:

A problem shared is a problem solved, help share this information and help us achieve our goal and let us all be life transformers!

                                                                  Thank you.

                                                                                peter maithya.

story:
30 Days for 30 Years!

Can you believe it? T.C. Eggington's is turning 30! That’s 30 eggstravagant years of cooking up your breakfast favorites! To celebrate we’re giving back to the community we love! But we’ve got a big goal and need your help.

Your donation of just $5 bucks (or less or more!) will help thousands of young artists! 

Click and help us raise $10,000 dollars to help support arts education in our community! Your donations will benefit the Mesa Arts Center Foundation, a local non-profit who works to enrich the lives of thousands of young students through visual and performing arts.

But that's not all! TC Eggington's will reward you for your donations by offering .30 cent dining deals during our 30 days of fundraising! Our way of saying an eggstra special thank you for supporting the community we love!


Your Impact

Mesa Arts Center Foundation is a non-profit, 501.c.3 organization whose mission is to support Mesa Arts Center’s arts education and engagement programs. While Mesa Arts Center is owned and operated by the City of Mesa, philanthropy makes it possible for thousands of young children to experience the arts, no matter their economic status or other barriers.


Engagement programs at Mesa Arts Center reach participants of all ages, and just last year over 50,000 students and over 200 schools were impacted through engagement programs Valley-wide.


Thanks to the generosity of T.C. Eggington fans and customers, school-age children Valley-wide will gain access to a broad array of programs that help foster self-confidence, critical-thinking skills, and teamwork through once-in-a-lifetime events at Mesa Arts Center.


Be Rewarded by Giving Back! 


To help achieve our $10,000 dollar goal, T.C. Eggington’s is offering up $0.30 cent dining deals  during our 30 days of fundraising!


  • If $1,000 is raised before 10/31 - the first 100 guests that day can enjoy a TC Eggington’s coffee for only $0.30.


  • If more than $3,000 is raised before 11/7 -  the first 100 guests that day enjoy a $0.30 you-call-it side dish with any entrée purchase.


  • If more than $6,000 is raised before 11/14 -  the first 100 guests to purchase an entrée will receive a $0.30 kid’s meal.


  • If  $10,000 or more in donations is raised before 11/21 -  the first 100 guests get BOGO entrees, meaning when one is purchased, another is only $0.30.



Celebrate with T.C. Eggington's!


When the fundraising fun is done, it’s time to party, T.C. Eggington’s-style! Our 30th Anniversary Eggstravaganza is Saturday, Nov. 21, 2015, and that means BOGO entrees, gift card giveaways galore and plenty of activities for the little ones, including an onsite patio art fair featuring kids’ classes run by Mesa Arts Center representatives. Egg painting, egg-shell mosaics, a giant egg toss and a large parking lot mural are also part of the party plan. Our way of saying an eggstra special thank you for supporting the community we love!

story:
Level 2 Kit (BBox 2)

The BBox 2 is the next release in the "Learning Electronics - The Practical Way" series after the successful BBox 1. We now take one step further and learn about Digital Electronics and Integrated Circuits (ICs).

A glimpse at the kits present in BBox 2

BBox 2 teaches you how to use integrated circuits like timers, comparators, op-amps, counters, logic gates, etc. and we use these to build 20 different projects including a stereo Bluetooth speaker system with a VU meter.

These beautiful PCBs help you practice soldering

The BBox 2 comprises of 20 different kits that are made up of a PCB, all the necessary through-hole components and also a short description of the circuit operation along with the schematic. It contains over 400 items and the PCBs help you practice your soldering skills too.

1. Stereo VU Meter - $5,000 - UNLOCKED

The VU meter project currently only takes a single channel input (either right or left) so we will convert this to a stereo configuration for both channels and we will also include a pre-amplifier to interface it directly to the Bluetooth speaker system that we will also be building. This means it will have a total of 20 LEDs, one for the right channel and the other for the left.

Some of the projects we will be building

Our focus here is to make use of all the concepts you've learned in BBox 1 and build upon that to teach you how to create more advanced circuits. By doing this, you will get a much better sense of understanding and appreciation for the electronic circuits that you see around you.

Some of the components and modules that we will be using

We start by building a simple voltage regulator circuit that provides 5V & 3.3V from different input sources - including USB, DC power adaptor or batteries. We then learn about the 555 timer and build various circuits using it in different modes. We also use decade counters, op-amps, and application ICs to build voice recorders, a stereo Bluetooth speaker system with class D amplifiers along with a VU meter that provides a visual representation of the music being played.

Using a cardboard box as an enclosure for the Bluetooth speaker system

Some of the assembled PCBs

LED arrow circuit

LED heartbeat circuit

DIY speaker enclosure

The internal operation of the 555 timer

We also analyze the circuit operation and take a look at how it works. Once you get an understanding of how the integrated circuits operate, it is easy to see how you can use them in different projects. 

An example of the reference sheet contained within the kits

Each kit also contains a one page summary of the circuit operation along with the schematic. It also contains a link that will lead you to a more in-depth analysis and related videos.

The BBox 2 contains all the components you need to build the circuits with the exception of batteries and soldering equipment.

It's not easy to classify all the 400 different components but here's a simple breakup of the existing contents. This number is likely to increase based on feedback and stretch goals.

A quick overview of the kit contents

You will need a standard 9V (PP3 or 6LR61) battery to power the circuits. Optionally, you can also use any other power source (7.5V - 18V) along with the power supply board as needed. Including the batteries would have complicated the shipping process and it would increase the likelihood of delivery delays which is why we decide to leave them out. We have not included the soldering equipment due to personal preferences and also to keep the kit cost low. 

The BBox 2 should give you a good understanding of how to use integrated circuits and this takes you one step closer to learning microcontrollers, which is what BBox 3 is all about.

Heartbeat circuit with the Bluetooth stereo

We're currently designing BBox 3 and this is expected to go live soon after the BBox 2 campaign ends. We will be using the Piksey Pico & Piksey Nano Arduino boards and we will learn how to interface different modules and displays opening up a world of possibilities.

International rewards will be sent by insured, tracked and signed delivery which means you can expect to receive them very quickly.

We've fulfilled the rewards for our first campaign on time and we expect to deliver these on time too. In fact, this is a much simpler campaign compared to the first one so we are very confident about everything running smoothly, now that we are familiar with the crowdfunding process.

We hope that you will start your electronics adventures with us and we hope to see you around.

story:
What is this for?

This campaign goes directly to help afford two trips. One is to Philadelphia, PA For 9 students who have qualified for the NCFL Tournament, and the other is to Birmingham, AL for 2 students who have qualified for the NFL. We have done numerous fund raisers but the community we are in has fallen on difficult times and we are short of our goal. Most of the students we have in our program fall into a demographic where parental contributions are difficult to ask for, which is why we are reaching out to the goodwill of strangers.

This is a cause that is important to me and the others who coach and help with the team because of the tremendous impact these types of activities have on these students. Each and every one of these kids is an amazing individual!

Your contributions help support 11 students who have spent countless hours preparing and practicing. These 11 students practice their public speaking daily, something most of us are terrified to do!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are short over $2000.00 in relation to our goal. This money is going to go to a few items. First this will be going to finish off paying for travel expenses. Our district has attempted to help, but as I mentioned before, we are still a bit shy. Second, this money will go to support the students while they are in Philadelphia. These types of trips are expensive in relation to food and travel and we want to help these kids who have worked so hard at something they are so passionate about. They should not have to miss such an amazing trip!
  • At the end of the day, our perks are simple. We are going to say thank you in as many possible ways as we can. There is not a significant amount that we can send you, but what we can do, we will! Postcards are always exciting to receive!! In addition, we will be more than happy to directly say thank you on social media! Finally, if you are feeling tremendously generous, we will make sure you understand just how much we appreciate you by sending you a certificate of appreciation. It isn't much, but it is what we are able to do!
  • Any of the money we raise will go directly to these students and helping them get to, and be provided for during this tournament, even if we do not hit our goal!

The Impact

  • Students involved in these academic extracurriculars are much more likely to go to and succeed in, college. Especially from a low income demographic, the skills these students learn and use will help them in almost every aspect of their life. Support for academics is dwindling. We need to be ready and willing to help each other, for the benefit of those generations who come after us. These students make up your next set of innovators, small business leaders, and even government officals. If we make the world better for them, they will pass it on!

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you cannot directly contribute doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Link us on your Facebook feeds, share us it on twitter. We need any help we can muster!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

That is pretty much all there is in regard to this campaign. We really do appreciate any contributions that you make, or any attention you can get for these students!!

The video above is from the 2005 Philadelphia Nationals, where ESPN participated in opening the Tournament. 

Thanks for your time!

story:
Welcome to the Ron Paul Commemorative Sculpture page! I have commissioned a classically trained artist to create a bronze sculpture of one of my personal heroes, Dr. Ron Paul. For 30+ years Ron Paul and his fight for Liberty has been an inspiration to myself and many others. I think that it’s time that we honor Dr. Paul by creating a symbol of him in recognition of his contribution to the cause of Liberty that will serve as a reminder to future generations! 

The artist whom I have commissioned, Suzanne Johnson, has over 25 years of experience. Her museum quality bronzes capture the personality of each subject with exquisite detail and are collected worldwide. She has generously spent many hours of her time on this project because she understands how important and influential Dr. Paul is. If you would like to view some of her previous works feel free to visit either her Facebook page or her website.  

As you can see from the photos, she has already begun working on a life sized bust of Dr. Paul in clay, which once completed will be molded and cast into bronze. It is important that you see the quality of her work and realize that you will not just be funding a piece of art, but a significant moment in history. 

Our goal is to raise the necessary funds by August 20th (Ron Paul's Birthday) to cast this sculpture in bronze and have it mounted onto a solid granite base which will feature a memorable quote by Ron Paul. Once completed we intend to present this sculpture to an organization which aligns with the principles of freedom and liberty. This is the really cool part: You get to decide where we donate the sculpture and which Ron Paul quote we will use! Join the Ron Paul Commemorative Bronze Sculpture Facebook Page and cast your vote today!

Please keep in mind that we chose a conservative goal of $4,500 which is essentially the minimum amount we need in order to cover the cost of casting and transporting the sculpture as well as fulfilling the rewards to our contributors to this project, so please give as much as you are able to!

*Additional funds beyond our goal will be used to compensate the artist for material costs, her time spent on the project and arrange travel accommodations to participate in the presentation ceremony. In the event that the project becomes overfunded by a substantial margin we will consider casting an additional identical bronze sculpture to be donated to the organization which receives the second most votes!

donors please understand that many of the rewards feature photos and/or photo books which will feature the finished bronze sculpture, we hope to have the rewards completed as soon as possible, but the bronze can take anywhere from 6-8 weeks to finish, so please have patience and we promise we won't forget about you

story:
My Pitch

My name is Louise Oliver; I'm 28 years old, from Scotland and am about to risk everything for the opportunity of a lifetime.  In August 2012 I attended a rare open audition for the New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts when they were in Scotland for the Edinburgh Festival Fringe.  At the time, in my head, a successful result was equivalent to a lottery win.  Things like that don't happen...except when they do.  I got in, and not only that, they offered me a scholarship in recognition of what I have achieved in my career to date.  Cue a lot of "pinch me I'm dreaming" and double checking it wasn't, in fact, a wind up and here I am; about to revisit the dream of a little girl from small town Scotland who wanted nothing more than to be an actress and who, as an adult, thought that dream had long since passed her by.  

Why now?  I didn’t attend drama school the first time around like I really wanted to for a number of reasons; lack of confidence, circumstances and financial limitations.  But I did get into the University of Glasgow where I achieved a Masters in Theatre Studies, a very academic course, and have been working my butt off for the past 10 years carving out a career in arts management.  However, I’ve had an itch and a little voice in my head for ten years telling me I let what I really wanted to do, what truly lit me up, slip away.  It’s not that I don’t enjoy what I do currently but I can’t ignore the feeling that I got here through necessity rather than choice.  Through my own perseverance and ambition I have managed to align my circumstances and as a result I have been presented with a rare and unique chance to pursue what I believe to be my own unfulfilled potential. 

The thing is dreams don’t come cheap, certainly not ones this big.  Although being in receipt of a scholarship is a wonderful position to be in, the amount awarded to me is a contribution towards my tuition as opposed to a blanket cover of costs.  The total cost of my tuition, room and board, supplies and general living is an intimidating figure of £33,192.88 per academic year. 

I know I am not exactly unique; I am not professing to be.  In this age of Glee and X-Factor everyone has a dream and a sob story to support why theirs is the most important.  I guess all I am trying to say is that opportunities like this don’t come along very often; only once if ever at all and I have managed to get myself to this point.  Now I am at an impasse and need a little help to push through.  That’s what this campaign is all about, it’s part of a wider fundraising effort to raise the tuition money and get me to NYC. 

Everything I have worked for and this life that I've built, as I know it, I’m putting at risk.  I’m taking a huge gamble and I need to stack the odds in my favour or, well, as the title of the campaign would suggest, I’m bust.  And that’s not a cry for help, it’s just a fact.  I suppose what I am asking is for you guys to blow on my dice.  You can make the difference on whether or not I go to NYC or go Bust.

 

 

 

 

The Target and Your Perks

Ok mathletes, here comes the scary money bit.  As mentioned above I need to raise £33,192.81 and in the interest of transparency, so you know exactly where your money is going, here’s how that breaks down...

Tuition & Fees - £18,983.30

Room & Board - £11,719.25

Books & Supplies - £331.16

Local Transportation - £588.16

Misc. (insurance, medical, etc) - £1,570.94

And that’s per academic year.  Sure, it’s expensive, but it has every right to be.  It’s acting training in one of the most selective schools in the State, in one of the most competitive and thrilling cities in the world.  If it wasn’t damn hard to get there everyone would be doing it.  But it seems a waste to let this opportunity get away because of money.  My target through Indiegogo is a relatively modest £2K.  I know what you’re thinking, that’s a pretty small percentage of my overall goal, and you’d be right.  Rest assured I am not resting on my laurels here; I have spent the last six months writing to dozens of trusts, stashing my own cash and chasing down Skills Development Loans.  However, you guys are probably going to be the most integral piece in this financial jigsaw.        

I am not oblivious to significance of what I am asking for, it’s a hard ask and one that I hope I am getting right.  I’m not a band you’re a fan of trying make an album, I’m not trying to change the world and I’m not Veronica Mars so what can I offer you?  The best of me, I suppose.  My perks have been structured around what I feel I have to offer; the parts of me that are personal, reflective of my personality and will require special care and dedication to get them to you.  They may not be much but they are small, personal commitment to you that I hope communicates just how grateful I am for your support.  

If I don’t hit my target...I could say that’s life but that doesn’t mean that wouldn’t suck!  But that’s OK, every little helps and those who will donate will help me get a few steps further and allowing me the breathing space to figure out how to fill in the gaps if I don’t hit the £2K. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t make a pledge...Do.  Not.  Worry.  Seriously, I know how painfully skint everyone is at the moment.  These are tough times for living the dream and we are all in the getting by boat together.  However, in the absence of a pledge, it would be super cool of you to share my Indiegogo campaign with others; maybe on your Facebook, your Twitter or in an email. 

You could sign up to my mailing listing to learn more about how the NYC or Bust campaign is progressing; featuring hilarious video blogs, updates and all the drama of wannabe actress.  Drop me a line on louise@rhymeswithpurple.net to join. 

And if you’re social media savvy then join me on Twitter @MsLouiseOliver and share the hash tag #NYCorBust

If you're based in Edinburgh or Glasgow you should come along to The Manhattan Project at Summerhall on Saturday 20th July.  Find out more about it and how to book tickets visit http://www.summerhall.co.uk/2013/the-manhattan-...

You might not be able to spare a fiver but you never know, you might have a rich friend who likes redheads who follows you on Twitter who does, so you know, every little helps.

story:
Short Summary

I am raising money to compete against other middle schools with my school band in Anaheim, CA this spring. This is important to me because it will help me me become a better player, and help me learn what it is like to go and represent my school.

What I Need

I need $485 to go on tour, plus money for food. If I don't reach my goal, I will have to pay the remaining cost for the trip, but every donation helps.

The Impact

Tour serves to provide a rich education for students at the highest level of our school's performing arts program.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also see me to  buy a See's chocolate bar that  I will be selling for $2 each.  The See's program is through the school's offical fund-raising, but this website is not through that program.  THANKS!

story:
Children of the Earth is offering a workshop based on "Pioneering Spiritual Activism: A Handbook for Young Leaders". 20 youth from around the world will be invited to participate in Spiritual Activist training. This  3-5 day training will convey all the processes gleaned from 25 years of work around the world by Children of the Earth. Young people are the engine of tomorrow's future. If they are to lead our world into the true global harmony needed for sustainability, then we must give them the tools to engage in positive change. Our youth leaders with an adult facilitator will offer this course of study for any group anywhere in the world. From this training these 20 youth will go back into their communities around the world and offer training to other youth creating a ripple effect. No longer disillusioned, disenfranchised, they will move into trust and hope that they can build a world with systems that bring forth peace on all levels. Their inner revolution leads to participants impacting social, economic and environmental evolution. Spiritual Activism is the thread that weaves all humanity together as one family.
 

"COE has changed my perception about life and taught me what L.I.F.E. is. It is Leadership, Integrity, Fellowship and Excellence.  I now have started M.A.D for children."

Mark Conrad, Philippines

"This training has given me a direction to which I can see myself and others living as one family of the one world within the sphere of love, trust, respect, unity, oneness and human dignity."

Jimmy Lama, Nepal

"I will always in remain in search of a peaceful nature and how can I use my talent and skill to provide inner peace in my self and how I can share that with other people, not only limited to my country. Children of the Earth is the forum that has provided me with the development of inner soul thoughts and initiating peace related activities."

Ashfaque Hussain, Pakistan 

"I believe "Spirituality" is the key to harmony and oneness. It is a way to overcome our fears, doubts and limits. Because spirituality to me, is reaching into ones divine self and realizing what life is all about. Like no clouds could ever harm or violate the sun, I believe that no experiences, thoughts or action could ever harm or violate the deep soul within. Therefore I feel it is our mission to reach out and awaken all the beautiful souls. And from there we can all start acting towards peace and oneness."

Yuka Saionji, Japan

story:
Short summary

I am a Canadian registered nurse who decided to go to Peru to volunteer my skills through the AMOR Projects, a non-profit oganization (EIN: 912094236). In my time there, I met Wendy. She is a local 18 year girl from the slums who showed an amazing drive to learn what ever medical skills I was teaching. She was in charge of patient care and running the pharmacy. The volunteer doctor agreed to train her because of her intense desire to learn and her excellent work ethics.

I was inspired to help her find a way to attend the local university to learn nursing. She would not have the opportunity to get an education otherwise as her family does not have the financial means. If we help educate Wendy, she will in turn contribute to her community, family, to the AMOR Projects and to herself for the rest of her life.

I believe in her. Please believe in her as well to help the community of Pucallpa in Peru for many years to come. 

The video you see here was made in Novemver 2012 during my visit there. It's a video put together by other AMOR Projects volunteers to help them realise a medical mission of visiting native villages and provide free medical care to the locals.

What we need & what you get

Wendy needs 150 dollars a month to pay for school fees and materials. The course is 5 years long. I have personally contributed 1500 dollars and she needs 6000 dollars more to obtain a Bachelor of Science in Nursing from the Universidad Alas Peruanas. The math: 10 months a year @ 150/month = 1500 x 4 years = $6000 + misc fees = $6420. All proceeds are being donated to the AMOR Projects, a tax deductable non-profit organization.

You can donate by using this website or donate directly to the AMOR Projects. If you choose to donate directly, please include "for Wendy’s education" in the purpose section of the web page. Either way, you will receive a tax deduction and a receipt. Furthermore, I will upload the university records to show accountability of funds.

For updates on Wendy's progress, visit the drop box https://www.dropbox.com/sh/vq2c6x1gg68ghuk/7bVV... 

I speak to Wendy regularly and we have a support system in place and multi-layers of accountiblity to ensure her success.

Meet Wendy and volunteer if you want! It's an amazing experience that I will carry with me for the rest of my life.

If we don't meet this funding goal, all the funds will be forwarded to the AMOR Projects. If Wendy does not meet her goal of completing her education, the funds will be used to buy supplies for the AMOR Projects to continue providing free health care in Pucallpa. 

The impact

This is my way of paying it forward as I was one of those people who was given an unforeseen chance at obtaining an education. One woman can educate and help others she comes into contact with.

As the saying goes, 'It takes a village to raise a child'. The education of our children is the task of community as a whole, not merely the province of the teachers and local school administrators.

Thank you for your compassion.

Other ways you can help

Get the word out!

Go to Peru and volunteer!
story_txt:
Short summary
I am a Canadian registered nurse who decided to go to Peru to volunteer my skills through the AMOR Projects, a non-profit oganization (EIN: 912094236). In my time there, I met Wendy. She is a local 18 year girl from the slums who showed an amazing drive to learn what ever medical skills I was teaching. She was in charge of patient care and running the pharmacy. The volunteer doctor agreed to train her because of her intense desire to learn and her excellent work ethics.
I was inspired to help her find a way to attend the local university to learn nursing. She would not have the opportunity to get an education otherwise as her family does not have the financial means. If we help educate Wendy, she will in turn contribute to her community, family, to the AMOR Projects and to herself for the rest of her life.
I believe in her. Please believe in her as well to help the community of Pucallpa in Peru for many years to come. 
The video you see here was made in Novemver 2012 during my visit there. It's a video put together by other AMOR Projects volunteers to help them realise a medical mission of visiting native villages and provide free medical care to the locals.
What we need & what you get


Wendy needs 150 dollars a month to pay for school fees and materials. The course is 5 years long. I have personally contributed 1500 dollars and she needs 6000 dollars more to obtain a Bachelor of Science in Nursing from the Universidad Alas Peruanas. The math: 10 months a year @ 150/month = 1500 x 4 years = $6000 + misc fees = $6420. All proceeds are being donated to the AMOR Projects, a tax deductable non-profit organization.
You can donate by using this website or donate directly to the AMOR Projects. If you choose to donate directly, please include "for Wendy’s education" in the purpose section of the web page. Either way, you will receive a tax deduction and a receipt. Furthermore, I will upload the university records to show accountability of funds.
For updates on Wendy's progress, visit the drop box https://www.dropbox.com/sh/vq2c6x1gg68ghuk/7bVV... 
I speak to Wendy regularly and we have a support system in place and multi-layers of accountiblity to ensure her success.
Meet Wendy and volunteer if you want! It's an amazing experience that I will carry with me for the rest of my life.
If we don't meet this funding goal, all the funds will be forwarded to the AMOR Projects. If Wendy does not meet her goal of completing her education, the funds will be used to buy supplies for the AMOR Projects to continue providing free health care in Pucallpa. 


The impact
This is my way of paying it forward as I was one of those people who was given an unforeseen chance at obtaining an education. One woman can educate and help others she comes into contact with.
As the saying goes, 'It takes a village to raise a child'. The education of our children is the task of community as a whole, not merely the province of the teachers and local school administrators.
Thank you for your compassion.
Other ways you can help


Get the word out!
Go to Peru and volunteer!

story:
iCAN, iWILL, iPAD

A Fundraiser for Dayspring Academy

 

Dayspring Academy is a charter school concentrating on high academics and the arts. Its mission is to prepare students of Pasco County, Pre-K through 8th grade, for high school, college, and for the work force by delivering a world class education through the arts in collaborative environment fueled by a passion for learning. In its thirteenth year of operation, it continues to be academically ahead of its class, continuing to perform as an "A" school, as has been done since its opening. With decreased funding and budget cuts, Dayspring Academy has organized and launched the "ICan, IWill, IPad" fundraiser. This program commits to and prioritizes the students' needs for user friendly, current and mobile technology in every classroom. "ICan, IWill, IPad", is a leveled sponsorship program using clever names that compliments the spirit of Dayspring Academy's charter.

How this Grant will Help:
This grant will provide students with the motivating tools to bring them into the era of technology and in turn increase learning. Students will no longer have to wait in line to use the single antiquated classroom computer. All students will have mobile access to a global community simultaneously to explore the world, new books, lessons, instructional gaming, all why becoming proficient using technology. Educators will use IPads to augment curriculum and increase participation with new, fun and engaging resources. With the IPads being portable, students will have the benefit of mobile data collection, utilizing outdoor teaching spaces, supporting cross-curriculum teaching, and storing and transporting information for all after-school activities. IPads will be utilized by the Artâ€™s in recording, reviewing and editing school productions, as well as in animation and graphic design. We will be able to impact our environment by using e-books and by using Ipads to administer all tests.


Getting this done would mean the world to our students and teachers. Can you help?
